description:
It's not even funny how many times I went there when I first discovered it. I used to come here like 3x a week- it was an ugly time for me. 

These are the desserts I've had:
- Thai tea mill crepe. This dessert came with a little container full of Thai tea sauce that you can pour all over the mille crepe that's already oozing with Thai tea sauce. 
- Sticky rice and mango bingsu. What I love about their bingsus is that they have different shaved ice flavors. This one was plain milk (I think) and it came with generous slices of mango. On the side, they give you small dishes with mango puree, condensed milk, nuts, and sticky rice that has a beautiful coconut flavor to it. 
- Strawberry cheesecake kakigori. This shaved ice dessert came with yogurt flavored ice, topped with strawberry sauce and cheesecake cream. It was crazy good and the flavors went well together. It also comes with a side of strawberry sauce and condensed milk.
- Melon bingsu. This one came in a melon that was carved into a makeshift bowl. It was filled with milk flavored ice and accompanied by spherical melon pieces and topped with a melon dome. It came with a side of nuts and condensed milk.
- Thai tea lava toast. I'm a sucker for honey toast- if done right and this was definitely done right. The pieces were toasted enough to be a bit toasty and crunchy on the outside, but it was soooo soft and pillowy inside. It's topped with lots of whipped cream and a scoop of Thai tea ice-cream. The real surprise is cutting open the toast box. A lava of Thai tea sauce spills out for you to absorb with your pieces of honey toast.

Service here has always been great and they're always patient when I can't decide if I want one dessert or if I want to pig-out and get 5 desserts. It's a bit pricy but what can you expect in San Francisco. Quality of the food and service makes me come back for more. In fact, I might convince my boyfriend right now to go here after lunch!
author: Alex D.

description:
Finally made it here after months of keeping it on my bookmarks. 

The two of us ordered the matcha float and matcha crepe cake, both of us were delicious and I'm confident I could have eaten double the amount despite our filling lunch. The line wasn't too bad around 4p and seemed fine when we were also exiting. They take reservations too, so do take advantage of it on yelp!

The match float had good balance of ice cream and overall tasted sweet but not in an overwhelming way. The crepe drizzle on top was a bit bitter due to the matcha but balanced well with the rest of the cake. There was a light spread of red bean paste across the dish and added to the aesthetics and sweetness balance of the cake. I was eating so quickly bc it was so good and wanted to ensure I ate the bigger portion. ;) a bit loud inside and felt slightly annoyed by the insta snobs taking endless photos within my peripheral, but I forgave them bc I'm actually one of them. 

I'd love to try the honey bread next time!
author: Juliana P.

description:
Thai tea brick toast 
Matcha lava cake 
Mango and sticky rice bingsu 
Pandan coconut crepe cake 
Volcano bingsu 

Dirty matcha: a bit too biter for me 

Nothing we didn't enjoy. Everything had the perfect amount of sweetness. I will return. 

Cons- after being seated for 15 minutes we gave up and flagged a server to take our order. She was friendly but could tell she was rushing and frantic.
author: Liz N.

description:
Solid desserts and cute interior but probably wont come back. We got the Thai Tea Mille Cake and the mango rice. 

Thai tea mille cake was delicate and the thai tea flavor was quite mild. Sauce is very much needed, but was still a very tasty dessert. (4/5)

I expected the mango sticky rice to have much more sticky rice. I'd say its more of a mango shaved ice dessert, which would be great on a hot summer day, but not what I was expecting, given the name of the dish. When it first came out, our party was actually worried we ordered the wrong dish since we couldn't find the sticky rice in the main bowl, which only had shaved ice. The sticky rice was actually in a small side bowl, and was quite delicious! I just wish there was more of it. (3/5)
author: Danielle C.

description:
You can see the craft, skill, and patience it takes to make a dessert here. The open floor plan allows patrons to see their orders being made right in front of their eyes and every order is done with care.

We ordered:

Thai tea lava toast - super rich thai tea-flavored cream filled inside a hollowed loaf of toasted bread, with bread cubes sitting on the cream. Topped with ice cream and whipped cream, garnished with a side of granola, fruit, and condensed milk. The bread cubes were super crunchy, lightly sweet and contrasts well with the thai tea cream. Sweet tooths - beware! Bring friends to share! Yes, multiple friends. A+

Igloos kakigori - new item menu! Shaved ice ala baked Alaska with sour mashed kiwi inside. Super good! The marshmallow layer gives a little bit of sweetness to the otherwise bland ice and the kiwi is a nice, tart way to end the dessert. A+

The service was impeccable. From the time we were seated to the time we left, the servers here were patient, knowledgeable, and super helpful. When the igloos kakigori came out, the server TOTALLY knew I ordered it for the Instagram-ability of it and waited patiently as I got my phone out. Thanks, homegirl! A+++++

One complaint I have is the size of the venue and the table arrangements. There isn't much space inside and the tables are very close together. Drop your gym bag, suitcase, cello case off at home because it's quite cozy inside.

Definitely coming back to try EVERYTHING else here.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening and luckily only needed to wait 20 minutes for a table of 4. I appreciate how efficient the staff was here by asking people in line what they wanted to order in advance and once you were seated at your table, your dessert came out within minutes!

We ordered the Green Tea Crepe and Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo. Not only was every dessert item Instagram-worthy, but it was also delicious too! The Green Tea Crepe Cake tasted like clouds and had a subtle sweet matcha flavor. The Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo was also very refreshing with the shaved ice and coconut pieces on top. Perfect for sharing and a great late night spot to visit after dinner. 

I was seriously in heaven and was wondering why I haven't visited this place sooner. For any guys looking for a good date night spot to take your girl, I highly recommend U :Dessert Story. They take reservations also, which is a major plus!
author: MyTien P.

description:
Dessert Story is a dessert cafe that screams basic and gentrification. Nevertheless, there are some yummy desserts to be had here. 

Aside from cute decor and interior, there is a nice variety of overpriced desserts here. Matcha lava cake, crepe cakes, shaved ice to name a few. While the crepe cakes were good, I think I've had better at Lady M. Overall, this is a sweet place for a date or whatever. Treat yourself if you're single kinda place works too. Whatever, we all love sweets.

Be wary, lines can get long depending on when you go. I was lucky that there was no line when I went, but I suppose I also didn't dine in.
author: Derek T.

description:
Usually I come to dessert cafes to destress. Unfortunately, all I got from today's visit was stress.

I came with a friend in the afternoon for what we intended to be a short break. From my first visit, I knew that U:Dessert Story's shaved ice and drinks were quality despite its higher price range, so I was pretty excited to be back. We order a strawberry kakigoori, igloo kakigoori, and two cheese teas. The teas and strawberry kakigoori arrive, all seems well. 30 minutes later, my friend's done with his dessert and no sign of mine. We try to flag down two waiters to cancel who say they'll get back to us. 10 minutes later, another waiter comes with what I assume to be news of the igloo kakigoori selling out when we say we want to cancel. No "sorry's" mentioned. 

I try to replace the kakigoori with another cheese tea for takeout b/c I'm haven't had anything but a drink at this point. Okay, they said, and two minutes later they hand me the bill. No sign of the tea. Another 15 minutes pass, and we finally ask about it again. Finally 5 minutes after that, my tea finally comes and we can leave. I don't think I've ever been so relieved to leave a restaurant.

Given that I waited over an hour for just two drinks and a dessert that never came, it was a big waste of time on a Saturday. A 5 or 10 minute notice about selling out would have been totally fine, but 30-40 mins? It doesn't seem like a lot of efficient communication was happening between the kitchen and servers, and all the staff seem strung thin due to understaffing. Honestly after this experience, I can't see myself coming back even if this is the only place that does kakigoori right.

Tl;dr: Waited an hour total and my main dessert never came.
author: Shela H.

description:
I read that the lines here are crazy. I came around 5pm on a Saturday and there was no line. 

I wanted to try so many things on the menu but at the end of the day, I limited myself to:

Thai tea crepe cake: This was good. The Thai tea cream is so good and has a strong taste. I do think that Lady M's crepe cake is better made but this was still good.

Mango sticky rice honey toast: I was really confused how this would be served. It was a deconstructed mango sticky rice, where mangos, condensed milk, mango purée, nuts, and sticky rice were provided on the side. Oddly, my favorite part was the sticky rice...IT WAS SO GOOD! The toast is good too, and I like that they are cut into cubes so that they are easier to eat. I definitely liked this more than the crepe cake...it's a lot more unique and better for sharing!

I was a little upset with the service. We waited a long time for our honey toast, thinking it was taking a long time to make. But then a waitress suddenly hands us a bill when we haven't asked for it. It turns out they completely forgot about our order. Everyone around us had gotten all their food and already left while we were still waiting. I don't know how you can forget an order when we only ordered 2 items.
author: Emily C.

description:
If you see incredible aesthetic Asian desserts posted in your friends' basic instagram feeds (cough also mine), chances are they're from U:Dessert Story. Thai Tea Crepe Cake! Mango Sticky Rice Bing-su! In terms of selection, presentation, and taste, I was incredibly impressed with this dessert cafe. Somewhat pricey for dessert, but I thought it was worth.

I've heard that the wait can be pretty crazy for this place a few blocks from Mission Dolores, so I easily made a Yelp reservation for my Friday afternoon a couple hours prior to coming. Easy-peesy. Though I would probably have had to do it much earlier for a night or weekend time slot. 

Everything on their dessert menu sounds good, but looking through the yelp pictures makes you want to try everything even more! My three friends and I made sure to get two of the most popular things on the menu though there were so many beautiful and delicious sounding desserts! We got the Thai Crepe Cake and Mango Sticky Rice Bing-su. Both were delicious and aesthetic af. 

The Thai Crepe Cake ($12) slice had so many light layers! Loved the presentation with even some flower petals sprinkled of the side. All my friends know I love whipped cream and this was so next level, especially with the thai tea sauce that definitely tasted like the traditional drink. 

The Mango Sticky Rice Bing-su ($13) was a great modern take on the traditional dessert. I loved that the bingsu ice was so light and airy. Some places have an uneven distribution of poured on the condensed milk/flavor on the ice but not this one. The fresh mango and mango puree was a nice touch on the side in case you want to keep adding extra flavor as you dig in. The rice on the side was so yummy I wished there was more! And the candied pistachio/almond mixture was non-traditional but added a nice sweet crunch to top it off. 

Overall: Was it pricey for dessert? Yes. 
Was it worth it? Hell yes. I think that places that add extra time to make delicious and distinct desserts with great presentation are definitely worth it. It's not like I'm going to go out of my way and take the time to make a beautiful cream crepe cake with a 20-something layers at home. It'd probably end up a sad one-layer mess of a pancake. 

Definitely make a reservation try it. I still need to make a couple more reservations to try all the crepe cake flavors!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
What an obnoxious line and one with a velvet rope at that! Their mango shaved ice/bingsu is good though. So, I guess I'll be waiting in that line despite all the eye rolling I'll be doing.

Not overly impressed by their dirty matcha--skip it.
author: Yad L.

description:
*Ursher Voice* "Oh myyy god"

If you are in SF and in need of dessert, you need to come here and give this place a try. Literally anything and everything here is worth ordering. 

Matcha Lava Cake:
The cake is super soft and chocolatey. The matcha oozes out and pairs well with the cake. 5/5.

Mango Toast with Sticky Rice:
So buttery, so decadent, so amaze balls. The mango dipping sauce and the uber soft butter bread cubes were tiny bites of nirvana. Even the pandan sticky rice paired well with the bread! 10/5!!

Matcha Float:
After having so many sweets, the matcha float helped fight all the sweetie goodness I was indulging in. The ice cream was very smooth and the drink itself was oh so delicious. 

Anything you order at this place will be delicious. No joke.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Crepe cake was SO GOOD! I LOVE IT! Both the Thai and the coconut ones!

However, the Toast fondue.....not so much....... that was a miss.

We came here on a weekday during lunch time and surprisingly we were the only people there. They have a really extensive menu, but we were only able to try so many.

I definitely will come back and try the shaved ice! It seems like one of the more popular dishes ( but it was cold the day we tried this place!)
author: Josie H.

description:
Truly felt so disappointed that I didn't like this place more because all the pictures on Yelp looked so good and I had high hopes based on all the good reviews. 

Finally found time to come in the afternoon on a weekday to avoid any crowds and ordered the popular strawberry yogurt cheesecake kakigori and mango sticky rice bingsoo. I may have higher than average standards for shaved ice because my husband and I have really had some fantastic versions on trips to Taiwan and Japan. I was unimpressed with the versions at this place. 

First, most of the thought went into presentation and not the actual taste. Both the bingsoo and the kakigori just had a very basic fruit purée and condensed milk on the side. Second, these just tasted very basic to me and weren't anything special which was a huge let down for the steep $13.50 and $14 price tag. The strawberry one looked awesome and was topped with yogurt cream but flavor punch was just not there. Perhaps there should have been a squeeze of lemon added to the strawberry purée to kick it up a notch or even basil to elevate the dish beyond just average. So many possibilities to be more creative here. I didn't know that I couldn't top off the dessert once it came to our table and poured all the purée and condensed milk on top. Then when we finished the top layer, I had nothing but bland shaved ice in the middle. Maybe they should have said to hold off on using the sides for the middle because it has nothing in the middle. The cheesecake chunks on the bottom were really gummy and strange. Definitely off putting texture which was reminiscent of cheesecake but not good at all. The mango bingsoo was only better because of the side of coconut sticky rice which was fantastic. Rest of the dessert was very uninspired like the strawberry one. It came with a granola which is typical of a bingsoo and was a nice change up of textures but again the flavor punch was just not there. The mango purée was nothing special and neither was the condensed milk. Interesting concept and very creative to pair it with sticky rice but it all looked way better than it tasted. Third, the more I tasted the shaved ice, the more off putting it was like there was artificial flavoring in it. I asked our server if it was plain ice or flavored and she said it was milk flavored but it didn't taste like milk to me. If anything, it tasted like soda flavor that you'd find in Japanese candy. Weirdly fruity and unnatural. Not my thing at all. 

Overall vibe of this place is cute and I absolutely love the concept but I'm not big on places only for the photo to post on IG. I want my food to taste awesome and this place just didn't measure up based on the shaved ice desserts we ordered. Maybe the other menu items are way better and I might consider coming back to try the other desserts but I would not come back for the mango bingsoo or strawberry kakigori.
author: Betty R.

description:
I've been here quite a few times and tried everything possible on the menu! Gotta say, everything has been very good with consistent quality.

Some of my favorites have got to be the chocolate matcha lava cake, strawberry cheesecake bingsoo, and surprisingly - the thai tea honey toast! Usually don't find honey brick toasts super appealing but they do it very well. Just the right amount of sweetness, even coverage of toppings across all bread, and warm and crispy toast!

The cheese drinks are pretty good as well but quite a bit overpriced in my opinion. I'd say pass on the crepe cakes (I know, they look super good! but eh). 

Service is good but they do get quite busy especially night time so they can be a little understaffed. Interior is super cute! Reminds me of Asian cafes in SoCal! But can have a few fruit flies flying around depending the day.
author: Mandy H.

description:
U: Dessert Story was on my bookmarks for so long. I finally made it out to the Mission District and forced my friend to make a stop here before heading back even though she was full. 

This a table-service restaurant. You are seated and a server brings you a menu. Luckily when we came, there was an open table. I eventually want to try everything on the menu because everything looks and sounds so delicious! I ended up ordering the chocolate matcha lava cake because I've had a crepe cake, brick toast, and bing-soo before.

Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake ($12): I had my slo-mo camera rolling, ready for the "lava" to ooze out of the cake. But it did not flow out at all (see my photo on yelp)! It just sat in its crevice, and I was disappointed and underwhelmed. I didn't get a nice picture/video for my food instagram :(  It makes me question how fresh my lava cake actually was. 

Despite the presentation flop (the plating was nice, though), it was delicious! The chocolate cake was dense (almost like flourless chocolate cake) and rich. I have a MAJOR SWEET TOOTH-its pretty bad. The matcha filling went well with the cake, and the green tea ice cream was yummy as well. My friend stopped eating after a few bites, and I felt obligated to finish the whole thing because I spent $12 on it. I made sure to hit the gym the following day. 

Everything here is pricey-enough that we didn't want to order more than one dessert for the table. The desserts are pretty much the price of a meal. Their quality almost makes up for the price. In addition, the service was very slow. Not so much the time it took to receive our dessert, but the time it took for them to bring the check and process it.

Regardless, I'd come back to try more desserts.
author: Megan H.

description:
I've been here a couple times now and this place gets pretty busy at night. It's a pretty good spot to get dessert, and one of the only spots in SF where you can get Korean/Japanese Snow Ice. 

During my visits here I have gotten the Matcha Kakigori, Strawberry Cheesecake Kakigori, Mango Sticky Rice Toast, and Thai Tea Crepe Cake. These desserts are great to share with friends and my favorite was probably the Matcha Kakigori. It comes with red bean, condensed milk, and matcha sauce, and the combination of flavors and textures was really nice. I also like how the sauce and condensed milk come on the side, so you can adjust the amount to your liking! 

If you do come at a busy time, service might not be the best and you might have to wait a bit to get your desserts but nonetheless, I would come back to try the other flavors they have!
author: Michael L.

description:
Impromptu Monday date night part 2 took place at U: Dessert Story. I love ice cream (and I bet you can extrapolate that I also love shaved ice). He doesn't have a sweet tooth and is not the best person to get dessert with. That said, we were already in the neighborhood and I've been meaning to try this spot for a while.

The shop's decor is super modern and cute. I just wish they would leave more than 8 inches between tables. Although I was able to slide into my seat when we got there, I wasn't sure if I would still be able to get out after a expanded belly from eating the dessert.

Like most of the others customers, we ordered Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu. I expected it to be like Korean mango shaved ice but it turned out to be more Thai influenced. Not only was it topped with roasted coconut shavings, it was also served with a side of sticky rice.

The serving size and sides were generous. But $17 for a dessert is something that would only fly in SF.
author: Yi Z.

description:
We tried the Thai tea crepe cake and Volcano bingsoo and they were both amazing. Bingsoo is shaved ice but it was very creamy - almost like icecream. 

They have an exotic collection of teas and beverages as well which I'm going to try next time.
author: Eshita S.

description:
We came on a Thursday night with a reservation and there was ample seating. The store is pretty small, but there is seating in the back. 

Between four people, we definitely ordered way too much, but everything was pretty good! We got the green tea lava cake, mango bingsoo, and the Thai tea crepe cake. Of the three, I thought the crepe cake was the most special, but the bingsoo was the most refreshing. The lava cake was my least favorite because the cake was overly dense, and it wasn't as rich in chocolate and matcha as I would have liked. 

I definitely see myself coming back, but be sure to bring a crew of people if you plan on trying a few things.
author: Sandra S.

description:
Reservations for Sunday 12PM and seated immediately. Service was good. Interior is small, cute, and clean.

Mango bingsoo - Must get! The mango was juicy and soggy. The ice was fluffy and light. This made a delightful balance in taste and texture. The sticky rice was good. Pour the mango puree on top.

Volcano bingsoo - Much more fun to see than to taste. Very light for a chocolate-inspired dish. Almost too light because it had chocolate dust, crumbles, and banana but none of the flavors stood out.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
It's so good it's so good it's so good!!! 

Sunday night at 7:30pm, the wait was about 30minutes for a sharing table for three. Stay parking was easy to find and the restaurant even easier. The decor has a fun quirky theme that is very similar to the dessert houses in Asia. The menu is a mixture of Taiwanese and Thai inspired desserts. 

Hollowed out bread loaf filled with syrup and ice cream soaked bread cubes. The plating is beautiful. I'm pretty sure my table spent the first five minutes just admiring how beautiful it looked. The Thai tea flavored dessert tasted so unique. 

Mango flavored snowy ice cream was incredibly creamy and fragrant. But my suggestion would be to eat quickly because we turned ours into a milkshake. If I came back, I would most definitely order toasted bread again.
author: Evelyn W.

description:
Came here around 8pm on a Friday, and there was only one group ahead of us and we waited about 15 minutes. Our order was taken quickly and we were seated at our table.

Food came out very quick, we got the thai tea honey toast and the matcha lava cake plus ice cream.

I would probably pass on the matcha lava cake.... but the thai tea honey toast was to die for! I want to try the mango sticky rice one next time.

Get the honey toast... you won't be disappointed!

Def would come back here again.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Mostly hipsters with poor language. I am all for use of profane language while I eat my cake but please use those words appropriately. That seems to be the crowd here, with an occasional family mixed in.
On a Monday night it can get crowded. Maybe even a line. The fact that you might get need a reservation is insane.

The service is wonderful and if not for the millennial hipster infestation this place would would be a great hang out spot for everyone. As it is now with it's current population it's obnoxiously overburden with attitude and a lack of graciousness.  

As much as I rant the real problem I have with this place is the dairy. Not much here for the lactose impaired! The menu is heavy with dairy and not very vegan either.
author: Ben M.

description:
I'll caveat this by saying I don't have a sweet tooth, but I was early to an appointment in the area and it was one of those days where I had an intense sugar craving. So, I stopped in for a treat.

The times I've passed by here there is usually a line out the door, and although there was a decent crowd around 2pm on a Tuesday, I was able to snag a high top seat in front of the window.

Because I typically do not like sweet foods, I asked the waiter to recommend me a few menu options that were less sweet and my attention was directed towards the Toast section of the menu. Because I love fondue, I went for the soft bread with triple flavor fondue ($12).

For a dessert at this price point, I was hoping to be blown away. The bread is deliciously thick and chewy, but the crust was a bit soggy around the edges (I saw them pop it in the microwave in the back while waiting). There are three fondue flavors: pandan, Thai tea and sweet purple potato. The sweet purple potato was my favorite, the others being too sweet without adding dimension to the overall flavor.

The service was also very, very slow, but I'll give points for the thoughtful presentation and plating.

If ever I'm in the area and the line is not too long, I may pop in again to try one of their other desserts since there seems to be great reviews for some of their other menu options. However, I would advise others in the meantime to skip out on the fondue.
author: Kimberlee P.

description:
After months of seeing pics and posts about this place, I finally tried u dessert story! It's a cute space that took over the old Ike's sandwiches. Thoroughly surprised on how big the space is. We came in on a Monday night around 7pm and surprisingly it was pretty empty. 

We were seated right away and we ordered mango sticky rice bingsoo and a young coconut pandan crepe cake. The mango sticky rice bingsoo was the star of the show. Perfectly powdered, fluffy and soft ice was covered with super sweet mangoes and some kind of nut topping. I love how they left the sauces on the side so you can decide sweetness. Bingsoo places in Korea usually already put the condensed milk drizzle over the ice. The condensed milk, the mango sauce and the sticky rice were all so delicious!!! Loved every aspect of this dessert! I would def order this again!  We then tried the pandan crepe cake and it was tasty, the coconut sauce in the side was really good especially with the pieces of coconut inside! The crepe cake itself had great flavor , you can really taste the pandan the only thing I didn't like was all the shredded coconut. Felt like there was a tad much. But overall it was a tasty cake.

I would definitely come back here again on a weeknight ! It seems to be less busy and the desserts are delicious! Next time I'll give the drinks a try as well! 

Total for 3: $28
author: Stella J.

description:
Splurge and try everything you can fit in your third stomach! Must try mango sticky rice shaved ice and coconut crepe cake. The satisfaction you feel when you cut down that crepe cake!! 

Pro tip: you can get this delivered to your door via Uber Eats
author: Angela T.

description:
I skipped dinner and happy hour and instead came here and spent $30 on dessert. 

Let me tell you, this place is worth it.... And I can't wait to go back because I didn't get to try the lava cake. 

The Thai crepe cake - like a Thai iced tea in crepe form... But better because the teas are always too sweet.

Earl Grey Lavender crepe cake... So good! Not too sweet, great texture, love the side of sauce 

Mango sticky rice bingsoo... Mostly good. I wish there was a better way to incorporate the sticky rice. It was just stuck on the side and I don't wanna eat plain sticky rice with a sweet dessert.... Like mango sticky rice by itself, the mango is on top of the rice and combined the rice blends the sweet and sticky rice together where it all melts in your mouth... here it's room temp in a bowl on the side and you can't pull it apart to save your life. Two of us legit had to strategize and throw in arm workouts and teamwork to separate it.

Moving on... we also ordered two drinks - the matcha latte (can't remember what my friend ordered) was good but too sweet. Same with the Blue Lychee - Wayyyyyyyyy too sweet. I wish you could tell them what level of sweetness you want like you can at boba places. 

Other than that, I love the interior, love the vibe, and staff were friendly.

As for you, Mr Lava Cake, I will be back.
author: Mandi W.

description:
I loved U :Dessert Story so much I came back twice in one weekend, and I'd do it again. 

Came with my boyfriend on a Friday night about 45 minutes before they closed, but luckily we were seated pretty quickly because the parties in front of us were larger. Ordered the mango sticky rice bingsoo (!!!), Thai tea crepe cake, and blue lychee drink. It was my first time having bingsoo and definitely not the last! Korean snow ice is SO much better than any other shaved ice dessert I've had. I like how they have toppings on the side so you can add as much or as little as you want. Only downside is that it melts pretty quickly so you have to eat fast. 

But omg, it was also my first time having a crepe cake and I FELL IN LOVE. I'm not usually one to fawn over cakes or pastries but the crepe cake was SO good. The second time I went that weekend I got the earl grey crepe cake, but I definitely prefer the Thai tea. It's light and not too sweet, and tastes just like Thai tea. Also comes with additional sauce on the side. 

The Blue Lychee drink was okay, a little overpriced at $7 for a blue drink that tastes like canned lychee juice with lychee popping boba. Wouldn't order it again, but it was pretty. 

Prices are a little high, but that's expected, since the presentation of the food is absolutely beautiful. I can gladly say that the desserts taste just as good as they look. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Cecille W.

description: Would have been a 5 star if not for the price. A bit over priced but in general very creative and delicious! Waited for 40 minute on a Saturday around 8:30pm. Not bad! Dessert items are well presented and they taste very unique and good! A good and maybe one of the first Thai dessert locations in the city. We definitely need more~ but should lower the price a bit.
author: Shirley Z.

description:
Berfdayz was the worst days now we drank champagne when we thirstayyyy ugh.

Nah jk this place is popular w frendo groups tryna "surprise" u w ratchetaz bday gifts n sh.

But we got the dessizzert n gtfo lol. Any of the bingsoo's (aka shaved ice thangs, haluhalu, etc) can be eaten walking around outside or in a car.

Guess how I know. #carlife #rideordie #notliterally
author: Dan B.

description:
Went on a Thursday night and there was no wait at all! I was so happy! I ordered 3 things: Soft Bread with Triple Flavor (Pandan, Thai tea & Ube),  Chocolate Organic Matcha Lava Cake with Matcha and Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo

I thought the Soft bread would have been a different type of toast but it was cubed soft bread with 3 different dips. The Matcha Lava Cake was yummy, the lava tasted mostly like chocolate and I couldn't taste the matcha as much since the chocolate flavor was overwhelming but in general it was soooo good just wished it was more matcha-y. My favorite of all 3 was definitely the Bingsoo, everything melted in my mouth and the mango was ripe and so sweet!

The waiter kept coming to check upon us and gave us water all the time. It is kind of small and this place is not meant to be for big parties and if you are planning to, then I'd recommend making a reservation.
author: Yenni H.

description:
I came here during lunch time and this place was pretty full. My boyfriend and I managed to get one of the last seats available. After we sat down, a line started forming and by the time we left the line was out the door.

We ordered the mango sticky rice bingsoo. Maybe we were full but this was HUGE and a lot. Between two people, we couldn't finish it. Maybe share this was at least 3 people.... 

I love how they give you additional condensed milk, mango puree, and nuts to keep adding to your bingsoo/shaved ice since only the top layer is drizzled with the sauce. As you keep eating, you can add more so you don't lose the flavor. The sticky rice was also pretty good. 

This is a great dessert place. They have many other desserts as well like crepe cakes. I wish I could've tried more but I was way too full!
author: Flora L.

description:
Wow, the presentation of this place is amazing! Even though the desserts are pretty standard, like shaved ice and cake.. this place puts a whimsical spin on them. Everything is just as pretty as they look in the pictures or even better. 

The coolest thing I've gotten here is the volcano bingsoo. Sadly, all the pictures I took didn't do it justice. It's shaved ice with chocolate toppings and dry ice spouting out of the middle. Would definitely get this again, but have at least 3 people to share! 

If you remember, I'd recommend making a reservation for this place. It gets crazy packed especially on weekend nights with a line well out the door. It's well worth the wait though!
author: Sandy Y.

description:
My friends and I came here on a Saturday night around 8PM and we took the last available table for 4 people. Eventually, there was a line of people waiting to be seated. So we made the cut, phew.

Each one of us decided to order one item so we can all sample each dessert.

Honey brick toast (5/5) - I'm not really a fan of brick toast because most brick toasts I've had were dry and hard to chew. However, this brick toast was really good, so I kept eating the square pieces of toast.

Chocolate matcha lava cake with match green tea ice cream (3/5) - I ordered the this because I'm a huge fan of match. However, the chocolate fudge was too rich for me to eat. I ate everything else but the chocolate fudge. The lava cake looked cool, but this dessert was too much for me. I would not recommend ordering this unless you are sharing this with 2-3 people.

Thai tea crepe cake (4/5) - The crepe was a little flavorless, but I did enjoy the Thai tea syrup.

Mango sticky rice bingsu (5/5) - This was probably my favorite dessert that we ordered. I really liked the sticky rice and the snow ice. I would recommend sharing this with at least one other person since it's a pretty large dessert.

Overall, the desserts look very pretty and Instagram-worthy, but I felt like the desserts were mainly hyped up and just okay tasting. Everything was pretty expensive. There's no A/C inside, so we were getting really warm from sitting all the way in the back of the restaurant.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
Not the best snow I've had, and it was also a bit pricey, but it was still pretty good, and I thought the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu was very unique! Loved the sticky rice and the extra toppings on the side it came with and it's definitely big enough for 2+ people. My friend got one of the crepe cakes but she thought it was way overpriced so I would stick with the snow to get more of your money's worth.

Came on a Wednesday night ~45 min before closing and there was no line!
author: Alice C.

description:
The deserts here are beautiful and delicious. The Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo is killer! 
The fondue toast is just okay.I didn't care for the ube or thai tea dips. However, the warm soft toast and the yummy pandan dip saved the dish.

Drinks are good too. Had the jasmine rose tea and americano. Would order them again.
author: Teresa S.

description:
Dessert night with the boyfriend after dinner next door! 

I came in last night for dessert and there was no wait! We got seated right away and I ordered the Thai tea crepe cake. Came out right away and the first bite was amazing! Not too sweet and lots of Thai tea flavor. The flavor kinda got boring because I was the only one eating it. 

The boyfriend is not a huge fan of sweets so we only ordered one item off the menu. I will be back though to try the bingsu and the pandan coconut crepe cake!
author: Elaine C.

description:
Mango sticky rice bingsu was the bomb!

We got Mango sticky rice bingsu ($13) for dessert. The portion was perfect for 2people. We got here around 7 on Sunday night and got seated after waiting in line for 20 minutes. The ambiance was very cute and hip. Service was great! This bingsu was so good and it came with condensed milk, mango syrup and pumpkin seed clusters. The presentation was on point and it reminded me of bingsoo I had in Korea!

If you crave korean shaved ice, this place is the one! I think it's the best bingsu place in town! I can't wait to try their crepe cakes next time :)
author: Clare L.

description:
All time favorite dessert place!! 

I usually go on weekday nights. The past few times I've been here it was pretty busy. We had to wait 15-20 minutes for a table, but it's totally worth it. They have cute decor and the employees are kind. 

I like to bring a few friends so we can try a bunch of desserts. In the picture, we got the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu $13, Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake $12 & Thai Tea Crepe Cake $12. It was the first time I had bingsu & U Dessert Story did not disappoint.
author: Jessica O.

description:
An overhyped dessert story for the foodie instagramers.

Thai Crepe
- This dish tasted warm and stale as if it had been left outside all day. The crepe barely tasted like Thai Tea. The only thing that tasted like Thai Tea, was the sauce on the side. The sauce was too sweet and too solidified. I would not recommend this dessert.

Matcha Molten Lava Cake
- The cake was baked almost perfectly, except the top was too thin such that the cake starts to collapse once you break into it. It tasted more like a chocolate lava cake and less so green tea flavor. It was also a bit too sweet. The worst part about this dessert is the ice cream. You can tell that they prescooped the ice cream and then stored it back in the freezer for easy retrieval. That caused ice crystals to form on the ice cream itself. Would not recommend this dish either.

Overall, overhyped and only looks good on the camera.
author: Eric Q.

description:
The atmosphere in U Dessert is extremely cute. The aesthetics here are very Snapchat and instagram worthy. It has lots of greenery, flowers and golden accents to make your dessert a cute experience. 

We came here on a Sunday afternoon and ordered the Thai Tea Crepe Cake and the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo. 

The Thai Tea Crepe Cake was delicious. It was extremely light and beautifully presented. They even had extra Thai Tea sauce on the side if you wanted more. The layers in the cake were precise put together with whip cream. It is a popular item on the menu and I would highly recommend! 

The Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo was so beautifully presented as well. It was extremely light and fluffy. The Bingsoo has a slight taste of coconut. If you don't like coconut, I would recommended to get another item. There is a mango sauce, pistachio granola and sticky rice on the side of the Bingsoo. The Bingsoo was filled with mangos and light drizzle of condensed milk. A fan favorite that I would also highly recommend.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Mango Sticky rice bingsoo was absolutely delicious - up there with the best desserts I have ever had.  The presentation wasn't as impressive as the volcano bingsoo, which was both a sight to behold with it's bubbling dry ice cloud of fumes, but it made up for it in taste.  Both desserts were very, very good.  MSR was perfectly balanced mix between sweet and sour.  Meanwhile, the volcano was sweeter with chocolately goodness.

My cousin lives in San Jose and we decided to meet up here for dessert.  A friend had been telling her that she needed to try this place.  If you follow me on Yelp, you know I have a sweet tooth and my wife and I are big on dessert.  There was a line of about 10 people when we arrived at 9PM on a Wednesday night.  It was obvious that they were used to having lines because of they way they handled the situation by handing out menus to the first 5 people in line.  There was a little pressure to have one's order ready once one reaches the front of the line, but it was understandable, given it's a small place and was completely packed with more people than places to sit.  Our party of 5 ended up sharing a long table with another party of 4.  We ordered our desserts and then we were directing into the back room to sit.

The portion sizes for what we ordered are large, so these are desserts meant to be shared.  We had 5 people to share these two desserts and it was still a lot!

I wish we had this place in SD.  There were so many other things on their menu that I would want to try.  Sul & Bean also has good Korean bingsoo, but this place takes it to a higher level.  Staff was super friendly and attentive.  One can tell that they take pride in their product.  Very cool place!

If you are in SF or you are visiting, I highly recommend you try this place out.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Solomon L.

description: Very disappointed that they didn't have cantaloupe Bingsoo. I don't like the tea pot which comes with large cup that make the tea get cold fast. Also my cup has cracked looked like hairline which not important to them when I told them:(( I wish they could better!
author: Tip S.

description:
I love this place!!! Their Thai crepe cake is the real deal!!! We also tried the matcha crepe cake and the match latte drink; my friends were not a fan of their matcha because it was a little too bitter (not sure if this is just us). They usually get super packed on the weekends, so I would go earlier to beat the crowd.  One thing which was disappointing was that they close at 10 pm which was super early for a dessert shop.

***********My overall ratings************
Taste: 5 stars
Price: 4 stars 
Environment & Cleanliness: 4 stars 
Service: 4 stars
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
Came here on a Monday night with two friends at about 8pm. It was pretty filled, but they sat us right away! I will say it was pretty hot inside the place. 

We got the Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake with Matcha Ice Cream ($12). The chocolate oozed out of the warm chocolate cake and it was really good. My only thing was that I could not taste the matcha at all, it just tasted like a chocolate souffle. 

We also got the Mango Sticky Rice Toast ($13). THIS is what I came for! I absolutely love mango sticky rice and this honey toast was a unique twist on that. I love how there were fresh pieces of mango! The toast was amazing (nice and crunchy on the outside, moistened with the honey on the inside). I do wish there was more sticky rice and coconut milk though. 

It was nice to balance out the chocolate flavors of the lava cake and the fruitiness of the mango sticky rice. Both were pretty sweet, but definitely a perfect amount for 3 of us. I am definitely excited to come back and try more things on the menu!
author: April L.

description:
Some say they have a sweet tooth. I have 28 of them! Came here for dessert before dinner to avoid the rush, so we got seated immediately. The interior is very trendy, which was no surprise to me because everyone comes here for the Instagram worthy picture. 

Ordered the matcha latte that was served on a plywood circle and decorated with some flower leaves. It looked like a work of art with the matcha slowly churning down towards the milk and ice on the bottom. It tasted like any other decent matcha latte, but at least, they used a tea whisk because there weren't any chunks of powder. 

Mango on the mango sticky rice bingsoo was so sweet that I wonder if they injected with sugar! Sticky rice had good texture and a mild coconut flavor that balanced well with the sweetness. Extra toppings were provided on the side to give it a crunch. All drenched with condensed milk. 

Impressed with the presentation of all the desserts. Although on the pricier side, the unique taste and careful design of each order made it well worth it. I will be back to try the other works of art.
author: Ronald M.

description:
I've always wanted to come here. Friends and I made plan (almost 2 months ago) but living in this expensive city, we were tight with works and gigs. We finally set out foot down and took a day off, just us and San Francisco.

It was a great day out then I realized (thanks to Yelp) that U Dessert was right in the corner of where we were at. Yay!

7.00pm on a Labor Day, we were afraid of the long line. I have no patience in me guys. The line were okay. Waiters were super friendly and active. 20 mins wait. Not to bad. Many ppl gave up so it was a bit faster than we had expected.

Ok. The food! They were incredible! We came bcoz of their beautiful Insta photos (they're good the social media marketing) and def stay for the food quality. Delicious! Eye catching! It certainly can make up for the long wait (waiting in line and took forever to have our food delivered). The atmosphere was pretty cozy and friendly. A cute dating spot (in the weekday). Y'all really need to check this gem out (^-^)
author: Bao V.

description:
This place is super cute and adorable..from the decor to the food presentations. it's actually a very big space but does get super crowded. If you're here in a big group, I highly recommend making reservation on Yelp. My boyfriend and I came here on Sunday at around 2pm and luckily got seated right away!

We ordered the Thai tea cake and mango bingso. Thai tea cake was delviois...loved that it wasn't too sweet. I brought half of it home and it was still good latern on. The mango bingso was also delicious. It was made from frozen shredded coconut milk...so good.!!!  Again, it wasn't too sweet . I will definitely be back to try the drinks.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Went here Halloween weekend and it was a full house. Situated where Ike's Sandwiches use to be and right next to Kitchen Story. The wait was worth it! I tried the young coconut pandan layered crepe cake (my fav as I loveee coconut and thorougly enjoyed the airiness of the cake and the coconut creme drizzle w/ tender young coconut pieces. I'm craving another one now) and mango sticky rice bingsoo. Can't wait to go back!
author: P C.

description:
This place is B.O.M.B! I would say this place is a mix of Korean, Taiwanese and Thai dessert? We came here around 9pm and this place is packed! there was a line to be seated. This isn't really a order and eat on the go kind of dessert place, so take a moment, get seated and enjoy to freshly served desserts here. 

I ordered and shared a sticky rice mango bingsu with my husband and it was plenty for the two of us. WOW! the fruit tastes sweet, fresh and ripe with four different toppings you can add on as you eat. Both my husband and I enjoyed our mango bingsu and would definitely come back here again. We are looking forward to trying to honey toast next time!
author: Nina Y.

description:
I came here around 9pm on Saturday night with a group of 4. The line was out the door but we were pretty eager to try this place so we waited it out. It actually didn't take too long to get in, so that was great! Do note that the line outside is a continuation of an equally long line inside. That threw us off hahaha.

We ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo, Earl Grey Honey Lavendar Crepe Cake, and the Chocolate Matcha Lava with Matcha Ice Cream (pictures of each dish below!) I'm really picky about desserts, but this place really knows what they're doing. My favorite was the bingsoo. It was SO refreshing & the sticky rice on the side made it taste really unique. The chocolate matcha cake was also very good, very decadent and thick as you'd imagine it to be. The crepe cake, which I was super excited to try as I love all things earl grey & honey lavendar, was actually not as amazing as I thought it'd be. The taste was a bit confusing - you'd think the 2 would compliment each other perfectly but I actually wasn't in love!

I do think the pricing is a bit high for this place. Their desserts are very tasty & aesthetic, but at the end of the day the prices are high for what they actually are. Still, definitely worth a try and I would absolutely come back!
author: Alice A.

description:
The desserts here are not only instagrammable, but also delicious! Came here on a Saturday afternoon and waited about 15 minutes to get seated. The whole place only sits about 30 or so people so I would not recommend coming during peak hours. 

They have a wide variety of asian desserts, but I knew I had to go with the mango shaved ice. The ice was very fluffy and it was the perfect sweetness with the mango puree and condensed milk. I also liked how they served it with some granola which added a whole new dimension to the dish. If I'm ever back in the area, I would definitely try the other desserts.
author: Patty L.

description:
Mango sticky rice bingsu!!
Very reminiscent of my ice cream dessert from chactuchak market in Thailand,  the bingsu was rich and light,  mangoes were ripe,  they had wonderful condensed milk and mango puree on the side.   My favorite part was the warm, salted,  coconut milk soaked pandan (?) Sticky rice and how it went so good with the bingsu. Everything was topped off with toasted coconut , super yummy

I can't wait to come back and try their other desserts,  I regretted not getting a matcha to go , o well,  next time it is!
author: Tina A.

description:
Care for some fine desserts? Then stop by this restaurant, stand in line, expect to wait, get seated, snap your IG pic, and indulge in desserts galore. 

We ordered three desserts: Mango sticky rice bingsu, matcha bingsu with red bean, and Thai tea crepe cake. If you aren't familiar with bingsu, it's pretty much shaved ice. However, the texture is smooth and melts on your tongue like creamy ice cream. The toppings are served on the side which include condensed milk, coconut crispies, red bean, and mango sauce. In fact, I really enjoyed the interactive experience by taking the sides and drizzling it over the bingsu. As far as the crepe cake, it's definitely an unconventional cake. The crepes are layers with whipped cream and produce a light and airy finish. In order to create this cake, it takes precision and tedious baking skills! 

Overall, an excellent dessert dining experience and I would definitely come back for some more!
author: Briana H.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!

Someone told me to check this place out because it was a new dessert cafe in the city. I finally found the time to try it! It's creative, it's decently priced, and most importantly - it's delicious. My friend and I spilt 3 items and I believe it was under $30.

BEWARE!!!
This place does get packed and the line can be crazy long! Try to make reservations if you can. If not, learn how to meditate while you wait in line. It took us about 20 minutes to get a seat and that was near closing time. Worth it, tho .


Sticky Rice and Mango Toast Box:
Be sure to bring someone you can share with (or just indulge yourself) because this thing is huge! You have a lightly honey coasted toast box (yes, it really is a box!) that is overflowed with ice cream, fresh mangos, and some whipped cream. On the side you have sticky rice, some condensed milk, and granola/nut bowls that you can add to your like.


Chocolate Lava Cake with Matcha Green Tea:
Honestly, probably my favorite thing there! Rich, moist chocolate cake with a warm, mild matcha goo oozing out. The green tea ice creek compliments the cake 
My friend and I both made a note that the cake actually tasted like chocolate and wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. 

Earl Grey Cheese Tea:
A very unique drink that combines the classic flavors of earl grey with a lightly salty twist from the cheese foam. If you are adventurous like I am, I recommend you try this - at least once! 

SERVICE:
Overall, service was great! You can see the servers hustling but they all managed to keep their cool and professionalism. Everyone was sweet and a delight to interact with. 

What I like about this dessert place was that even though there is a lot going on, you still manage to enjoy your time there because it is such a charming place. I loved all the deserts I tried because they weren't overly sweet! I applaud any dessert cafe that can balance sweetness with flavor instead of dunking gallons of sugar into the recipe  just because it's a dessert. 

Will be back soon!
author: Leya S.

description:
The desserts here are absolutely delicious! I had the strawberry cheesecake kakigori and the matcha ice cream lava cake. I loved both dishes so much! I especially enjoyed the strawberry cheesecake kakigori. It had pieces of cheesecake inside the shaved ice. It also had a layer of thicker cream/cream cheese on top, covered with a layer of strawberry syrup. The flavors were so great! I definitely want to come back to try some of their other signature desserts. 

I've been twice and each time it was after dinner. There was a pretty long line both times, so keep that in mind!
author: Hanna K.

description:
WOW. Just wow.

Came here with my wife on a Thursday night with no reservation. There was a line, but we got seated in less than 20 minutes.

Ordered the Thai Tea Crepe Cake, Mango Sticky Rice Brick Toast, and Matcha Macchiato. Spent about $35 before tip. All were DEF worth the wait and money.

The Thai Tea cake was a revelation and unlike anything I've ever had before! Who knew stacking crepes and layering it with whipped cream could make a cake? AND topping it with a Thai tea sauce? Perfection! The Mango Sticky Rice Brick Toast was the perfect combination of refreshing from the mango, and warm and buttery from the toast. And the Matcha Macchiato packed that bitter punch! Presentation was on point (see photos below)!

Would definitely come back to this hip and trendy spot to try more stuff soon!
author: Ryan M.

description:
The hype is real, and for good reason!! I usually don't care for sweets at all, but this place has such great execution on their desserts that I will happily be back soon

Split a matcha lava cake and a mango brick toast thing with two others and loved them both! The lava cake was insanely decadent in a good way, and the mango dessert was super complex. Such a wonderful combination of buttery toast, tart mango ice cream, crunchy almonds and a savory sticky rice to balance it all out. 

My friend mentioned that the matcha macchiato was something to definitely pass on however.

My only two gripes was that it was extremely stuffy inside the cafe, and the price for the lava cake was a bit steep considering it's size. Otherwise, see ya soon U Dessert!
author: Nicolette E.

description:
Solely based on the Mango Bing Soo which was BOMB DOT COM. Not sure if this is seasonal because of the mango, but pls let it be an all-year item. The mango pieces were sweet and fresh. Loved the presentation -- served in a bowl with surrounding side dishes (like banchan!) with extra mango sauce, condensed milk, the crunchy granola coconut mix, and some delicious warm sticky rice. 

The place is quite large, with seating in the back behind the kitchen. Despite its size, expect a long line on weekend afternoons. 

Usually I get a sick sweet aftertaste in my mouth with a lot of desserts, BUT NOT THIS ONE! Absolute go-to in my future.
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I bookmarked this place for a long time but Today I luckily have a chance to explore this place ! 
this is a small place but super cute decor so make reservations before you come!
The foods come out quite big and beautiful  but sweet so they place couples of plates and forks for us to share 
The service is beyond friendly and helpful! 
We definitely will come back!
author: Truc M.

description:
I love Asian desserts!  

Parking: There is free parking around the area. I didn't personally drive (Uber'ed there), so I am not sure how easy it is to park - it seemed relatively easy. 

Ambiance: The space is large and good for big groups. It resides on a quieter street (next to Kitchen Story). 

Service: The service was slow; however, I can understand b/c of the detail to the presentation of the desserts. 

Order: Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo, $13: It was so hot that day, which made it perfect to eat this. This dessert tastes exactly like Thai Mango Sticky Rice, and only difference is that it resides on a bed of finely shaved ice. :) It was super refreshing! The presentation was so beautiful as well - an Instagramer's dream! 

Verdict: 4 b/c while I liked our dish and extremely Instagram worthy, it's a bit pricey for me to come back frequently enough.
author: Michelle B.

description:
If you haven't heard of this place, you must live under a rock. I'm kidding, but seriously I see at least 1 post about it on IG every day. So finally I decided to give it a try on a rare hot Sunday in SF. 

IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!! I had high expectations and I was satisfied still (this doesn't happen often). 

We tried the IG famous Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo (shaved milk ice with loads of mango and sides of condensed milk, toasted coconut crumbles, mango puree and pandan sticky rice - apparently all the sides are organic too!), there were plenty of mango to last until you finish the shaved ice, and the portion was large enough to be shared by 2-3 people. $13.5, worth it! 

The Matcha float was too bitter for my taste (I wanted an ice cream float!)

The table next to us (2 girls) got the Mango Sticky Rice toast, Volcano Bingsoo and a dirty matcha  
Everything looked bomb! They were having a hard time finishing everything, I almost shamelessly asked them if they needed help  (keyword: almost) 

Tip: 
1) Come in the mid-afternoon (3-5) during the weekend and be flexible with where you sit (especially if you have a group of 4 or more)
2) Try a slice of the crepe cake (like a millecrepe), I saw them make it in house.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Matcha Chocolate Lava cake is worth every penny, It was perfect not too sweet not too bitter, soft and moist, the matcha ice cream on the side was smooth and silky, loved it!
The Mango sticky rice honey toast was not upto the mark, it was too soggy for my taste, I am not a toast fan but friend insisted and had it, not impressed.
Thai crepe cake was good too, tad expensive but good. For the matcha cake I can give it 10 stars, lol, it was worth buying. Recommend this place, its clean and very pretty. Service is quick too.
author: Lizz C.

description:
I would drive to SF just to get dessert from here! All the desserts I've gotten here were delicious. 

My favorite is the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu and the Earl Grey Honey Lavander Crepe Cake. I couldn't stop eating it!

The Match Bingsu was okay... and I love Matcha but it was a little too much after awhile and so was the Thai Tea Crepe Cake. The first couple of bites were yummmzzz but after awhile, I was over it. 

I really like the concept of this place. Usually, when i got to dessert places that have toppings, you eat all the toppings and then you are just left with the shaved ice and it's not worth eating anymore. At U Dessert you can keep adding as you go. So kudos to that! 

I usually come here after lunch and it was never really a long line for me. I usually get seated pretty fast. After sitting there for a while IDK if its the people I've been sitting next to but there is a foul smell. IDK but my only problem is there needs to be some air ventilation or work on the foul smell in the front where the table/bench is. 

Def recommend this place and the dessert is PRETTYYY
author: Christina T.

description:
This place is my happy place. End game. 

Let's consider the fact that I'm not a dessert person, but also the fact that I enjoyed every part of this dining experience (except for the long line and small space). My husband and I ordered 3 desserts, yes 3, because we wanted to make sure we could take a lot home! We got the Thai Tea Crepe Cake (fresh, light and not sweet at all - just the way I like it), Mango Sticky Rice Toast (game changer for me, not too sweet, light buttery crisp on crust and soft on inside), and Matcha Macchiato (bitter and strong). 

Service was speedy and servers were friendly! Desserts ranged from $12-14 ea. Sounds pricey, but was worth it!

Best to come in small parties (2 people), because the space is so tiny! Be prepared to wait in line, or at least use that time to digest your dinner.
author: Jazzica D.

description:
YuuuuMMMM!!!! Finally got to try this hot & new dessert spot with one of my friends. We were pretty full after dinner, but decided to share 2 desserts because, why not?! The first thing we noticed was the interior--so cute! They definitely transformed and expanded the old Ike's Sandwiches location. We got there around 7:30 pm on a Sunday and barely had to wait in line, but when we left around 9 pm, the line for tables was already to the door. People can stay and eat dessert for a while... so come early if you don't want to wait too long.

We ordered the mango sticky rice bingsu and the chocolate matcha lava cake. They both came within 10 minutes or so. I've never had bingsu before so I fell in LOVE with this. The shaved snow was sooo soft and powdery, and it completely melted in my mouth! I loved how you could add more condensed milk, mango puree, and granola topping. The "sticky rice" is almost nonexistent, and it's actually a bit salty (see the green rice in the pic), but it's a good contrast to the sweet snow.

The chocolate matcha lava cake was also really good. I'm not the biggest fan of chocolate, so I wouldn't order this again unless someone else wanted it. I wish it was a matcha cake with matcha lava!

Safe to say, we couldn't finish either dessert... LOL! I would love to come again to try more of their menu, like the thai tea crepe cake!
author: Tara A.

description:
Finally got around to trying this place and I have to admit, they've got some really yummy desserts! Seriously Instagram-friendly, which never hurts! The strawberry cheesecake shaved ice was amaaaazing. Lots of cheesecake pieces at the bottom. YUM! We also had their limited time rainbow crepe cake which was yummy as well, though a bit pricey!

We came in on a Friday evening and luckily there wasn't much of a wait. I have seen the lines here be pretty crazy though so be warned! The servers were super friendly and fast! 

U :Dessert Story impressed me, and I'll definitely be back.
author: Emily K.

description:
The line here (on a Saturday night) is ridiculous but since it's dessert vs. a full meal, the line moves somewhat quickly... It took about 20 or so minutes to get through a line of 20 or so people. 

I'm a sucker for crepe cakes, so I of course ordered the Thai Tea Crepe Cake. While it was good, I would love if they had a wider variety of flavors. Gimme a mango crepe cake please! :)
author: Charles L.

description:
My friends and I decided to come try this place since one of my friends said she's been wanting to try this place. I think we came at the right time because we took the last table before a line started to form. 

SERVICE: not much to say about it since we just got seated, looked at the menu and ordered our dessert. 

DESSERT: We each ordered a different item on the menu so that we can try a little bit of everything. We got the thai tea crepe cake, mango sticky rice bingsu, honey brick toast, and chocolate matcha lava with matcha ice cream. Here's a ranking of my most favorite to least favorite:

1) Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu - This was my fave because it was the least sweet of all four. The sticky rice was warm and it was so yummy! I like that they gave both mango sauce and condensed milk on the side for us to pour over the bingsu. This way we can actually put the amount we want ourselves. If I had only gotten the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu, I would've given this place at least a 4 star rating.

2) Honey Brick Toast - This was my 2nd fave because the toast was very soft and the fruits complemented the toast very well along with the ice cream. It wasn't too sweet either. 

3) Thai tea crepe cake - This was okay. The only thing I liked about it was the thai tea syrup.

4) Chocolate Matcha Lava with Matcha Ice Cream - I liked the matcha ice cream but the chocolate matcha lava cake was a bit too sweet for my liking. 

Maybe I'm just not into super sweet desserts so if you LOVE sweets, I think this place is a good choice. 

Overall, this is a cute little dessert place that is worth trying out. Their desserts are definitely INSTAGRAM picture worthy though so if you're a foodie IG person, check this place out.
author: Lydia H.

description:
Must get the mango sticky rice!!! The sticky rice is a warm green color sticky rice with a hint of sweetness. The shaved ice is beautifully shaven and soft. The mangos they used were so amazingly sweet (probably helps that it is summer and are in season ). I love that they put the extra assortment of condiments on the side!...genius cause we all know that one person will want this and the other person will prefer to have that. 

Do not get the Thai crepe cake if you are NOT a fan of whip cream because it tastes like whip cream between every beautiful crepe layer. It was awful. My friend and I took 2 bites each and we were already done after the first bite. We are not fans of whip cream...but the strawberries they used for decoration was super sweet. 

Next time we come we're going to try the dry ice dessert!
author: Jess W.

description:
I had to wait really long in a line, I am not sure if you can book reservations here

We ordered the Matcha cake, and it was delicious, the dessert looked SOOO Good!! Also this seemed like a really happy place. They celebrated someones birthday with music
author: Amar P.

description:
This place is the full package.  Modern / bright decor, friendly service, delicious desserts that aren't too sweet, and beautiful presentation.

After seeing multiple pics pop up on IG, I knew I had to try it.  Unsure of how packed it could potentially be, we got there 30 minutes before they opened and found that we were first in line.  I guess only dessert-aholics like me go at 10am.

When it opened, my husband and I seated ourselves at the counter as most of the tables were set up to accommodate groups of 4+, but the manager(?) told us to sit at a table so we could be more comfortable.  I thought this was quite kind of her.

Never one to shy away from indulging once in a while, we each got our own dessert plus a drink.  Here's a breakdown of each item:

Soft Bread w/ Triple Flavor Fondue - beautiful tray of soft bread chunks you can dip in vibrant hues of purple (sweet purple potato), green (pandan), and tan (Thai tea).  

Thai Tea Crepe Cake - fluffy layers of cake with a nice, well-developed Thai tea flavor

Dirty Matcha - great combo of coffee with matcha (unsweetened)

Earl Grey Crumble - Earl Grey tea topped with a creamy cheese foam and toffee bits.  Who doesn't love toffee bits?!?

Overall, great place and will definitely be back.  My favorite part?  I was very pleasantly surprised that the sweetness was moderate for every item.  I love that you can enjoy these desserts without crashing afterwards.
author: Sheila C.

description:
A unique little dessert place.  Nice garden like decor and colorful menus.  The desserts are artfully put together and placed on natural wood with the U story logo on most of them.  The presentation is so beautiful and definitely picture worthy.  And a place to try on special occasions because it's not cheap at all...  We ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo $13.50 - kinda wish there was more sticky rice, instead of the teeny spoonful and there were a lot of snow ice.  Matcha lava cake $12.50 - a cupcake size lava cake and a small scoop of matcha ice cream ( not worth the price) and a Matcha float $7.50 is good, with tax and tip, it totaled $40, more expensive than lunch!!!

There is a bigger table inside for groups of 8 and a gender neutral restroom.  Along side the entrance wall, is covered with the U story logo, a back drop meant for picture taking.

Overall, if you like artfully put together dainty desserts where price is not a factor, then visit this place.  Otherwise a unique place for a special occasion.  Worth a visit at least once.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I had some late night cravings for DESSERT of course and found a video of someone cutting open the matcha lava cake and I knew it was ova LOL! 
I even got lucky and found street parking right across the street. 

However, I knocked down a star because I didn't 
feel welcomed when my boo and I walked in. We were kind of just standing there for a minute because we didn't know if we had to order first or wait to be seated and the waiter that saw us come in didn't give us any direction or greeting either. On top of that, I didn't feel as if they were busy until after we finally got addressed and seated. 

As for the dessert, I was happy to see different options. Obviously I got the matcha lava cake and I don't have any complaints but I mean if it was bigger I wouldn't complain either LOL. My man got some matcha latte drink that he enjoyed so... overall I would come back to try something else if I was gonna be in the area again!
author: Roxanne A.

description:
Join waitlist they get pretty bussy at night. 
drinks were ok but dessert plates were mouth watering.
author: Rogeah Jeane M.

description:
Very cute new trendy dessert place! I passed by a couple times at night to see that it's super busy and people are all standing outside. So when I was nearby one Sunday morning, I had to stop by! 
Parking is street parking and it's always hard in SF... but inside is pretty spacious and there's a lot of tables. I saw there are also some tables if you walk to the back for bigger parties. 

We arrived just as they opened and there were already a couple tables seated inside. After we sat down, the place got full super quick. Because we had a pretty filling meal before, we decided to just order the mango sticky rice bingsu to share. The table next to us got the melon one and presentation was everything!! Made me want to order that one... But anyways the mango was delicious!!! Wasn't able to try the crepe cakes but I would definitely come back to try their other menu items. I can see why this place is so popular!!!
author: Kristie L.

description:
After eating some savory food, my friends and I were craving dessert so I searched for a dessert place nearby and found this little gem.

First thought when I walked in was this place looked a little bougie. It's cute, modern, and trendy. Damn...Will it be expensive? Then, I looked at the menu, and it was expensive. 

Second thought, this better be good for the price. Instead of making a run for it, we decided to stay and ordered.We ordered the matcha lava cake and mango bingsu. Third thought, the presentation looked great but does it taste good? After the first bite of the matcha lava cake...damn this ish tastes good. Go head and take my money, just give me moreeeee. The lava cake itself had a rich chocolate favor and it was soft and moist. The matcha lava was warm and the green tea tasted really good. Matcha can be a hit or miss, the reason why is - it can be too bitter or too sweet but not at this place.The matcha was well blended, sweetness with a hint of bitter and in every bite, you can taste the exquiste green tea flavor. 

The mango bingsu was definitely another hit item. The ice was shaved very well and fine. Mix that with some delicious sweet mango then it hits the spot. On the side there are nuts, condense milk, mango puree, and sticky rice. My tip is drizzle a little condense milk on top, add some mango puree and nuts then go in for a bite. YUMM decliousness. 

Overall, this place is expensive but it is quality dessert. The desserts are worth the buck. The desserts are good and they put in the time and effort to make it look pretty and taste good.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
Update: they've added an online reservation system via Yelp so you can make reservations now!

One of my favorite dessert places in SF! Yes it is more like $$$ than $$. And since it is a sit down place with service, you'll have to pay for tip as well so the bill can quickly add up, but so far everything I've tried here has been amazing!!

I've been twice, once on a Monday night and once on a Saturday, and let's just say I would recommend coming here during the weekday if possible. My friend and I were able to get seated immediately on Monday, but my group of 5 ended up waiting 30 minutes on Saturday night.

The restaurant decor is incredibly cute. For example, they have plants hanging in the ceiling. And it is larger than it initially appears, as there's a whole back area with tables/benches meant for larger groups. However, watch out as it can get very hot and stuffy inside. Both times I felt like I was burning up and quickly started shedding layers.

They offer a variety of Asian style desserts such as honey toast, bingsu (or snow ice), crepe cakes, etc. in addition to a good variety of teas and coffees. Most of the "main" desserts are in the $12-14 range, and expect to pay $4-7 for drinks.

This place was designed for Instagram, and they know it. Every single dessert I've seen here is perfectly plated in such a way to maximize its visual appeal, even regular drinks are served on a log tray with some flower petals. Fancy.

So far I have tried:

Mango sticky rice bingsu ($13): served with mango sauce, condensed milk, sticky rice, and crushed pistachios on the side. SO GOOD. My friend and I devoured this. The mango pieces they use are fresh and ripe (i.e. sweet and yummy). As a mango lover, I strongly recommend this dessert!

Chocolate matcha lava cake with matcha ice cream ($12): this was not available the first time I came, but they had it the second time round. It's very chocolate-y, though I think I tasted some coffee (unless it's just really strong chocolate) in my first couple bites? The matcha "lava" inside was delicious though, and had a nice but not too sweet matcha flavor to it.

Rainbow crepe cake with strawberry sauce ($12.75): this was a limited edition crepe cake offered only during pride week. The crepe cake was wasn't very sweet, as you're supposed to dip it in the sauce, but man, THAT. SAUCE. I was obsessed. If you ever get the chance to try the strawberry sauce here, do it!!! You won't regret it :D

Coconut crepe cake ($12.75): if you like coconuts, then you're going to love this! The crepe cake itself already had a nice coconut flavor to it, but it also comes with a coconut dipping sauce on the side for that extra oomph. Absolutely delicious!
author: Dianna H.

description:
What's my story? I am a dessert addict. My eyes lit up as soon as I saw Cherylynn N.'s post and thought.. I MUST GO ASAP. So I rushed my butt over 2 days after seeing her review.

.:: Sweets ::.
+Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake with Matcha Green Tea Ice Cream $12: placed on a bougie wood set. The chocolate lava cake oozed with matcha as soon as I cut in. The cake itself was not super sweet at all but had hints of bitterness. It was a bit upsetting though, the first plate they brought us the lava cake was smooshed and lava cake was leaking out completely. We were shocked that a place so dependent on presentation would bring out something like that. But they regained themselves when we asked them to make another one without complaint.

+Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu $13: bingsu resembles flakes of ice. i LOVE that they provide a whole side addition of mango sauce, condensed milk, and nuts because GIRL, it aint ever enough. Loved that it came with fresh cut mangoes. 

.;; Ambiance/ Service/ Parking ::.
Ambiance was quite the bougie hipster feels with well thought-out decors. 
Service was good. Again, just surprised they would serve a broken smooshed lava cake, but other than that they were very nice. Came around 7-8pm on a Friday evening and got seated immediately. 
Parking seems to always be bad in this area so my friend and I opted to uber here.
author: Chena N.

description: U: Dessert Story, more like I: Dessert Heaven! I came in here to try the the Thai Tea Crepe Cake- they were out and I can honestly say, I'm not even the least bit upset about it because everything else I tried was to die for! Seriously, check this place out if you're in the SF area, it's worth a visit! The deserts are rich but not heavy and the staff is oh so sweet too!
author: Rita H.

description:
I'm not a big dessert person, but I must say this place is amazing. I came with a party of 5 on an early Friday evening and just beat the rush. I saw a line out the door the remainder of my time there. Our orders came out fairly fast and I was impressed by the presentation of all the sweets. We ordered:

Coconut crepe cake
- tasty and not too sweet

Mango bingsoo
- comes with extra toppings and a small side of sticky rice. The final display is picture worthy

Bread Fondue
- comes with 3 dips: Thai tea, Ube, and pandan
It's just cubes of bread, but it was a fun experience
author: Vega T.

description:
There's nothing more exciting than dessert. I've always been on the hunt for this type of place in San Francisco and here it is. The first time I had Binsoo was in Los Angeles, but now finally can get it up here in SF. I came here with a friend who came from New York in seeking out tasty dessert after dinner. Luckily, we met during the week so it was not too crowded, but we still waited in line. 

FOOD: Mango Binsoo. Oh man. It tastes just like what you would imagine shaved ice with mango on it. It definitely is a might tasty dessert that can be split among two people, so it's definitely a nice date spot. 

SERVICE: Great! 

Also, is the Colon intentional to get a smiley face? It's genius. You'll see me back at U :Dessert Story soon!
author: Albert H.

description:
My friend and I went here around 5:30p on a weekday, and were seated immediately. The interior is beautiful and on the smaller side, but there were several empty tables. We ordered the young coconut pandau crepe (yum!) and matcha shaved ice with red bean. They both were beautiful and tasty but had different flavor profiles. 

The crepe was lightly sweetened but creamy; really excellent dessert. The shaved ice was good too but lighter and not super sweet.
