Good service. Highly recommend. On the pricier side, but worth it!
author: Thu P.

description:
Being a hype recently with lots of nice pic from friends, we decided to give this place a try. However it didn't quite meet our expectations.

Food: 
1) matcha lava cake - so good! The cake is so warm and the matcha sauce melts from inside. However the chocolate taste of the cake is kinda heavy that I can rarely taste the matcha. 
2) mango sticky rice bingu - average. Not outstanding.

Price: quite pricey - we paid ~$30 in total for the 2 desserts, when they're not outstanding

Hygiene: this is where the 3 stars from. We were seated on a table that with gaps between wood stripe. We saw all the diets and food that got pushed into the gaps - I almost wanna puke by just siting there...
In addition, their menus look so dirty and wrinkle. Given that they're a new dessert place (I think?), I can't tell how they treat their food when the menus are like that..."

Service: servers are nice, but we can tell that they're quite busy and probably not attentive enough. We lined up in front of a 5 party group and were sat with them on a same table, which is totally fine. But then when we ordered the same mango bingu (we ordered first and lined in front of them), the server gave it to the 5 party first, and we waited for another 10 mins for ours, which make us felt a little disrespected, especially the line wasn't short that we waited for a while, and it wasn't comfortable sitting there as mentioned above. 

In short I will not come back for a while.
author: Yuen Yung L.

description:
I'm always down for some aesthetically pleasing desserts so I was SO excited to see this place open.  The interior is very cute and photogenic, ideal for an afternoon date~  I absolutely love the plants in the ceiling and windowsill.  Very cute touch and totally reminded me of the cafes I frequented in Korea.

I've come here a few times, and I've had the pleasure of ordering the Thai Tea Crepe Cake, the Matcha Lava Cake, and the limited edition rainbow crepe cake during SF Pride week. 

Thai Tea Crepe Cake: My favorite! That thai tea sauce it comes with captures thai tea so perfectly without overdoing the sweetness. Love love love this cake. It's light and not too sweet, but satisfies any dessert cravings~

Matcha Lava Cake: Like chocolate? Like matcha? This is the dessert for you.  As I'm not the biggest chocolate fan (one of the few in the world), this wasn't my favorite BUT I can acknowledge that I still thoroughly enjoyed this dessert. The different textures were so enjoyable with the moist chocolate flavor in the center of the cake, and paired so well with the liquid matcha sauce. It was rich and packed with chocolatey goodness.

Rainbow Crepe Cake: Get that strawberry sauce on the side if you get the chance! So yummy and fresh tasting! The cake had the lovely light texture similar to the thai tea crepe cake, and was beautiful but aside from the exterior, wasn't as unique in flavor.

FYI: The cakes slices are not too big, so although I shared all my desserts, I totally think you should order more than one if you plan to share! 

Although it's quite pricey... it's still hands down my fave dessert spot and looking forward to trying their bingsoo in the future! 

P.S. their cheese teas are also good, but not sure if worth that $6+ price tag..
author: Tina T.

description:
How can you say no to aesthetically pleasing and delicious desserts? The owner and staff here are also incredibly humble and friendly. This is a typical sit down spot, and we asked if it was alright for us to stay longer to study and do some work, and they were really nice about it (though my friend and I didn't actually end up staying to study, but knowing that this was an option is nice). 

This place is pretty spacious -- front area has smaller tables, but there's also the back area with more tables for seating as well. Cute cute cute decor, especially the ceiling lights. I'm such a sucker for these type of places. 

Onto the food: Only tried the mango shaved snow ice and the Thai tea crepe cake, and both were delicious. I'm also somewhat biased for mille crepe cakes, so it was nice they had a Thai tea flavored one! The sauce on the side added the Thai tea taste that I love. Mango shaved ice is also served with other toppings, such as more sugar sauce and also what I thought was some sticky coconut rice and crunchy bits. 

Yes it was pricey, but then I think we are also paying for the prettiness and the art, sooo will probably be back some day!
author: Sara T.

description:
I am a huge fan of Asian desserts and pretty stuff, and this place has both. I got the mango sticky rice with Korean shaved ice, and was very impressed with the amount of mango that was in it. Felt like an entire mango and tasted like a step above your typical Asian dessert. In this case, the higher price reflected a higher quality as well!

I am impressed by how they cater to the Instagram community. Everything is so instagram-able, there is even a backdrop on the wall for photo-ops. 

The downside is the spacing between the tables because it makes me feel stuffy and uncomfortable. If the place were more spacious, it would be perfect and I would come more often.
author: Andrea T.

description:
So glad we came on a Tuesday night! We arrived shortly before the after-dinner rush and only waited about 10 minutes. The line was out the door by the time we left. 

This is one of the newest, trendy dessert places to open up in the city so expect a long line. Oh, and the desserts and drinks are Instagram-worthy? That means even longer lines. 

The menu is a fusion of Thai, Korean, and Japanese which is pretty cool. We each ordered a cheese tea and opted to share the mango sticky rice bingsu - glad we shared because the portion is perfect for 2. I highly recommend trying the bingsu! We enjoyed all the toppings and it was a nice treat for the rare, warm-ish SF night. We can't wait to come back and try their other offerings!
author: Olivia V.

description:
If I started a cult, U : Dessert Story would be my headquarters. All of the other cult members would be just like me -- pre-diabetics who love brightly colored tea lattes and understand the importance of getting just the right shot before digging in with their spoon. They also would know the importance of ordering a different menu item so we can all share -- yep, I'm in the sharing is caring cult.

Everything about U: Dessert Story brings me joy and happiness from the sunshine pouring in through the windows, white subway tiles, to the bright green ferns clinging to their ceiling. The atmosphere is friendly and our server seemed so excited to serve us and bring out the avant garde dessert platters to our table. Even the other restaurant patrons are super friendly swapping tips on their favorite items and recommendations on what to get. 

What I wanted to order was: the matcha lava cake, matcha cheese latte, earl gray latte, butterfly pea latte, mango sticky rice honey toast, coconut pandan crepe cake, rainbow crepe cake, triple flavor fondue (with matcha, taro and thai tea, and strawberry cheesecake bingsoo ...

but I had to check myself and instead ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Honey Toast and Matcha Cheese Latte.

The Matcha Cheese Latte had a mellow grassy flavor with a bit of salty, sweet, creaminess added in. 

The mango sticky rice had all of my favorite things in it...ice cream, whipped cream, mangoes...carbs and even more carbs! I loved the little crunchies and how you can choose your sweetness level by adding mango sauce and condensed milk to the top.

I have found my happy place!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
10/10 would get the matcha green tea cake with matcha ice cream 

Service and everything is 5 Stars. The line was long but the workers were persistent on getting us seated, esp. 20 minutes before closing! 

My boyfriend rated the Thai tea crepe 7/10. It's mushy and tasted like a softer marshmallow in your mouth.
author: Jazzie D.

description:
I desperately wanted to like this place after seeing all the aesthetic photos on social media (i.e. Instagram), but I was disappointed. I think I was even more disappointed because I've had such an amazing experience at Kitchen Story. 

I had this place bookmarked, so when I came up to SF for a visit, it was the #1 spot I had to go to. Four of us shared two dishes - Thai Tea Crepe Cake and Matcha with Red Bean Kakigori, which was a perfect amount after dinner. 

The disappointment was primarily the Thai Tea Crepe Cake. For a $12 slice of cake, I expect it to be the best slice of cake ever, especially because the more well-known Lady M crepe cakes are around $9/slice. Unfortunately, this not only could not compete in flavor, the layers itself tasted rather soggy and unappetizing. 100% would skip this dessert since it's definitely not worth the taste and price.

The Matcha with Red Bean Kakigori was a lot better than the crepe cake, but the matcha sauce came out rather clunky and unevenly in comparison to the condensed milk. It was rather hard to pour onto the kakigori, so I can see why it was placed on the side. The red bean tasted super authentic, and was definitely a highlight of this dessert. 

In my opinion, skip this place and just dine at their other restaurant, Kitchen Story, next door. The desserts are beautiful here, but the taste is subpar.

Also, on a last note to management, being seated next to the bathroom was very unappetizing for our party. I'm not sure how to counteract this, but the strong wafts of bathroom odor weren't very pleasant while eating. It made my party eat rather quickly to just get out of the smell. Service was also very rushed - I understand that it was busy, but after seating us, a waiter came over twice within 5 minutes asking if we were ready to order.
author: Bradford L.

description:
Finally gave this spot a try!!!!! We had the earl grey crepe cake and the lava matcha cake along with a dirty matcha. Everything was pretty good! 

I liked the crepe cake better as it wasn't overly sweet but still very lavender-y and my boyfie liked the lava cake more because it was so rich and fudgey!

I also loved the dirty matcha and it was actually not super sweet. I don't usually drink coffee but if I were to crave an iced coffee ever in life, this would definitely be the one to set the standard. Not too sweet, not too milky, not too acidic, just perfect! 

I want to try the other crepe cake flavors next time along with the bingsoo! The bingsoo looks pretty big so I would save that for a time where I didn't want to try the cakes or had more people with me.

The presentation was super cute and we used Yelp to make a "reservation" but I was able to check in earlier than the Yelp time and snag a table within 15 mins of waiting. I havent enjoyed dessert in such a long time and this was extremely satisfying and I felt very happy leaving.

Thanks for reading my dessert story ^^
author: Samantha P.

description:
A bit overpriced, but you come here at least once for the Instagrammable desserts right?  U Dessert Story really reminds of me of NYC's Spot Dessert Bar, but a lot better in terms of aesthetics.  The desserts aren't top notch in terms of taste (and I expected that going in), but they do look pretty.

So I came here on a Saturday evening, I would definitely recommend having an early dinner if you're looking to come here for dessert as the lines are still crazy busy.  I came here about 7:30pm and the line wasn't too bad, we got in fairly quickly.  However, when we left, the line had more than doubled in size.  

The inside of this place is really warm, they only have some fans running, but they don't help a whole lot.  Also, they kept tripping their circuit breaker, I lost count of the number of times this happened (often times happening multiple times within minutes of each other).  Hopefully, this gets fixed in the future.  The service here is great though, our table was checked upon constantly for water and just how our meal was going, it was above average for such a busy place.

Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake:
At $12 this was probably this one seemed questionable for the price.  It was on the small side.  It had a nice oozing matcha filling and was quite rich in matcha and chocolate flavor.  If you're really into either of these, then this dessert is for you.  Probably one of the richer items on their menu.

Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu:
A little lacking in sticky rice.  Overall good, but the actual mango chucks could have been better.  Back to the sticky rice though, it only came as a side topping with no sticky rice inside the shaved ice initially.  The sticky rice was good but didn't taste fresh as it was only room temperature.  The shaved ice had a lighter taste.  Out of the 3 desserts I tried, the consensus was that this one was the least enjoyed.

Strawberry Yogurt Cheesecake Kakigori:
Probably the best of the 3.  I haven't seen Kakigori in the Bay Area yet, most of what we have here is Taiwanese style shaved ice.  It was great to have some Kakigori.  Overall, it was very delightful, especially if you like yogurt.  The only bad part about this was the unexpected chunks of cheesecake bites at the bottom of the shaved ice.  This would have been better off as a side topping like the sticky rice.  The problem here was by the time you reach the cheesecake, you're already full. And given that cheesecake is the densest part about this dessert, you'll likely have no desire for it, not to mention that it also tastes rather cheap like the cheesecake bites you see at froyo stores.

U Dessert Story brings some nice trends to the table with great aesthetics.  If you do any research on this place, you'll likely know what you're getting into.  It's still a great place to grab a dessert, though it is pricey.  Just know what you're getting yourself into.
author: Bryson L.

description: I saw this on my friends Instagram and had to try it myself!!! It's super delicious if you have a sweet tooth. It was so yummy that we ordered more after for home (not pictured).
author: Alison B.

description:
We've been here twice this week and it's a definite favorite. They serve such great tasting and beautifully presented desserts, in addition to coffee or tea options. 

Thai Tea Crepe Cake ($12) - so good and light, not overly sweet. Comes with additional thai tea sauce that you can add more if you prefer. 

Fondue - Thai Tea, Pandan, Ube ($12) - soft white bread that comes with 3 different dipping sauces. The pandan one was a favorite. 

Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo ($13.50) - this was the definite hands-down favorite! while all the desserts were good, this was so refreshing light and tasty. Comes with the sticky rice, condensed milk, mango sauce, and crunchy bits to add to your preference. 

Organic Matcha Kakigori ($14) - matcha shaved ice with red bean and mochi on top. Comes with additional matcha sauce and red bean. 

Chocolate Organic Matcha Lava Cake with Matcha Ice Cream ($12.75) - chocolate cake with matcha lava that flows out once you cut into the cake. The cake was very good, but rich.

Young Coconut and Pandan Crepe Cake ($12.75) - light and refreshing cake, comes with additional coconut sauce. 

Service was great, everyone is very friendly and accommodating. It definitely gets busy and reservations would probably be a good idea, especially if coming on a weekend. Great to come with a group so you can order more things to try. Would definitely return!
author: A W.

description:
Is there a place that could be hyped more than this spot? To be honest,y I never knew this place ever existed, but thank goodness to my friends that told me about it. We got there at what seemed to be the perfect time (830pm on a weekday) and grabbed seats right at the bar. However, the line went out the door as soon as we sat down. 

What we got:
- Earl Grey Mille Crepe Cake: Like Lady M, just as pricey ($13?). Layers on layers of crepe turned into a perfectly not too sweet dessert. Comes with extra earl grey cream if you're a sauce boss

- Matcha chocolate lava cake with ice cream: Think chocolate lava cake with green matcha? chocolate flowing out. Interesting take on the standard chocolate lava cake. Sweeter than the other desserts, but still spot on

- Mango toast with dipping sauces: Holy crap this one takes the cake. Love what they did to the standard brick toast with cubes of toast inside. There are three things to dip your bread in, plenty of mango to go around, and not too much stomach space left after eating this dessert. Definitely worth a try.

This place can get busy, so be prepared to wait. Definitely worth a try if you're in the area!
author: Andrew C.

description:
The prices are more pricey than I'd like, but the desserts are tasty and pretty. 

I got the mango sticky rice bingsu and it was amazing. It came with a couple of sides, but I think the gamechanger was the granola. I never thought granola and bingsu would be so good together, but it was perfect. Definitely share this with someone because it's too big to eat solo.

Can't wait to come back and have the mango bingsu again!!
author: Alexis T.

description:
U:Dessert...I contemplated the name and came to the conclusion that it must be some sort of analogy.
For instance, as an apple: banana//you: dessert. Just as an apple goes with a banana, you go with dessert. Do I get anything for making this observation?? Just kidding, I might be totally wrong.
But regardless, so many people have been frequenting U:Dessert that it's becoming some sort of trend. Although I don't have an Instagram, people are supposedly posting tons of photos from this dessert joint AND now I'm even hearing about the place through word-of-mouth. To prove the effectiveness of these unintentional marketing techniques, I can testify to the fact that a new party came in every five minutes while my friend and I were at U:Dessert...it was packed and insane. The workers seemed a little overwhelmed by the popular demand. It seems like the prices have gone up overtime as well. The laws of supply and demand...

Anywho, we ordered one of their famous and expensive desserts (I thought it was originally $12, but it is now $13.50): Chocolate Molten Lava Cake with Green Tea Ice Cream. It was f****** tiny, but f****** amazing.

I felt ripped off when I saw the tiny cup of a cake, tiny scoop of ice cream, and single strawberry cut into two pieces...wtf. But I have to admit, all the flavors were on point and everything was fantastic. The cake was slightly crunchy but moist/gooey on the inside. The green tea "lava" flowed out magically onto the flat plate. The green tea ice cream was amazing--not your Americanized version of it. The toffee bits beneath the ice cream supplemented the ice cream perfectly. Even the Whip creme with the single strawberry was delicious...

Other than the Molten Lava Cake Dessert...idk what to talk about.

It just gets REALLY CROWDED and busy...
author: Christine H.

description:
The cafe, if I may call it that, was dimly lit, with dark wooden accents. It was a quiet weekend afternoon and the space provided much tranquility especially with the green plants strewn across the ceiling. It was small for a restaurant, but then again provided a few tables to accommodate groups of 1-4. I think that's why some reviews say the cafe is small while others call it spacious.

I came with 4 girlfriends and shared the Thai tea crepe cake. The presentation as you can see in the photo, was whimsical and fairy-like, much to my friends' liking. The texture of the cake was soft and spongy with the various layers congealed together as one. I couldn't really differentiate the layers, although that may have been the plan all along. It was sweet but not too much so, and the dipping sauce strengthened the thai tea flavor. I personally like the more airy texture to cakes and would have preferred a crispier texture.
author: Cici T.

description:
Very appealing presentation desserts, comes with an expensive price tag. 

I think almost every dessert cost more than $10, drinks are at least $5. I got the sticky rice bing soo, it's interesting they give you little toppings on the side tht u can add into your bing soo, the mangos are sweet, loved the coconut flakes. But is it worth $12? No........

The matcha lava cake is good but wished the cake itself is warm, because it was room temperature. Loved the matcha inside the cake. Also $12... 

Overall, definitely worth a try but not practical to spend over $20 for 2 desserts. Also this is a sit down restaurant, so you have to tip. We almost spend $30 just for 2 desserts. They need to change the price tag to $$$ instead of $$ imo.
author: Debbie D.

description:
U: Dessert Story serves mouthwatering delicious desserts that are trendy and Instagram worthy. 

I went here on a weekday after dinner with my family for a much needed treat after a long day. There was no line and we only had a wait about 10 minutes for a table to open up. The service was excellent and quick. After going through a bunch of yelp pictures we got the earl gray crepe cake and the mango shaved iced. 

Early gray cake- light cream sandwich between layers of thin crepe. The early gray flavor was perfect, flavorful but not over powering. The crepe cake was soft and fluffy, melts instantly in your mouth. The sweetness was perfect for me. The cake comes with a creamy condensed milk type of syrup. The syrup is perfect if you want it sweeter. 

Mango shaved ice - OMG!!! I have to say this is the best shaved ice I have ever had. The ice is sooo fluffy and melts instantly in your mouth. It is not the flavorless, chunky ice that you get elsewhere. The shaved ice actually taste creamy! I honestly didn't know ice can taste soo good. The shave ice comes with purple sticky rice, granola, and this creamy syrup. Everything went perfectly together and taste absolutely delicious.

The verdict: If you like sweets and is willing pay more than $10 for an item, you must try this place. The quality of the desserts are outstanding. You can choose anything from the menu and will not be disappointment. It may be a bit pricey but it worth every penny.
author: Sunny L.

description:
This place is awesome.

There is a wait, come early and put your name down on the list.

The food is amazing. We ordered a matcha green tea latte and the matcha chocolate lava cake. Both were amazing.

MGTL: creamy, matcha-y, cold and fulfilling. Love the presentation.

Lava cake: ORDER THIS if you love chocolate and matcha. The warm oozy cake mixed with cold matcha ice cream is to die for. I loved it! 

Service is impeccable. Many folks running around to serve and, it was my birthday so, they have a song and dance they sing to the birthday person! (A surprise, the boyfriend had asked them to place a candle in the cake.... not only did they do that, they came out with drums and the whole crew sang happy birthday). So, a warning, don't ask for a candle unless you're prepared for some song and dance :)
author: Karen H.

description:
Came on a Friday night around 9pm. It's really a cute dessert spot, the interior design is really done up. The wait wasn't too bad. they have two sections of seating in the front and back. 

We ordered the chocolate matcha lava cake- it had a small scoop of green tea ice cream. It was really good. At first I didnt taste the green tea inside the brownie and even thought that the chocolate would overpower the green tea, but it didn't! it sinks in and really rich.

The mango sticky rice shaved snow was so good! Definitely more than we could finish. The snow was light and flavorful. The set up of the toppings were nicely put together. It  had extra mango sauce, sticky rice, nut mix, and condensed milk. 

Overall, the presentation was what caught my eye and the atmosphere was very chill. Would recommend and return!
author: Audrey K.

description:
Overview: U: Dessert Story is a medium sized dessert centered, sit-down restaurant from the owners of "Kitchen Story," that serves very high quality, shareable desserts with strong Asian influences.

The Establishment: Located just a block east of where 16th St intersects Market St, U:DS sports light wood accents, art-filled walls, colorful balloons (probably only there because of Pride Month), and tables with beautifully pronounced wood grain. There's nothing to criticize here.

The Service: This is very nicely a sit-down restaurant where your food is brought to you. I didn't really expect much in the way of service so I don't really have much to comment.

The Food: 
Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu: 5-stars. This is mango pieces atop of sweet shaved ice with a caramel sauce drizzled on top. In addition there is condensed milk, nuts, additional caramel sauce, and sticky rice served on the side. It's presented beautifully (see photos below) and would like be enough calories to replace a meal for two people.

Triple Flavor Fondue: 3.5 stars. Don't get me wrong, this dessert is delicious, but is a very simple concept: Get soft white bread sliced thickly, and bring out small bowls filled with condensed-milk based flavors. 

Conclusions: U: Dessert Story only opened a few months ago in April of 2018 but I predict by the end of 2018 it will be a staple of the Castro neighborhood. With a well kempt and laid out establishment, table service, beautiful presentation, strong flavors, and a wide menu, this would hands down be my choice for dessert after a date.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Bad service, they seem overwhelmed here...

I can see why this place has such a long line. 
Their desserts are well presented and delicious. So far I only have one favorite, which is the Mango Sticky Rice. Thai Tea crepe and Matcha Lava cake are okay, not bad but not extraordinary. Thai Tea Crepe has like 20+ layers lol pretty cool how it was put together. Matcha Lava Cake seems to be pretty popular as we looked at our neighboring tables (most people ordered it), so we called this last minute. It came out with matcha filling all over the chocolate cake itself, so we asked our server if it was supposed to come out that way since yelp pictures showed that you're suppose to break the cake for it to flow out.. like lava. The server said yes then walked away. So we called the gentleman who appears to look like the manager there to ask about it, he said no then grabbed it away to get us a new one. We just wanted to be the one breaking it - afterall, that's what it's for? lol 
Seatings are are very tight since they have a narrow space and many people are waiting. I also tried their matcha drink, it was good at the beginning but at the time we left, it wasn't the same. My husband said his salted caramel drink wasn't that great and he thought the drinks were overpriced. We both agreed that the best part about our dessert was the mango sticky rice.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Most of the desserts are gonna be $10+ but definitely worth it since they use high quality ingredients & matcha! You order at the front and they seat you. The place is cozy, and can seem smaller when there's a line. Always a plus when a small place has a bathroom (not very common thing in SF). 

What we ordered:
- Matcha Chocolate Lava Cake: good blend of chocolate & matcha, not too sweet, more on the bitter side but well balanced with the ice cream on the side!
- Thai Tea Mille Crepe: simple and delicate. Not too sweet, and the layers just melt in your mouth. The Thai tea flavor on the crepes are light, but you can add more of the Thai tea frosting (served on the side) if you want a stronger flavor
- Matcha Macchiato: strong matcha flavor, served hot with a side of sweetener which you can add to your liking.

Expect a wait time of an hour, especially during peak times (after lunch and dinner). We went after 10pm on a Saturday (they're open til midnight) and the line died down around 11pm. That's a bit of a risk as some of their more popular desserts might have sold out already. Definitely worth the wait though! Overall, I'd go back again! They have other popular desserts like their bingsu that I want to try!
author: Kim C.

description:
I never imaged matcha oozing perfectly out of a lava cake...until I came here.

Though it is a dessert only place, it was packed with people on a Wednesday night. The place looks like a restaurant, meaning it's relatively large for a dessert spot. I think I even saw an area in the back for larger parties to hold events in.

One dessert is plenty to share between two people and will run you ~$12. They also have tea and coffee to pair, or wine if you're feeling a little riskay.
author: Allie L.

description:
First time here..same owner as kitchen story next door share kitchen. We got their 3 specialty...matcha lava, coconut Mille cake and thai tea Mille cake. The lava was just ok. It's a bit rich for me. It's more of a brownie than cake texture on the cake. I do really really love their lava matcha filling.. so smooth, strong matcha flavor and not too sweet. I can swim in that matcha lava all day. It has a strong matcha flavor without it being bitter. Just wish the cake wouldn't be so dense and rich.  

Now for two Millie cake... wow ..it's soooo good. Not sweet at all and their dipping sauce is perfect. I can eat it every day. It is as good as lady M but.... yes there is a but. Was it worth it for the price. $12 for a small slice. Hmmmmm.... I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. I probably go here for first timers to try or I'm in the area. I think if the price was a bit cheaper than it would be more reasonable. They are busy so I guess people doesn't  mind the price. 

Overall I still enjoyed it and service was great too
author: Christy V.

description:
Let me start off by saying, while i've never been a believer in hangovers, food comas are a completely different story..U:Dessert Story that is.

Nestled on a corner in the Castro district, next door to what i would assume to be thier sister, Kitchen Story (who might i add owns quite a few of these korean/asian fusion breakfast places in the bay area. This is the newest in the "Story" family, a newer, modern and more colorful HK type cafe that melts flavors of both the east and west to bring you eye catching, trendy and delicious desserts. 

Being a huge HK/Asian dessert fan, I decided to hop on a lyft and get a little taste (shhhh..don't tell anyone, i'm supposed to be on a diet..) and ended up trying the following:

Special pride edition of the milli crepe cake in all its delicious and beautiful rainbow glory, with strawberry sauce.

Followed by thier take on my favorite thai dessert, the Mango sticky rice bingu (very finely shaved snow ice) with sides including mango sauce, condensed milk and sticky rice.

Portions are not only huge but look almost too good to eat! My eyes are usually always bigger than my appetite so if possible bring friends and share a few rounds of the various dessert combinations they offer, including the matcha lava cake I didnt get to try this time around. Come hungry and take your time indulging...i know i most certainly am..
author: Petra S.

description:
Although the snacks are expensive, it is worth trying and going in bigger parties to try more food! 

Mango sticky rice - was unique and I enjoyed it a lot! The mango bingsoo is similar to other places but dipping the sticky rice into the sweet jam was delicious!

Fondu with Thai, pandan, and taro - I enjoyed that the most!! Dipping the white soft bread into different flavors of sauce was nothing that I've had before.
author: Instafamishe D.

description: The bingsoo here are super good! The ice shave is creamy and sweet. They give you a lot of mango! I will be coming back again!
author: Shelly C.

description:
Let's tell a story through the art of dessert. Came in for the first time a couple of weekends ago and luckily, there wasn't much of a line because upon leaving, the line grew out the door....and I mean it went from a 15min wait to an hour wait. I came for their famously crepe cakes that were being posted everywhere on social media. So I tried the Thai Tea Crepe Cake and the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo. I LOVED the texture of the shaved ice, it was prob the best textured shaved ice I've ever had, or maybe I just haven't had it in so long that I don't remember the texture. But anyway, it was really good. 
On the other hand, the Thai Tea Crepe Cake had a very interesting taste to it, I wouldn't say I loved it but I didn't hate it either...it was interesting. 
Overall this place is good, totally hyped but I'd come back if I were in the area. Kitchen Story is next door (sister store!) and it's owned by the same person that owns Sweet Maple and Berkeley Social Club.
author: Sabrina N.

description:
I've been here twice now since they opened.  This is absolutely my favorite dessert spot!

From the families of Kitchen Story, Hollywood Cafe, Surisan, Sweet Maple, and all of their other spots in the city...we now welcome U:Dessert Story.  It continues to display their Korean/Thai influences.  Everything from pandan to Thai tea to bingsu...delish.  

My favorite?  The pandan crepe cake.  This is a MUST when you check this place out.  Their plating is beautiful.  The gal there told us that the wooden display plates come directly from Thailand.  They definitely take care with the presentation of every order.  

5 solid stars and plans to revisit over and over and over again!
author: Jen W.

description:
IG-ready, Scandi/ Electic styled interiors (geo shapes, plants, wood plates), Matcha & Thai-tea inspired crepes & cakes that satisfy your late night cravings!!!

- First-time visit on a Sat night & super crowded. About 15 min wait time to get through the line & get seated. 

- Ordered Chocolate lava cake +  matcha ice cream, and it was a complete delight!! The chocolate cake was slightly heated & of which the center filled w/ drips of matcha syrup at just the right level of sweetness. Ice cream added a hint of tea flavor & refreshing coolness onto the heated cake. 

- The cake came on a piece of chopped wood, sprinkled with powdered sugar, and the display adds so much value to the aesthetic experience!! The entire dish was instantly photogenic, along with the potted flowers, decors w/ cute birds, and Scandi/ geo-patterned, white wall in the surroundings.

- Friendly staff always ready to cater to your preferences despite the busy and hectic environment. 

- Ambiance is very energetic, fun, celebrative. Groups celebrating birthdays in the back room, as well as couples at the small tables/ counters with windows overseeing the 16th st. 

- It's a bit pricey for each item though. The one lava cake + single scoop of icecream was about $13 including tax.
author: Jess W.

description:
There was a long line when we entered, but we were seated pretty quickly as we were a table of 4 and we beat out all the table of 2s ahead of us. Guess sometimes it pays to come with a few more people.

I ordered the thai brick toast. It was very large and scrumptious. The honey toast was nice and crunchy, sweetened with honey on the outside. Once broken, thai tea custard spilled out of the toast. The flavor of the custard contained a strong tea flavor (a tad bitter), but worked well with the sweet toast.
author: Mallory L.

description:
This place is so cute and it has a bunch of the desserts I love from honey brick toast to lava cakes to bingsoo and mille crepe cakes. This is definitely a new Instagram dessert spot as all their desserts are presented so beautifully and colorfully. 

When we arrived, there was fortunately no line at around 7 PM. When we left though, the line had stretched to the outside of the store. I'm not sure how it usually is inside the store but it was really hot and humid with no AC. They did have some fans set out to keep the place cool but it felt like I was walking into a sauna. Granted, it was hot outside and it usually is never hot in SF. But the heat probably melted our bingsoo a lot faster.

I was so excited for their mango bingsoo since I ate a lot back in Korea and I think the trend is just finally starting to catch on in SF with a few dessert places now opening up in the past few years that serves bingsoo. I have to say that U: Dessert Story is the closest in matching up for my expectations of bingsoo. Fresh mango fruit, fluffy ice, condensed milk on the side to drizzle on top, mango sauce among other toppings such as granola and sticky rice. 

We also tried one of their mille crepe cakes. Unfortunately, they were out of the Thai crepe cake so we got one of their limited edition Rainbow crepe cake with strawberry sauce on the side. There's something really satisfying in cutting down a crepe cake with your fork. The cake was gone in a few bites since it was so light and not too sweet to eat.

Both desserts were around $12-14 dollars so it's not cheap. I would say the bingsoo is more worth it since you can easily share it with friends.
author: Diana C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 2pm. There were 2 parties ahead of me. Waited roughly about 15 minutes for a table of 3. The place is very small and hot. No AC. Just a couple of fans blowing in every direction. While waiting in line, I come to realize that if you get seated right by the restrooms which is in the middle of the restaurant, you can literally smell the restroom every time that door is open. I prayed while I was waiting in line that I do not get seated there because the smell was that bad. Anyway..

I end up getting seated at the far back room. Hubby and I ordered the chocolate lava cake and matcha Frap. They were both sooo delicious! The cake was $12.95 and the Frap was $6.95. Quite expensive considering the cake was only the size of a small ramekin, but it was worth the try. There aren't a lot of places that sell this kind of cake so I was willing to pay this price to give it a try. The matcha Frap was rich and creamy, nothing like I tasted before. 

Overall, very unique place; yummy desserts were all served on natural wood slices which made it even more appealing and picture worthy.  I recommend giving this place a try. There is a good selection of desserts to choose from. 

4 stars because I think they were all overpriced.
author: Lynd A.

description:
We came here once before but it looked like the line was SOOOO long so we didn't bother to wait.  We came another day and we drove by and it looked pretty empty inside so we decided to come in and give it a try. This place is right next to Kitchen Story (I assume same owner?) and they serve dessert here. 

I feel like the dessert was pretty okayish, it is kind of too sweet for my liking but the design of all the plates and everything all looked pretty cool. It is a bit pricey here and it is definitely worth a try.
author: Ben Z.

description:
OMGOMGOMG 

MANGO STICKY RICE SHAVED ICE!
You HAVE to drizzle the mango sauce and condensed milk on top, and just makes it 100 times more better! 

I personally prefer the Korean style shaved ice just because it has a better taste

The plating, the presentation is just so picture worthy.

The coconut cake, it's very light, and the sweetness is just perfect!

However, I have to say the wait can be a little frustrating, and the space is small so it gets really hot inside. (But they do take reservation, so plan accordingly since parking is always the issue)

I am so glad I discovered this place, and it's right next to kitchen story...which I believe is owned by the same owner.  

Millionaire bacon + mango shaved ice = happy me
author: Linwei Y.

description:
U :Dessert Story is connected to Kitchen Story! they are owned by the same people!

mango sticky rice bingsoo is the one!  ~$14
the shaved ice was very milky. the mango puree was very good. condensed milk is always great. the sticky rice was pretty delicious when all the other parts are combined together! 

i want to go back and try the matcha lava cake or the thai crepe cake!
author: Marjo M.

description:
Mango sticky rice bingsu was my favorite. The ice was so fine and the mango puree sauce was amazing. The mango chunks were sweet. I wish they gave us more pandan sticky rice. The presentation was very cute, all desserts were served on engraved logs and wooden plates.

The crepe cake was layers of freshly made pandan crepes interleaved with coconut cream sauce with small pieces of coconut flesh with shredded coconut flakes on top. Very light and refreshing, just the right amount of sweetness.

The thai tea lava honey toast was so indulgent. Rich butter toast with thai tea ice cream and sauce. I really want more sauce to go with the toast and the whipped cream on the side would have been better.

All three desserts go well together with different flavors that balance each other. Will come back soon!
author: Norases V.

description:
Ya'll sign me up right now to re-visit this place because I'm seriously out here wishing I lived in the neighborhood so I could pop in to this place whenever I wanted. 

I dropped by U:Dessert Story on a Wednesday evening around 7:00 pm with my brother and was able to get seated right away. Initially, we were going to get the matcha lava cake, but since it takes 15-20 min to prepare/bake, we went with the honey brick toast.

To be completely honest, I was totally floored *in the best way possible* when the toast came out. Not only was it super aesthetically pleasing, it was also SUPER delicious. It was sweet, buttery and overall great for the soul. I would recommend saving the fruit that comes on the side for the end of the dessert because it helps balance the super sweetness towards the end. I would have liked a tiny bit more ice cream and whipped cream with the toast as the proportion of bread to ice cream/whipped cream seemed to be just a tad bit off. 

Overall, my experience here was awesome. Service was friendly, the desserts were beautiful and delicious, and the interior was so freakin cute. I am seriously planning my next visit to this place as I type.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
You know that saying, Stressed is "Desserts" spelled backwards? And, you can reverse being stressed by eating desserts. 

Well, that's the theory...

This week, I had one of those: "FTS, I'm Out!" moments and ended up at U: Dessert Story. 

For "moral support", I dragged my coworker out with me because she looked stressed too. 

Gotta test that theory right? 

U: Dessert Story is a new dessert cafe spin off from Kitchen Story, a popular brunch eatery around the corner. They sell Asian inspired desserts: Bingsu (Korean shaved ice), Crepe Cakes, Honey Toasts, and Freakshakes which I'm assuming are ginormous dessert shakes. For drinks, they sell coffee, tea, and cheese teas. 

Initially, while perusing the menu, I was taken aback by the pricing: https://bit.ly/2wQOel9 BUT the craftsmanship, presentation, and taste is what you will find at a nice, sit down restaurant so it's totally worth it. 

Order at the counter, seat yourself, and your order will be brought to you. There's complimentary fruit infused water. 

To start, we ordered the Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake w/ matcha ice cream ($12): https://bit.ly/2IN90Hm.

Loved the whimsical presentation. Slicing into the matcha dusted cake, we were met with a rich, goooey, molten chocolate center. The lava cake was satisfyingly decadent and not overly sweet. The matcha ice cream was the perfect complement providing a nice, cold temperature contrast to the warm cake. There was also toffee crumbles for texture.

Roy's used to have the best chocolate lava cake but they've gone way downhill so this is my current favorite. 

We also ordered their Signature Bingsu. One of the owners (?) said, their mangoes were really ripe today so we went with the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu ($13): https://bit.ly/2IMuDHQ.

When the Bingsu arrived, our eyes lit up. The bowl was piled high with finely milled milk snow surrounded by incredibly ripen sweet mangoes. The coconut sticky rice was served warm on the side along with mango purée, condensed milk, and housemade granola for some crunch. 

So many delicious textures and subtle flavors. And, the milk bingsu itself was incredibly soft and light. It's a refreshingly cool dessert you can feel good about eating. 

I've also bought their Thai Tea and Young Coconut Pandan Crepe Cakes to try at home ($12/slice): https://bit.ly/2KzMiQf. The 20+ mille crepe layer cakes are good but not as their excellent lava cake and bingsu. I think the whipped cream filling needs to be tweaked a bit. I found it to have a waxy mouthfeel.

The two ladies (owners?) who run this dessert cafe are the epitome of true Thai hospitality: genuinely warm and gracious. They make you feel like you're guests in their home. Both checked in with us and neighboring tables several times to make sure we were enjoying our desserts and to refill our water cup. I would recommend providing a larger cup though for efficiency sake.

For a dessert cafe, there was good amount of seating: ~20 seats in the front and two large group area in the back that can seat another ~20 people. No outdoor seating, maybe in the future, they'll consider adding a table or two out front for furparents in the area (their sister restaurant is dog-friendly). 

Ok, back to that theory - does eating desserts really reverse stress?

Most definitely.

I returned to work with a silly happy ending smile.

Chocolate = Endorphins
Matcha = L-Theanine controls stress hormones  

It's proven so go out and write your own dessert story! ;)





.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Cute dessert spot in the Castro, right next to Kitchen Story! (Same owner) 

It's a small place, but there's also extra seating in the back. I'm sure it's because this place is still fairly new, but there was a backdrop with balloons at the entrance. 

We kept it simple and only ordered two things: 
1. Matcha Float ($6.75) Are you a matcha lover?? This is perfect if you are!! This was sooo good and much better than I expected. It's not too sweet even with the matcha ice cream on top. Must get!! 

2. Chocolate Matcha Lava ($12) Soo good as well. This wasn't exactly what I expected, as I thought the "lava" chocolate interior would be spilling out as soon as I cut into it (also fine with me because then it would have been too messy). And it's actually smaller than I anticipated, but it was just the right amount for two. Since it's on the sweeter side, I'm glad I split this with another person because it might have been too heavy for me to finish on my own. Would highly recommend this item as well. Don't forget to eat this with the nuts scattered on the side! I didn't notice it until halfway finishing the dish. 

There can be a bit of a wait (but we did go on a holiday). Luckily there was no wait for the bar facing the street, so we sat immediately). 

Overall, the presentation is excellent, and the ambiance/decor is all "ig worthy." Not only is it served beautifully, it tastes just as good. Would highly recommend this place in you're in the city! They also built a cute bench around the tree in front of the building. :)
author: Miranda T.

description:
Food: very aesthetic. & tasty for the earl gray crumble. we got the thai tea crepe cake, earl gray crumble, and the matcha float. The flavors were pretty unique imo except for matcha float which we got for aesthetic purposes. the Thai tea crepe cake wasn't all that fascinating to me but the taste of the thai tea was there which I liked & would prob get it again if i was going with someone who's never been there . The matcha float just tasted hella basic. I would say I liked the Earl Gray crumble the most out of these three.

Service: We came here waaaaay before the place opened and already some others waiting around as well already. We were amongst the first to be seated and the food took around 15 - 20 minutes to come out. The employee service was decent. 

Ambience: I recommend coming early ofc so you can take your foodie pics with less people judging you. The decor is aesthetic as well and is perfect for pictures. 

Price: expensive but expected bc aesthetics. it was around 16 dollars per person. 

Would I come here again? YES!!! b/c aesthetics and unique flavors coming out and I was not disappointed overall
author: Celina D.

description:
3.75

So whats the newest craze in SF?  Crepe cakes.  So when my friend and I finish dinner and he asks what I want for dessert.... I said I hope you have room for cake(s).  

The decor and the desserts were super cute.  We were stuffed from dinner but we ordered three cakes anyway

Matcha Crepe Cake and Thai Tea Crepe Cake - these cakes were very light and creamy but IMO, I wasn't really a fan.  It was somewhat bland but luckily the cakes came with a syrup for extra flavor; I recommend drizzling the whole thing on the cakes
Matcha Lava Cake - we enjoyed this cake out of the three.  The matcha lava was surprising and different than other cakes.  It went well with the ice cream and what tasted like toffee bits

Our neighboring customers ordered a mango dessert which looked absolutely delicious.  I guess I had high expectations for the crepe cakes. 
 I'm not sure I would come back but I'm open to giving the other desserts a try.
author: Linda N.

description:
Pretty great quality dessert spot in the city.  I've come here 3 times and have tried 3 different desserts. The portions for the honey toast and the shave ice (bingsoo and kakigori) are good to share for 2. This place is the same owner of Kitchen Story so you already know the quality and presentation is going to be A1.

At night there was a line outside so you know it's a "worth the wait" type of spot. The presentation of their desserts are very pretty and picturesque. They have a variety of drinks (teas/coffee/matcha), to cakes (slices of crepe cakes or lava cakes), to honey toast, to shave ice. You can't go wrong with any, just pick what you're craving! 

Glad theres a new dessert installation to the city where they don't slack on the Asian fusion type of desserts. I'll be back again! :)
author: Tiffany Z.

description: We happened to see this place and were intrigued by the name. Came back after making a reservation after 3 weeks and all the crowds now seem justified. It is cosy and fun and very hip.. the dessert items look so pretty. It is like a visual treat. I had the mango sticky rice bingsoo and loved it. Happiness turned to max food.
author: Neha B.

description:
Much esthetic. Much wow. Much expensive. Holy cow. 

This place is the cutest! Love the esthetic and the food. It's a very popular place with a line out the door on a Friday night (with good reason!). The staff seemed very efficient by taking orders while ppl are still in line. We didn't have to wait long for a party of 2 to get seated. 

We got the mango sticky rice bingsoo and it was very yummy and the presentation was on point. It was a good size to be shared between two. The sticky rice was good but there was a white sauce on top that seemed a bit off-- could just be me tho. The only down side to this place is that it's expensive. $14 for a dessert is asking a bit much. it's SF though so can't expect much less. 

Despite the price, I'd definitely be back. Haven't found another comparable dessert place in SF, so this will be my go-to for now. 

 Nomnomnom
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Every dessert should have their own story and this hot new dessert spot will sure blow you away with their pretty plating and presentation.  Each dessert comes out beautifully plated and totally IG worthy that it's hard not to snap some photos before digging in.

Brought to you by the same owners of Kitchen Story, Sweet Maple, and Blackwood... I love the Thai/Asian inspired flavors in their drinks, crepes, brick toast and bingsu (Korean fluffy snow). 

Coming on a Friday night, we expected them to be busy but everyone was working their tails off to attend to their customers.  The kitchen staff was cranking out the matcha lava cakes and brick toast from the back while the baker was neatly making each crepe to layer onto her cakes.  While it may have taken a minute to get an order in and the check, everyone was super friendly and helpful.  Given that they have just opened a few days ago, they are doing the best they can to accommodate the crowd so I definitely applaud them for that.

So far, we have tried the Young Coconut Pandan crepe cake, Strawberry Cheesecake Yogurt Kakigori Bingsu, and the Thai Tea crepe cake.  While the crepes and filling in between each layer lacked flavor, their sauce totally made up for it.  Each sauce was so tasty, not overly sweet but the perfect touch to the delicate layer of each crepe.  However, the star of the night was the Bingsu....not only was it so light and fluffy, but the tartness from the yogurt combined with the sweetness of the strawberry sauce and condensed milk reminded me of a Milkis drink.  The best surprise were the cheesecake pieces found inside the huge mountain of snow.  Delicious!! 

I have yet to try their drinks as their espresso machine was broken tonight but I will sure be back for that, along with their cheese tea and matcha latte.
author: Janetto L.

description:
Environment: Super nice and aesthetically pleasing. It's just very hard to get around the tables because it's kind of crowded. People in wheelchairs might struggle with it. However, I can also see why having a reservation is good since seating isn't a lot.

Service: Very friendly! Although there were only like 3 waiters, they were very fast and kind. The desserts were also served pretty fast.

Food: Everything was so delicious, rich, and filling. My boyfriend and I got the Matcha Lava Cake and the Thai Tea Crepe came! I really enjoyed the matcha ice cream that came with the lava cake! I wish the crepe dish came with a scoop of ice cream as well though!

Price: Now this is where I docked off a star. It was a little overpriced in my opinion. The lava cake was worth it but I did not believe the crepe cake was worth as much as the lava cake. Our total came up to $26 and 80 something cents. 

Overall I would totally go back. It's definitely a once a while treat. But it was so expensive!
author: Casey Y.

description:
The short: phenomenal dessert place that is well worth the wait and price.

The long: I'm not a dessert person, lacking a sweet tooth and preferring a third helping instead of a real dessert...but I somehow was convinced to go. Flash forward an hour later, I walk into a place that was immaculately decorated. The touches were gorgeous, from the step-and-repeat, to the mural sketch of Venice on the opposite wall, you could tell this was a well-thought out theme. 

The desserts itself looked delicious and, most importantly was surprisingly refreshing. We ordered the mango snow ice dessert (mango bingso).

They lost a star for forgetting our earl grey but I will definitely come back!!
author: Peter C.

description: This is a fancy dessert place, the sibling of Kitchen Story next door. It's a bit much to go from a rich meal at Kitchen Story straight to a rich dessert at Dessert Story, so I would actually recommend going to the latter as an outing on its own or, if one is looking for a post-meal treat, sharing a main item with at least three friends. My party of three got a table without reservations with no problem early in the evening, although the line and wait time increased later on. I was full from dinner so ordered the "ceremonial" matcha and nibbled on my friends' shaved ice platters. The ceremonial matcha is just a small cup of plain matcha and at $7 seems way overpriced, despite being plated beautifully on a tree stump plate with a smattering of rose petal pieces. The similarly artistic shaved ice entrees are a much better deal. I enjoyed the soft syrupy pieces of mango on the mango shaved ice. The strawberry cheesecake one was a showstopper, rising tall out of its bowl, with actual cheesecake squares at the bottom. The white shaved ice looks like it would be plain vanilla but they are able to inject a lot more flavor into it; the strawberry cheesecake shaved ice clearly matched the description on the menu involving yogurt. I would definitely come again to partake in the pretty dishes, but prepare better by leaving more room in my stomach.
author: Amy G.

description:
Just finished enjoying the soft opening delights from U Dessert Story with my husband. This place is certainly off to a good start with cheese teas, delectable desserts such as Thai crepe cake, toffee cake, fruit/whip cream, matcha tea cake, bingsu, etc. 

While all the desserts were amazing and could be found appealing to the right palate, my favorite two options were the Thai crepe cake and matcha cake. The airy texture of the crepe and the freshness of the cake made them an automatic favorite and options that I will return for on future visits. 

With a light and airy feel to the location and its proximity to Kitchen Story, its brunch sister restaurant, it is a great fit to the local area and most likely an automatic hit. I'm grateful for the opportunity to be there on opening day and enjoy all the restaurant has to offer.

Came back for opening day for a world wind of delicious flavors. I had the matcha lava cake, matcha latte, thai crepe cake, and cheese oolong tea. The matcha lava cake was warmed to the perfection. The chocolate matcha sauce oozed out of the middle. Both flavors complement each other and are not over powered. The dish is paired with a matcha ice cream and mint leave which allows you to have the perfect balance between warm and cool. 

The matcha latte has a strong matcha flavor with a nice thick layer of whip cream on top.

The cheese oolong had a nice mild cheese flavor paired with oolong base.
author: Dawn B.

description:
I'm a big fan of this new dessert cafe in the Castro. 

Really cute and inviting atmosphere. Flowers and succulents on each dark walnut wooden table. Plants and light fixtures dangling from the ceiling and beautiful painted murals on the walls. Features that really set the mood for a fun evening with friends. 

Crepe cakes are my absolute favorite dessert, but can be a bit difficult to find in the city. I've tried both the Pandan and Thai Tea crepe cakes and both are delicious! Very light and perfectly sweet.

The Chocolate Matcha Lava Cake was fudge-y and the match "lava" wasn't as overpowering as I expected. The two flavors together really worked well!

The last dessert I tried was the Thai Tea Toast. The bread has been toasted to a slight crisp, served with their Thai Tea sauce and condensed milk. Just, yumm!!

The way they present their plates are absolutely adorable. The desserts are served on these adorable wooden plates, some sprinkled with powdered sugar, a swirl of whipped cream, and a few pieces of berries. 

They have a good/unique selection of teas, shakes, espresso drinks,  and floats.

The place gets busy (especially on the weekends), which is why I appreciate the service being quick but never too busy to assist when needed.

I've been to U Dessert Story two times since they've opened and intend on coming back sometime soon!
author: Mary R.

description: A very good dessert experience overall. Don't expect any store bought resell stuff here; everything is made onsite including their thousand layer cake. Their matcha green tea shaved ice was tasty but I forgot to tell them to hold the condense milk.  Their Expresso shot here is no joke. Of all the stuff we tried everything came out like decorative art. You can tell they took the time and made it presentable. Their dessert are not overly sweet but just enough to remind you it's dessert.
author: Eric T.

description:
After having dinner at Kitchen Story, I came across this place right next door.  I saw they had two of my favorite desserts, snow and crepe cakes, and knew I had to try it.  The place was quite busy, but luckily we got a table after about 5 minutes.  Good thing I looked around at what everyone else was having because if my husband and I ordered both the crepe cake and snow, we would have been in trouble, especially after a filling dinner earlier.

We ordered a couple of teas and the mango sticky rice bingsu to share.  They all came out on really cute wooden trays.  I love how the bingsu had the condiments on the side (condensed milk, mango puree, sticky rice and crunchy toppings) so you could add how much or how little you wanted.  The mango itself was a little sour, but it balanced well with the powder and condensed milk.  I'm sure if I came straight here to just get dessert I could finish it, but between the two of us, we were stuffed and ate about 3/4 of it.  

Service was good, though it is a bit tight in there, kind of like Kitchen Story next door.  I really appreciated the snack and am looking forward to coming back to try the coconut pandan and thai tea crepe cakes.

Yum!
author: Maria S.

description:
Got the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu for $13 and was hella pleased with the selection. The portion size was super big and you could get an extra friend to help you finish the rest of it. They went generous with the toppings and the toppings included some condensed milk and mango puree/sauce.

Someone came for their birthday and the staff did the best birthday song -- it got everyone in the whole store in the mood.

Note that the seating area was a bit tight, but is extremely cute. I'd recommend this place and would come back!
author: Victor L.

description:
Came here with a large group on Wednesday night. 

Very cute interior and concept, the menu has a variety of drinks, cakes, BINGSOO, and toast. The front seating area is cute but we were seated in an awkward hallway table in the back. The staff kept going behind our table to get to the storage room in the back. Kind of awkward so I think they could do away with this table location. 

The food and drinks come out on huge tree trunk plates, which make for great pictures but bad table space. Especially since they're all circular and heavy. But the laser cut inscription of their store name was a cute touch. 

The matcha chocolate lava cake was pretty okay, I thought it was too sweet. The lava cake part wasn't that warm either. 

I tried the strawberry cheesecake bingsoo, I think that was very good. I'd get it again next time -- it was not too sweet, but the strawberry syrup sauce was yummy! 

I saw some other table got the toast -- it is like the honey box toast I've seen at other Asian dessert places. It's not a slice of toast. It is basically a loaf of bread that's toasted and filled with other pieces of bread/fruit/condensed milk. I want to get that next time too. 

Come here with a few other people so you can split things and sample everything!
author: RachEl L.

description: How I love organic matcha in this cute little dreamy place! The reason why this place got so jacked up is their desserts are top notch - yes, they are very high quality and eye candy too. People come here for comfort dessert as well as IG photo bombs. I have to say they are very creative in presenting these food; a little bit over priced because it is $7 for a cup of matcha float, $13 for snow ice but I am sure to see very young hard working team serving the whole floor. Make sure you tip them well please!
author: Jenny N.

description:
Kitchen Story or U :Dessert Story, which story is more interesting?  Here's what I suggest.  When writing a review, I write more words about something very new, something never before seen attracts patrons attention.

So here's my U :Dessert Story.  Lately I've been desperately searching to see new and interesting places on yelp.  So when I go to "activity" and scroll down, I stumbled upon the grand opening of Urban Ritual.  While on the business page, I scrolled down further to see more of the new businesses.  And there, I found what was now a very new and interesting dessert place!  One of its photos posted happened to be Bingsu (Korean shaved ice).  So I bookmarked it until I get there a week later.

When I arrived at U :Dessert Story, I'm willing to get my sweet tooth on.  As I looked around the atmosphere, everything seemed super sweet.  Their menu was sweet as well (there are some of the unique selections to choose from).  I been so eager, but there are many patrons who have their order first.  It took me minutes to choose any dessert, and I had to ask questions.  Without a second to spare, I ultimately chose the Melon Bingsu (so much for my first chance this afternoon without a freakshake).

After minutes pass by, my Melon Bingsu was as good as gold.  I was surprised my lovely waitress have carved out a cantaloupe dome to reveal chunks of cantaloupe balls and a coconut shaved ice inside.  Everything on the wooden board was great as it see it, pieces of almond, condensed milk, and a honeydew creamsicle.  Again, I had to ask questions before I finished the entire dessert.

It's nice being in a dessert place surrounded by many Asian patrons.  And a couple of sweet ladies working here, service with a smile.  I feel I'll come back if I ever needed to reverse being "stressed". ;-)
author: Jimmy C.

description:
The interior here is cute! I'd give this place 3.5 stars. 
- 1 star for the price cause this place is pretty pricey. We spent around $30 for two desserts, including tip. 
- 0.5 stars for the service. Service was meh, but it was busy so I get it. Our server tried to check up on us once or twice.

Aside from the service and price, I enjoyed the desserts! My friends and I came here on a Wednesday night around 8pm, and it was crowded. Luckily, we got seated right away.

We ordered:
- Thai Tea Crepe Cake ($12)
- Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo ($13)

Both were delicious! The crepe cake took awhile to come out but it was worth the wait. I would recommend getting these desserts for people who haven't been here yet!
author: Elise F.

description: I've been to Dessert story on several occasions now and can safely say that this is probably one of my favorite dessert places in sf... my normal go-to here is the mango sticky rice bingsoo and a matcha latte... although I did have their Thai brick toast before and it was pretty delicious... I'm not usually a brick toast guy but this one is good. For my next visits I'll probably venture out and try some other stuff but so far the bingsoo and brick toast is pretty good. The only drawback on this place is probably the wait time which can be long during peak hours... but other than that, the food is great, the drinks are pretty good as well, and the service is also a-okay.
author: Marco M.

description:
I had found this place while searching for dessert and I was very intrigued at looking through their menu items, especially the matcha lava cake because I LOVE chocolate lava cakes and I love matcha, so the combo of the two had me wanting to try it. 

Walking inside the interior was super cute, but I ended up sitting in the back and it was very cramped. When I used the restroom I saw that it was the biggest one room public restroom I've been in before. I feel like in the layout of the store, it would have been better to cut out the space of the restroom so the store could accommodate more space for customers since they're pretty busy and crowded most of the time. 

BUT ANYWAY onto the dessert - honestly, this was the best and I'm not sure exaggerating, it was THE BEST dessert I've ever had in my entire life. I got the matcha lava cake and a slice of the Thai tea crepe cake. The matcha lava cake was everything I love in a chocolate lava cake - moist chocolate cake, and a delicious flowing center of matcha. As for the Thai tea crepe cake... my goodness... it was as if I laid my head on the softest pillow I've ever felt but that feeling was in my mouth  

I am definitely coming here again!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
This  Has been a super popular place that has been talked about for the past couple of months!
Super exciting to have gotten a chance to get in with a group of 10 people without reservation to begin with!  We were  told if you show up later usually the crowd dies down!
 So we took a chance and showed up for dessert time at around 9:45 p.m. And bingo, we all sat down by 10:15 p.m.. What's amazing about this desert place is that they close at 10:00 p.m., However super accommodating,   Amazing customer service right there to begin with,  without even having a chance to taste   any of the  desserts yet.    While  we were in line for about 15 minutes they went ahead and took our desserts orders.  That's super efficiencies also on the staffs.
 So we had order basically a little bit of everything from the desserts menu. When we sit down with a group that size especially with a lot of kids we always make it easy for ourselves and order one of each!
 As soon as we sat down long after the business close, All the desserts came out at the same time. 
There were so many of them I can't even keep track of how many we had ordered!
 Our eyes had widen and our mouths  were salivating!  Everything is super colorful and the display were simply gorgeous! 
 The taste of every single desserts  Here lived up to the hype!
Omg!  What do I eat 1st?
  Just a feeding frenzy straight ahead diving into everything!
 The taste, the presentation, the colors and texture of each bowl and platter are mouthwatering delicious!
 The cream,  the ice cream, the coconut, The pandan leaf,  the Macha tea, the lavender cream are all  so good and sweetly crafted! 
The chocolate molten lava cake was bubbling!
The Multi layer cake made  straight from coconut and pandan leaf was moist and rich creaminess!
 We're already planning  and anticipating on coming back here the next night for the next desserts!
 I guess I better not eat dinner when I'm about to come to this place again next time !  This is the place to get your sweet tooth  cravings  fixed!
author: Cecilia L.

description: Nothing really special, the food is okay ain't amazing really cute plates. The bingsu Is pretty big, ate it with two of my friends.
author: Bts A.

description:
Dessert Story, you have captivated my foodie heart!  I've been here twice already and each time, the place is packed! I can understand why since the store decor is cute, their dessert is yummy and the presentation of the dessert is definitely IG worthy. 

I recommend their bingsoo. I've been on a hunt for good bingsoo in the city and this place definitely is the best place I've had for bingsoo. I've had the mango and matcha one and both of them were delicious!

You can expect a wait for a table. I went on a Tuesday night at 8:20 pm and there as a line to the door already. 

I will be back to try the other bingsoo flavors!
author: Frances K.

description:
I think I have tried most items on the menu...I have yet to be disappointed. Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo and Mango Toast are AMAZING. I think the crepe cakes are WAY better than Lady M. 

Super cute and instagrammable. If you are looking to get a good gram, I'd go during the day. Super dark throughout the place at night. 

long line, so expect to wait. (well worth the wait)
author: Howie M.

description:
Not going to lie. I stalked them on insta. I love mille crêpes in France and I love how not sweet some Asian dessert can be so I was here for it. 

Thier mille crêpes  are VERY similar to the versions of Cafe M in NYC but they are better at U: Dessert Story and they are also more expensive at U:Dessert Story. Flat out the dessert here are expensive so it's a good thing they are big! A slice of mille crêpes gâteau was more than enough for two of us. The korean snow ice is big enough for 4.  I've been there a few times now. The winner for me so far (still eating my way through the menu) is the Thai Tea mille crêpes!

It is so light yet so creamy, the warm thai tea sauce should be wrong but it is so right. It just makes me happy. Not to sweet on it's own but can be sweet with the sauce. Works on it's own or with the sauce.

The coconut pandan is ok but the mille crêpes and the coconut cream didn't work as well. 

The coffee is average, skip it.

The best time to go is on a weekday night, on weekends it can get busy and they annoyingly turn up the music. 

Totally worth making a trip to the neighbourhood just for this dessert.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
I was craving Lady M style crepe cakes, so my sister and I decided to visit U:Dessert Story on a weekday after lunch. I heard the lines for this place can get crazy, so we got really lucky! The whole store is extremely cute and the employees were attentive and friendly.

After reviewing the menu, we settled on the matcha lava cake and the young coconut pandan layered cake. Yes, the prices for these desserts are crazy expensive (think $10-$15 for each dessert) but they come out instagram worthy and look like they're created by $$$$ dessert chefs. Also, they are pretty damn good! I don't really like chocolate, but the chocolate cake wasn't super sweet and tasted great a la mode. I loved the crepe cake the most because it was airy, light, and the flavors weren't overpowering. A plus is that if you're craving Lady M, the crepe cakes here won't taste like freezer burn!

I would love to come back again, but maybe I'll share a dessert next time! Our total for both desserts was around $30.
author: Joyce E.

description:
I wanted to try this place after seeing a lot of buzz on Instagram.  Right off the back, I noticed that the menu had some unique menu items putting spins on some popular desserts.  I ended up ordering the mango sticky rice bingsu.  As expected, this bingsu was a bowl of shaved ice with mango on top.  In addition, I was also given sticky rice, nuts, condensed milk, and mango sauce on the side.   It was recommended that I combine a little of everything as my first bite.  And this first bite did not disappoint.  All the elements worked really well together and tasted delicious.  It also didn't hurt that the presentation was very impressive, making for great photos.  

I would also have to say I was very impressed by the service and attentiveness of the staff. The person at the counter was super nice and gave me a lot of info about the menu.  A glass of water was delivered to my table and another staff member gave me an in-depth description of my dessert as she delivered it.  

I will definitely have to go back to try the other desserts on the menu.
author: Mitch T.

description:
Trendy Asian dessert spot in the Castro-Church area.

My partner in crime and I took the muni train to Church St station, then it's just a short walk to this spot.

Interior is cute and clean but small. I can see it getting crowded on weekend or even in the evenings.

As usual, we over ordered. Two of us shared a slice of Coconut Pandan crepe cake (12.50), melon bingsu ($13) and Macha with Red Bean ($14).  Generous portions and beautiful presentation. 

Came out satisfied and would go back and try the other items next time.
author: Margaret W.

description: Cute matcha places in SF. I visited here on Sunday afternoon, it was crowded but didn't wait too long, around 5 mins.  I ordered matcha float and chocolate matcha lava cake withice cream. Matcha lava cake is great!
author: Jenny H.

description:
The dessert's here are definitely very unique and tasty. I tried their thai tea crepe cake slice ($12) and the mango bingsoo. I was impressed with their fast service and appreciated how friendly their staff members were. The crepe cake was definitely something I'd come back here for. It wasn't super sweet and the cake was easy to share around. The mango bingsoo was also delicious and refreshing. Plenty of mango fruit and assortments to eat it with. I came here in the early afternoon to avoid the long lines and crowds so I didn't have to wait for a table. Prices here are typically of any restaurant in the city so yes..its expensive, but oh well.

I would stop by here again for their crepe cake :)
author: Kenneth L.

description:
they have a very interesting menu for dessert. we picked one from each category and the pandan coconut pancake is the best! the toast is pretty sweet, not my favorite but the bingsoo! the matcha bingsoo tastes great and the matcha float is great also. will come back really soon! 
plus: they have cute corner table with great light for selfie lol.
author: Nhi T.

description:
U:Dessert Story reminded me of a popular dessert shop that I tried in NYC - tasty desserts and a good selection of drinks. Every item I ordered was served with superb presentation. I appreciated the time they took to present the items (this place is IG worthy)! 

The Strawberry Bingsu was good. How can you not like condensed milk, strawberry syrup and shaved ice?? 

Moreover, the Thai Tea Crepe Cake comes with a ladle that you can drench the cake with more Thai Tea syrup? (I'm not sure how I would describe the consistency of it). The syrup/frosting was not very sweet so this may be a good choice for people looking for something a little more low key.

Looking for dessert? Look no further. Come here and start your own dessert story ;)
author: Henry W.

description:
I fell out of my bed when I came across this place on yelp. Then I got up, put my shoes on, and came straight here. THIS IS MY DREAM. It's tough to come by Bingsu in SF, so I've been living vicariously through Instagram foodie accounts, but I shall no longer.

This place is amazing! The interior and decor is so cute. The plants on the ceiling, down to the dishes they serve desserts on match the style, I thought that was a super cute touch. 

I'd definitely recommend going with a friend or small group so you can try multiple things, because I honestly don't know how'd you'd choose just one, and most of them are pretty big portions (especially the bingsus).

*Coconut pandan crepe- great texture, not too sweet. I probably wouldn't get again as there are too many other things too choose from, and i actually prefer sweeter desserts.

*Mango sticky rice bingsu- this hit the spot. The mango was perfectly ripe, and all the the ingredients to go on top were amazing. Just when you think it doesn't get any better, you get to the condensed milk at the bottom *drool*. I do wish there was more sticky rice, but that's just because I'm fat hehe.

* Earl grey cheese tea- The tea itself is actually amazing. They give you a fair amount of cheese foam, but I didn't think the foam had a very strong flavor compared to others I've had. Regardless, I'd still get again!

I've seen others posting that the service was great, but we personally didn't have great service. They were fairly busy, so I'm sure that's why they were less attentive. The staff was very nice, nonetheless. 

I'll definitely be back to try everything else on the menu. Wondering if the menu is seasonal?
author: Morgyn T.

description:
Good dessert choices. Got the Mango Bingsoo, taste was great, loved how they gave extra condensed milk and other toppings on the side. Presentation was great, definitely for social media. However, prices are crazy. It was $13 for shaved ice and mango!!! Insanity! Probably won't come here again. 

Waited 30 mins on a Saturday night. Apparently they take reservations...
author: Hanna M.

description:
Very tasty and very creative... We came all the way to the Castro to find a bakery/dessert house that was still open. When we got there it was clear that we weren't the only ones with that idea. The line was long but it actually moved pretty quickly (10 minute wait, maybe).

Lucky for us... because the desserts were pretty good (though damned expensive). The best, surprisingly, were the toasts. Our group of 4 managed to devour a whole "toast" (they're large) in about 5 minutes. I was proud...
