We weren't as impressed with the crepe cake. We had two kinds and they were both just OK. We've had much better versions.

We'd definitely go back if it was late and we wanted something sweet.
author: Art C.

description:
I am a sucker for fancy Asian desserts - pretty much anything that's matcha, thai tea, ube, black sesame flavored. Although they don't have ube or black sesame, they do matcha and thai tea very well. This spot has taste to match their aesthetics! The only down fall? Their price. Expect to pay $12+ a dessert. 
FOOD: 
They have most Asian desserts any dessert lover would want - brick toast, mille crepe, lava cake, bingsu, drinks, etc. Unfortunately, they ran out of matcha lava cakes when we were there, but we shared 3 plates among the 4 of us: 
+ Matcha Bingsu: Loved it! Unlike most bingsu, where they just add powder to the ice, this place actually mixes in the matcha with the ice so the taste is more thorough. They also give you plenty of extra matcha and milk sauce if you want extra flavor. It also comes with red bean and mochi.
+ Mango Sticky Rice Brick Toast: I usually don't like fruity desserts, but this one wasn't bad. They had real mango pieces - not canned - which is huge plus. The stick rice is on the side rather than on the toast and was saltier than we would have liked. They also gave us mixed nuts and mango sauce. We found pipping bag pieces in our toast, which was quite unpleasant - but they were nice enough to reimburse us. 
+ Thai Tea Mille Crepe: The thai tea flavor could be a tad stronger. Even with the extra sauce, I feel like the thai tea flavor was diluted with the creaminess of the sauce. Overall, the texture was super! 
SERVICE: 
We came on a Sunday night and there was no wait. The staff is welcoming and the dishes did take some time to come out, but expected.   

AMBIANCE: 
This shop took over where Ike's sandwiches use to be and is located right next to Kitchen Story. Parking isn't too terrible if you come at the right time. They actually have a decent amount of seating and their interior is very cute! It gives off a garden vibe! 

Verdict: I will be back to try their matcha lava cake!
author: Samantha F.

description: Since they have opened, I visit at least every month. The balance of tart, sweetness and bitterness is just absolutely perfect! My absolute favorite is the matcha lava cake. I have had the Mango Bingsu, strawberry cheesecake Kakigori, Thai and Pandan Crepe cake, Honey Brick toast as well. The best thing about this place is that I do think someone can find their favorite and the sizes are perfect for sharing!
author: Athena C.

description:
This place has really cute interior design. They have a theme with wall flowers and birds. There are tables in the back, but this place is still small. Depending on the time you come, there will be a line. The line forms in front of the bathroom (which I found it odd).
Luckily, I didn't wait too long because I was only with another person. Although they have big tables for big groups, if you are coming here with another person then it's easier to get seated. 
I didn't order to the shaved ice. Instead we ordered the chocolate matcha lava cake. It came with a small whip cream and a kid size scoop of green tea ice cream. The cake itself is dark chocolate, and in the inside, there's the matcha. Initially I didn't taste the matcha because the chocolate was over powering. However, if you taste the sauce by itself, you can taste the matcha. The ice cream was on top of caramel bits and there were two slices of strawberries on the whip cream. Unlike the shaved ice, this dish was small. There was less of an visual impact, but it taste really good. I don't think I can eat the whole thing by myself because the cake started to get heavy near the end (too much chocolate for me).
I would like to come here again, but I would imagine there will be a long line. I do wonder when is the best time to come without having to wait in line. I went after eating dinner at Kitchen Story on a Thursday night.
author: Kiyomi K.

description:
Went on a Sunday afternoon around 3:00pm and there was already a line, about 10 people waiting in line.

We ordered the Match Chocolate Lava Cake with Matcha Ice Cream. The price of the dessert was $14.00 including tax, however it wasn't that great. The matcha flavor was too strong and the chocolate tasted like dark chocolate.
author: Grace T.

description: Finally get to try this place out after wanting to for at least a month and a half or so. Their staff is attentive and made sure everything was good a few times throughout our dining experience. Their Thai tea crepe cake was so good and I love the fresh strawberries garnish.I wish they had a matcha crepe cake though because for sure it would had been bomb!  Their mango sticky rice bingsu was good too, I love the generous amount of fresh mango on it.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
My go-to spot for mango shaved ice. Pretty happy that this is within walking distance of my condo since you have to go to Sunset to get anything remotely similar. I generally gravitate towards the mango or strawberry shaved ice, but mango is certainly my favorite.

Reading other reviews, I think people need a reality check on where they are at. You are in SF, don't rate how hard it is to find parking or how expensive the dishes are!! You are an idiot if you expect to easily find parking in this area and this is how expensive things need to be to survive in the city! Bridge and tunnel people who complain about these things, please stop coming so it will be less crowded for me.
author: C W.

description:
Albeit a fairly new place, this establishment has caught many eyes and established quite a popular following, with a line spanning out its doors most days. 

The venue appears small upon first entry, but there are actually several tables towards the back of the place. There can be a bit of a wait due to large crowds, depending on the time you come (with weekends being the busiest). Nevertheless, this place is worth the wait! The interior design of the place is modern and chic, with glass domed lighting fixtures hanging from the ceiling and cool artwork gracing the walls.  

I came with a party of six other people, and was seated in roughly thirty minutes on a Saturday afternoon. Though the options on the menu are a bit pricey, the presentation of the food and their taste made up for the higher expense. My group opted to get matcha floats (which come with a scoop of matcha ice cream), mango sticky rice bingsoo, matcha lava chocolate cake, and thai lava toast (with the thai ice team flavored ice cream swapped out for vanilla ice cream). 

The aestheticism of the food, and their respective themes, was mind blowing to me. The matcha lava chocolate cake came on what seemed to be a tree ring type of plate, with the words 'U :Dessert Story' engraved on. Going along with this earthy theme was the bits of sprinkled matcha powder adding a green, natural touch to the earthen plate. The mango bingsoo came on a platter sprinkled with flower bits, which made for a cute touch. 

I myself tried the thai lava toast, which came with a bread-brick enclosure containing thai ice tea flavored sauce, little cubes of toasted bread, topped off with whipped cream, sprinkled almonds, and vanilla ice cream. Condensed milk came in a container on the side of the platter, along with assorted fruits such as strawberries, blackberries, blueberries, and bananas with hazelnut chocolate bits interspersed. I absolutely loved this dish, with the crunchy bread bits (along with the sauce), tasting like little pieces of heaven with each bite. The combination of flavors exploding in my mouth made this one of the best brick toast desserts I have ever tried. The cold ice cream made for a cool combination with the still warm bread cubes. My only complaint is that the thai tea flavored sauce was all concentrated on the bottom, drenching the bread cubes at the bottom, making them soggy and way too sweet. Other than that, this dish was perfect. 

All in all, I will definitely come back to this establishment. The other desserts are calling out to be tried, and I cannot wait to see the other presentations and taste the unique combinations that each dish presents.
author: Karen Y.

description:
The dessert that I ordered were Chocolaye Matcha Lava Cake and Thai Tea Lava Toast. The toast tasted very crispy, and the Thai Tea ice cream was so creamy. I like this dessert's taste!

But talking about Chocolate Matcha Lava cake, it didn't meet my satisfaction. The chocolate was too bitter and the macha was too sweet that I feel greasy while I was eating it. So I even didn't finish the cake... Maybe I'm just not into too sweet desserts, so if you're addicted to sweet, you should try it!

In addition,the food presentation is so adorable that you can take many pictures and upload them to your Instagram.
author: 珮瑜

description:
If you love Asian desserts, this place is perfect. They have a variety of desserts from matcha items to brick toast to bingsu. I desperately wanted to try the bingsu from this place, but my friends and I came here spontaneously after a gigantic dinner, so I only had room for a matcha float. -_-

Nonetheless, the matcha float was very delicious. There was enough matcha powder, and the addition of matcha ice cream makes it more delicious. I can't wait to come back to try their bingsu though!
author: Julian Y.

description: I love this place  All deserts are very delicious and unusual, so you can't go wrong. Strawberry cheesecake bingsu is an absolute must
author: Tatiana Z.

description:
Been here twice, and it will continue to be one of my go to spots when I'm craving a creamy but refreshing dessert (Mango sticky rice shaved ice!).

I love the mango sticky rice shaved ice. It is so creamy that it tastes like the ice is made from frozen milk rather than plain ol water. The soft mangos perfectly complement the ice. However, the second time I got it, the mangos were a little more tart. But they do provide a mango sauce that makes up for the too tart fruit. 

I have also tried the "Bread with Triple Flavor Fondue". It is not something I'd order again because it just tasted like big chunks of bread dipped in sweet creamy sauces. 

The wait can be a bit long, but when we went at 9pm on a Monday, there was no line.
author: Sarah M.

description: I would def. recommend the matcha lava cake. Thai tea crepe cake had the perfect amount of sweetness. We also tried the peach fusion drink which did not disappoint. I recommend making a reservation beforehand, unless you don't mind waiting. We were seated on time and had no issues regarding reservations. Cute decor and fast service. Only thing I would suggest to the staff is changing their wet rags or keeping it behind the counters. We sat next to the register/window and smelt some wet towel odor. Overall, pretty good decent priced desserts.
author: Vannah V.

description:
I came here for the mango sticky rice and I left happy! I stopped in after dinner, at ~8:30pm on a Tuesday, and didn't have to wait in line, which I was worried about. The server that greeted and sat me was extremely nice and adorable. I ordered the mango sticky rice bingsu and waited maybe 10 minutes before it arrived. For starters, it is a beautiful looking dessert. The tray and measuring style cups were made of the same wood and it made the dessert seem extra special and expensive. Everything tasted great!! Eating it deconstructed or all together.

The large bowl is the mango chunks over thinly shaved ice - which was a new way for me to experience the dessert. It has a little of the mango sauce and other toppings on top, but plenty of extra and other new toppings on the side. It was nice to be able to add your wanted toppings over and over when you hit a new level of the shaved ice rather than have the restaurant add it all for you at the beginning. Don't get me wrong, I loved this dessert, but all I've ever known is mango chunks over warm sticky rice. Although there is a small cup of sticky rice on the side, I wanted more rice!! And because it was on the side and not covered by the mango chunks it got cold pretty quickly and then it was less enjoyable. Not a complaint per se, just an observation in case anyone loves the sticky rice like I do. I ate this entire dessert by myself (which was totally doable) and I would have been bummed if I'd had to share the small rice portion with someone else lol.

I thought their check drop was cute having been paper clipped to a book! I have never seen that before. Again, my waiter was really nice. While I had been eating an enormous line began forming and he assured me there was no rush to get up and to take my time. I didn't linger but I appreciated the comments.
author: Bri T.

description:
Got to try this place out with my boyfriend few days ago and it's definitely a place to try! This place is located in the Castro's so it's a bit difficult to find parking in that neighborhood. Its on the same block as Kitchen Story FYI. (I'm not sure if the owner is same or different from Kitchen Story). Anyways, my boyfriend and I came here on a Tuesday night and we got there around 8:50pm. We got seated right away and was given the menus. The place is a small so you'll feel extra cozy with the neighbors next to ya. They gave us flavored water which tasted delicious btw lol. 

Since it was night time, we decided to go for caffeine free teas. I ordered the herbal chamomile fusion tea and my bf went with the ginger lemon tea. The herbal chamomile fusion tea had lots of flavors in it and was super tasty. The ginger lemon was just a simple taste and literally just ginger and lemon. For our desserts, we shared the mango sticky rice bingsu which is the shave ice with toppings on the side. It was super yum!! I wanted to try the matcha with red beans but by the looks of everyone's dessert, I knew it was going to be big so we decided to just get one. :( Anyways, the mango sticky rice bingsu was amazing! The shave ice was like huge! It had cut up mangos, mango sauce, and some granola looking things. They also give it to you on the side if you need to pour more! Overall, service was great and the desserts were amazing! The only downside it is kind of on the expensive end but it's worth the try! I'd definitely love to try other things on the menu next time I'm in the area! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
I don't have a sweet tooth. It's only a blue moon that I do or have my man-stration. 

This place is dope! It replaced the old Ike's place and it has a lot os seating. It's somewhat loud, but don't matter. You're here to sate that tooth. Wait time is short. They have community tables. 

We ordered:
Matcha lava cake - very good! No complaints and you should get it. 3.5/5

Mango sticky rice toast - must get! It's a big treat and show stealer for a crowd. Pieces of toast are covered in honey and toasted. The sticky rice is served in a tiny portion and is a little bland. I guess this makes up for all the other sweet stuff. It would be better if they served more coconut milk. The whip cream is flight and fluffy. Not like the one off a Safeway bday cake. 4.5/5
author: Kingston T.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: finding parking is hella hard.  30 minute wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: horrable service. Hot and stuffy. Cramp seating.  You need to ask multiple time for the check. They tried to shove as many seats in as they can.  Don't be surprised if they make you share a table. My party of 4 was seated at half a table made normally for 6 people but there was another group of 5 already seated there.  We asked to be seated at an open square table made for 4 people but was not allowed to have that table since it was for 5 to 6 people. When the group of 5 left, they tired to seat 2 couples (stranger to each other) into the area. There wasn't enough space to seat the couples so they can look at their dates.  They were offered a table corner each. So ya, 2 stranger sharing a bench and their dates looking at each other.  Not cute or romantic. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: the food was good but not worth the wait or the cost. You can get most of these items for half the price and no wait at an Asian cafe.

_____

Overall Experience

2/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Not a place to bring a date to.
author: Elliott N.

description:
Haaaaannnhhhhh

This is the best dessert place in SF. Get the volcano, and giant toast. Thank me later. The cakes aren't as good as what I saiiiiiieeeedddd.
author: Matt H.

description:
The desserts here are so good !! We ordered the 
- mango sticky rice toast ( around $13) 
- mango sticky rice bingsoo (around $13) 
They both look really cute in photos !! 

I personally liked the toast better since I never really liked shaved ice that much. They provide condensed milk for you to dip the bread in (which i love!) 

They have free wifi and the password is just their phone number. 

The environment was great and it's perfect for going with a friend/ group of friends. 

I would definitely come again to try their crepe
cake!!!
author: Kelly L.

description: Got the matcha lava cake, melon bingsoo, and Thai tea crepe. Hands down, get the Thai tea crepe. The matcha lava cake would be good for someone who loves chocolate but too much for someone who isn't...like me. Melon bingsoo was good too but not unique since you can get it at other bingsoo places.
author: Sharon C.

description:
I came here and ordered a Thai Crepe Cake and a Hot Dirty Matcha.  

The Thai Crepe Cake cake paired with a saucer of Thai tea sauce, strawberries-and-cream, a mint leaf, and topped with powdered sugar and more Thai tea sauce.  The cake itself was sweet and super fluffy with Thai tea flavored crepes and whipped cream in between each layer.  It was extraordinary, especially when paired with the bitterness of a Hot Dirty Matcha.

The display for the cup of matcha was adorable, served in a U Dessert custom mug ware on a wooden platter.  The matcha is true matcha from Japan, so rich that the smoothness overpowers the bitterness.  I didn't mind it staining my teeth green, but I couldn't finish the bottom layer of matcha powder chunks (it was too strong at that point).

Service was okay.  It's easy to get seated if you come alone or with someone else (I came with my partner).  Wait time would be long if you came with a larger group.  There was a very long line outside if you didn't reserve seats.  However, since it was so busy, it took forever for the waiters to give the menu to you and much longer for them to give/collect payment.  Waiting for the food was a short time though.


I would come back next time to try their famous toasts and bingsoos though!

(Fair warning, seating is pretty cramped inside if it's busy!)
author: Amy Z.

description:
Dessert menu is not much, but the ones they provide are good. Every plating is cute, just get ready to line up, which is usually less than 15 min average.

The tea selection is great, my fav has been the earl grey crumble. Cake wise I like the lava cake and the thai crepe. Has yet to come back for the ice dessert selection though :)
author: Kevin L.

description: I went here with a group of friends on Wednesday night and there was surprisingly no wait for our group of 3 at 8pm. However, a line started to build at around 8:30-9pm so we were lucky to get seated.  The table was quite small and didn't have room for more than 2 desserts.  We tried the mango bingsu first, which was a Korean snow-ice with mango and other assorted toppings like condensed milk and nuts.  The snow ice actually had some flavor to it (not just plain ice), so I liked it quite a bit. It was even better with the extra toppings mixed in.  We also tried the matcha lava cake. It came with a side of matcha ice cream, which worked perfectly with the dessert.  Overall, it was a satisfying experience. I definitely recommend sharing with friends.  The only downside is the small seating, as well as a rather small menu, but I would definite come back again.
author: Nick A.

description:
I found you, even though I didn't know I was looking for you. 

Tried the yummy sticky mango rice. It was delicious and a great portion. I had never had sticky rice nor my wife. She is very picky so I was surprised on how much she enjoyed it. We will definitely be back! 

Why not the 5 stars? We order for to go and I think since they are new, they are still working out some minor issues. The line for eating in - really long and takes up most of the space. For take out you are supposed to go the registers and place the order. I'm not a skinny girl and the place is tight. It was confusing where should we wait and who would take our order.  (Also, they place the orders for to go on these stairs- kinda dirty, seems sort of weird to place them there) 

See you soon!
author: Jayden R.

description:
Accessibility & Wait Time: 0/0 stars
Street parking can be very difficult in the area. Wait time was about 30 minutes at 9pm on a Friday night, one hr before closing.

Service & Ambiance: 0/0 stars
We had a party of 4, and they squeezed us in a corner with an already half-occupied table that barely bit us. We felt really cramped. It was also very hot and stuffy, so they gave us a broken electric fan that didn't turn on. The staff was very nice, but I think they need to accept the fact that they cant seat everyone. If you don't have a table large enough for a group, then let us wait for the next available table. Don't try to cram us all up like a can of sardines. The group sharing the table with us left, so then the staff tried squeezing two separate parties of two next to us. They were obviously not happy, and they asked to be seated elsewhere. 
 
Food: 2/3 stars
The dessert tasted good and was well presented, but it didn't wow me. We had the Thai Tea Crepe Cake, which was very light and tasted like whipped cream. The star of the dish was really the Thai tea sauce that we drenched the cake in. We also had the Mango Sticky Rice Toast, which is mostly toast with a small side of sticky rice on the side. Lastly, we had the Matcha Chocolate Lava Cake. The cake was a dark chocolate, filled with matcha lava. It was bitter due to the dark chocolate, but it offered a nice contrast to the ice cream. 

Total: 2/5 stars
Overall, the dessert was good but wasn't worth it. Prices were expensive for dessert. For a $13 cake slice, I could've gotten a dinner entrée elsewhere. Not satisfied with the overall experience.
author: Katherine C.

description: This place where I would love to go every week lol. Fresh and never experience with sweet-overloaded. This place represents how Thai people regularly have for desserts, even there are not traditional style, but it could make me miss my comfort desserts. Im looking forward for more variety of Bingsoo and toast like Thai tea Bingsoo or Shibuya honey toast. I have already tried Mango sticky rice and Thai tea toasts, Chocolate Matcha lava and Strawberry Bingsoo, they were not over sweet at all. Worth for a line!!!
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: OMG I've been here probably 10 times just last month because it's SO GOOD :D My favorite is the chocolate ice snow thingy and mango brick toast!!! The people working here are always so nice, they don't know what to recommend because everything is so delicious, hahah. 10/10 would recommend!!! Super duper insta worthy too :))
author: Anne Y.

description:
My first five stars on yelp! I think this place is a great place for such beautifully presented and unique dessert! Great to take visiting family or go for a date night :) We ordered the mango bingsoo and pandan crepe cake. 

The mango bingsoo was just the right amount of sweetness with cool toppings that came with it. I loved the warm sticky rice and the mangos tasted so juicy and ripe. The ice is super soft and milky mmmm. 

My dad chose to order the pandan crepe cake which was also great as well. Definitely yummy but something that I would not order again only because I would want to try the other options on the menu that sound more appealing to me, like the matcha choco lava cake and Thai tea crepe cake. 

The inside decor was cute and staff was friendly and fast.  The only downside is that this place is super pricey. For two desserts, we spent 28$ not including tip! The crepe cake slice is kinda skinny for what you pay for. 

If it wasn't for the price I would go here every week! But definitely returning to try out the other yummy desserts!
author: Lauren L.

description: It has a cute little urban chic/farm house aesthetics to it. Parking is very limited; street parking to be more specific. Prices for drinks are approximately $7 & up depending on what you get. Today, I tried their Classic Oolong Cheese Tea & I couldn't get enough of it so I ordered another one to go!! It's a winner in my book. The only thing I was disappointed about were the Thai Crepe Cake. I expected it to taste as good as how it looks and it just wasn't up to par and it cost about $14 for just a slice of it. So, if you're craving for sweets or cheese teas this is definitely the place to go while you're in San Francisco. But, instead of the Thai Crepe Cake, I would suggest going for the Mango & Sticky Rice or the "Match Bingsu?" I might've missed spelled that.
author: Gerlie P.

description:
It was after all the bars and dinner, it was time for some durian, told bart Simpson there is durian he say nah bruh there aint, I insist there is, he should have known better not to argue with someone whose buzzed lol. 
.
So there's a line, and next thing you know my eyes rolled big and backwards, cuz I dont see no durian. And line moved half way up already, so I'm like eff it we will do the mango instead. Lol.... well I had 2 desserts in mine. But if they are same price and the other one doesn't have fresh fruit, obviously didnt seem like a good deal to me. 
.
So mango bingsoo is what we chose. The price is 15 so the dessert is easily served 2 people or more if you order multiple. 
.
Mango bingsoo is fined powder snow or ice and they put mango puree and fresh cubed mango, condensed milk, topped with some nuts, and a bowl of sticky rice. This dessert was really good, refreshing, and fresh, cold in the mouth at first then it melts. I believe bing soo is what they are known for or most popular. So go for it if you had to choose one. Will be back for more soon. This was a Great summer dessert. I need to find which one serves durian because I know there is a place who does. 
.
So before dessert came I need the bill, cuz I'm in a hurry to catch the uber back to smf.  Next was i asked for the box when the dessert came to the table so we can snap it pretty before it was destroyed. Lol. Anyways here we go eat the dessert in the uber car back to Caltrain to catch the bus to go home. Anyways it was a wild adventure that night and to find out the bus was late 1 hr, so yea eating dessert in uber was just so classy! Pinkies up! Thanks for reading and have a yelptastic day!
author: Alex T.

description:
Came here for dessert after a day at pier 39. Made reservation on yelp but arrived earlier than the reservation time. The hostess simply told us to get in the line and maybe we'll be able to be seated before the reservation time, which was 30mins away. We got seated maybe in 15mins, which wasn't bad. The line move fairly quickly. 

We order the mango sticky rice bingsoo and the mango tango spritzer.  The presentation of both the drink and the dessert was A+.  It both came on a wooden plate with few dry rose petals.  Maybe that's why all the pictures on Instagram and yelp look so good. 

The bingsoo was very good and it came with side of condense milk, nuts, mango purée, and sticky rice.  I think with the name Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo we would be served more sticky rice but no. It was literally a bite or two of the sticky rice. It was also bit dry cause it was sitting on the side by itself. Which is why I took off a star. 

The mango tango spritzer was mango chucks, mango purée, mint leave, and club soda. Nothing really fancy about it.  I think we will come back and try the other desserts cause they all look so good.
author: Pei Pei G.

description: So BOMB. I've tried all the desserts there and I like all of them. I would definitely go back when I'm close by. The people working there are super nice as well.
author: Suzy Z.

description: Came here last night with my bf. I have been wanting to try this place for so long and have heard so many great things upon this spot. TRUST me, I will definitely be back for more. We were so full from dinner, but wanted to try the Matcha Lava Cake and the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu which was soooooo freaking delicious! I definitely recommend this place to people. The inside decor is super cute, clean, and small.
author: Loreah D.

description:
First thought: this is so overpriced, even for SF!! No way a tiny chocolate lava cake with a golf ball sized scoop of ice cream is worth $14 

(Like seriously did they custom order extra small ice cream scoopers... and why is a bottle of water $4)

Second thought: Holy shit please take all my money

The matcha chocolate lava cake is decadent without being excessively rich or heavy - it's definitely pre-prepared and warmed up to order, since it was served 3 minutes after ordering, but no complaints there. Lots of dense, fragrant matcha flavor in the "lava" that pairs perfectly with the dark, bittersweet chocolate cake.

Mango bingsoo was even better! Every ingredient was spot-on, from the incredibly fluffy bingsoo to the mango sauce, to the crushed pistachio topping. It was almost too sweet for a fruit dessert, but that's mostly because the ample amount of mango in the bingsoo is perfectly ripe - that stuff tasted like it was picked in the jungles of Indonesia a few hours earlier. 

Was it still too expensive at $30 for two desserts? Yes, but U:Dessert Story serves PREMIUM desserts that you'd be hard pressed to find anywhere else in the city. I'll absolutely be back again!
author: Andrew W.

description:
Heard about this place from a co-worker, tonight I decided to try, so I went with my better half. We went there, the line was out the door, I almost turn around and go home but my boyfriend said " we are here, it's ok let's try it" we got in line. The line moving pretty fast, we waited about 20mins, so worth it, the food and also the pics lol if you are an Instagram junky. 

We were watching the staffs working while waiting, they are FAST, great and friendly doesn't matter how Busy they are. We sit down, ordered our desserts, get it fast compare to how busy they are at the moment too. Presentation is BEAUTIFUL, desserts are delish-yum. 

I hope the owner can find a bigger place to open, they will make a lot more money. I wish this place has more room :) it was good and highly recommend everyone to try it. Pandan crepe is my favorite:)
author: Karrie C.

description:
A new dessert spot in the Castro. Everyone and their mother flocks here and had to give it a try since it was blowing up my Instagram feed. 

The Thai Crepe cake was good but overall lacked thai tea flavor! You had to put more sauce on the cake which made it really sweet. The Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo was the better choice of the two desserts ordered. Light fluffy snow and yummy sweet mangoes. 

4* bc it is pricey. $13 for a slice of cake? Damn you SF.

They take reservations now, so do yourself a favor and don't wait in line.
author: Angela D.

description:
The little baby sister to Kitchen Story (or more like twin, conjoined at the ...sidewalk?) 

It's a small space and you stand in line against a wall to order. I'm not so sure they have the layout figured out yet, seeing as the restroom is located halfway to the register. This means that a restroom line crosses perpendicularly to the line to order. It's weird but you'll get my frustration when you get there....

The menu is covered in "thick toast" and "shaved ice" desserts, which are the two staples in any HK dessert cafe. There is a bit of a San Francisco-hipster twist in its atmosphere and customer vibe though. The plants along the walls make it feel like you're in a sort of garden. 

While the menu may seem overwhelming, I'd recommend trying their Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu ($13) which is a mountain of fluffy, sweet, milky shaved ice, with juicy mango chunks and fixings like condensed milk and nuts! Incredibly refreshing during the summer season! 

My one gripe is their lack of crowd control and timely service. Their one server lost track of orders, which led to two other later parties getting served their mango ice mountain before I did. I thought that being a part of Kitchen Story would mean that the service would be different from what I'm used to getting at HK cafes. For the dessert experience, it's still worth the try, just know that it may take a little time. So settle in and enjoy!
author: Greg Y.

description: First time here. Servers are really nice and friendly. A bit noisy because it was kinda crowded. I ordered Thai Tea Crepe and it was SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD. I'm coming back tomorrow for the manga bingsu
author: Vi T.

description:
PROTIP: try to avoid nights on weekends! This place is packed.

That being said, the desserts are delicious and the service is quick and friendly! 
We came on a Friday night, and waited for about 30-40 minutes before we were seated. Ordered the matcha snow ice and triple flavor toast and they were served pretty quickly. The matcha snow was the perfect texture and light in flavor; a little pricey though. The triple toast was what really made the wait worth it! Soft bread with three fondues: pandan, thai tea, and taro - really unique flavors and so good! We finished the bread quickly and they were kind enough to give us another serving of bread after we asked since we had so much extra fondue left!

Also, shoutout to one of the male bussers! He was SO fast yet thorough, and really helped the flow of customers.
author: Christie T.

description:
Came here with a friend at around 2:30 on a Saturday and waited less than 10 minutes. We decided to order the matcha kakigori that comes with homemade red bean and dango, and it exceeded our expectations! We came in not expecting much, thinking it would be another typical over-hyped Asian dessert spot, but it was way better than we thought! 

The kakigori was super soft and light, and we expected only the "snow" on the outside to have the matcha flavor, but it was matcha throughout! I wanted to sink my whole face in it because it was so soft and melty in the mouth. The matcha taste was pretty strong and had that true bitter matcha flavor, which we both loved. It came with condensed milk, matcha syrup, and more red bean on the side. Their homemade red bean impressed me as well. It wasn't too sweet and I loved how they didn't mash it up too much so you could feel them individually, which offered a nice bite! The dango was a bonus -- perfectly chewy & sticky, and seemed to be covered in a yummy purple yam powder. The whole dessert wasn't too sweet at all, and I feel like they did justice to all the flavors represented in the dish.

I would definitely come back to try their other desserts!
author: Melody K.

description:
New dessert spot in the area located right next door to Kitchen Story. We came here on a weekday night within an hour before closing and there was still a line out the door. We were able to review the menu while in line so we could order right away once we sat down. They have assorted typical Asian desserts from shaved ice to sweet toast to crepe cake as well as different beverages.

We chose to go with the chocolate matcha lava cake, pandan coconut crepe cake, and honey toast. The first two desserts came out at the same time but the honey toast didn't come out later until we had already finished the other desserts which was unusual. First, the chocolate matcha cake had the warm chocolate inside with a scoop of green tea ice cream on the side. It was good but I have had better. The pandan coconut crepe cake was pretty much all coconut and even game with a coconut creme to dip/top it on the side. Finally, the honey toast was served with vanilla bean ice cream and was just normal. 

The desserts were average and the prices were a little high but it has a cool vibe to it so if you are in the area, check it out if you want something new.
author: Heng T.

description: I highly recommend making a reservation before heading over because they give priority to reservations. My husband and I didn't make reservations because we had plan​s beforehand so I wasn't sure what time we would get to the restaurant​ but we were seated after waiting for about 5 minutes. The line can get pretty long because while we ate, I saw the line go out the door. We ordered the mango sticky rice bingsu, matcha chocolate lava cake, blue lychee drink and matcha cream cheese tea. Out of the four, I highly recommend the bingsu and the blue lychee drink. The lava cake and the matcha cream cheese tea was mediocre. Although the staff was very friendly, I personally think everything was overpriced and the desserts were beautifully​ staged for pics only.
author: Ting Y.

description:
I went here with my friends and OMG! this place is freakin amazing! The venue was very small but felt very at home. The decor of the dessert restaurant had a lot of green but had a rustic style of interior design.

 It took us about 15 minutes for us to get seated even after putting in a reservation. After being seated we receive very nice customer service from the server. I don't remember the name but I remember he was able to give us a good amount of input on the different tastes of the dessert. 

I decided to go with the bread fondue and it was delicious! The bread was nice and fluffy to eat. The three flavored dips that it came with were Thai tea, Ube, and Pandan. I personally thought that the Thai tea dip was creative and had a better taste than the Ube or Pandan.

Overall, it's a very cute dessert place that works well for a date night.
author: Thien H.

description:
I'm so glad I decided to stop by during my day off! I came on a Friday around 1:45pm and the place was packed! I was able to get a seat without having to wait but there were only maybe 3 other empty tables left when I came in. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the Thai tea crepe cake and a strawberry cheesecake bingsoo. The cake was a small slice but enough for the both of us to share since we ordered another item. Very light and it was our first time trying a crepe cake! The strawberry cheesecake bingsoo took a bit longer but it was worth it! Definitely too big for just two people to share. I love that there were cheesecake bites inside!

I probably wouldn't come here on a weekly basis since it's a lot of $$ but it's a nice place to come with a group of friends if you're all craving dessert!
author: Benita L.

description:
This is not just any restaurant spin off. The owners of U : Dessert Story and Kitchen Story really exceeded my expectations for what a dessert experience should feel like. After seeing pics and stories on ig and reading online articles about their opening, I just knew I had to come here w my friends. The pictures do no justice to what the true experience feels like and what the desserts actually taste like at all!! The atmosphere and decor are phenomenal, to say the least. A lot of thought was put into designing not just the desserts, but the lighting, kitchen accessories, and overall vibe of the restaurant. 
The mango binsoo, when combined with rich condensed milk and mango puree, melts in your mouth with an assortment of colors that are made visible in the form of sweet love on your tastebuds.
The chocolate matcha lava cake is a sweet Earthy concoction that combines the bittersweet flavor of chocolate and matcha with the the doughy flavor of the brownie-like exterior.
The matcha floats are like nothing I've ever drank before; sweet to the core, and probably going to be the cause of diabetes for sure 
It's an experience worth having regardless of the price. The only nit I have is with the takeout menus being wrinkled up. They could use some laminate :)
author: Leo W.

description:
I love this place. I went yesterday and was very happy with everything. I ordered Thai tea crepe cake, matcha lava cake and the mango sticky rice Snow Ice. I was surprised that the rating today went down since I'm gonna go there again tonight to try out the other stuff on their menu. To my surprise, they have some recent bad reviews. This place deserves a 5 star for their hard work of making people who loves dessert happy. For the people who wrote bad reviews below me, you guys should open your own restaurant and let's see how you feel when you guys get 1 star yelp review after working 16 hours a day and spending so much money on expenses. Some people just feel so entitled when they are not entrepreneurs themselves. What happened to humanity?

Anyways, ditch the bad vibes and come to this place happy and ready to spend. If you can't afford it, then go to somewhere else you can. Don't come negative and hide your face behind the social media. If there's something wrong, talk to the manager. I love love love this place and I am definitely coming back tonight
author: Sherry C.

description: Looking so nice!! yummy and pretty, as a dessert, I'm sure I fall in love with this store!!!
author: Faye L.

description:
Tasty, fancy, generously portioned, and pricey desserts. We got the Thai tea crepe cake ($13) and the mango sticky rice toast ($13). As a side note, this place does not sell crepes, just crepe cake.

Thai tea crepe cake: Thin layers of crepes and whipped cream served with a Thai tea sauce (black tea + condensed milk), a blob of whipped cream, and half a strawberry. It was not too sweet. It's very rich and mostly tastes like whipped cream.

Mango sticky rice toast: I really liked this. It's a hunk of toast carved into a bowl. Inside the bowl are toast cubes topped with whipped cream (a huge amount), mango sorbet, and fresh mango. On the side you have sticky rice, granola, mango sauce, and condensed milk. I really liked how many textures and flavors there were, and it was an awful lot of food, so I'd say it's more worth the price than the cake.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I can't believe still after weeks, my husband speaks about this place! You can't believe how sturdy he is with food. He doesn't like Chinese, sushi, Japanese. He is much more simple;) and he hates waiting. 
There was like 40 min. Wait. Place is small but cozy. Really enjoyed the interior design and being able to see cooks, makes me trust the place! 

I don't remember what we order but please see photos! I am not chocolate person, but my husband ordered smth like brownie flow, he loved loved it! 

I ordered their most popular dessert with mango and Oolang Tea! 

Presentation is really spot on! 
I teally don't think the tea is "original" , it felt like a "tea bag" from store! 

And I love books, so receiving books with bill, is a good addition :)
author: Angela K.

description: I was excited to try this place out because of all the pictures I've seen from friends. I love Asian desserts and everything looks delicious. The 2 desserts that I ordered were the toast fondue that comes with ube, matcha, and Thai tea flavored condensed milk to dip the pieces of toast in and the Thai tea layered crepe cake. Each dessert costed $12 so it's quite pricey for what you get. I enjoyed the Thai tea crepe but was not that impressed with the toast fondue. For the price paid, I don't think it's worth it. I'd only be back with friends who haven't been here before.
author: Ashley C.

description:
We recently found out about this place and are ecstatic that Castro has an "asian" dessert place. Was getting tired of just Cookie and ice cream. 
The location can be difficult if you are trying to find parking. Interior is nice, clean, and refreshing. 
When ordering, staff was really helpful in picking out items. They have some stuff for people who love fruity type desserts and others who tend to go for more chocolatey things. 
All the desserts are plated on a sliver of tree trunk with scattered petals along it. Great plating and visually pleasing to the eyes (aka Instagram worthy ). 
Haven't had a dessert I wasn't satisfied with. My favorite is the Matcha Lava cake; an explosion of flavor! I like that their bingsu dishes come with additional side bowl ingredients so you can kind of customize and add according to your preferences. 
I definitely recommend this place. People have been asking the bf and me about it and we have nothing but good things to say. Definitely going back to try the others!
author: Christian N.

description: My friend and I came around 6/7pm on a Tuesday night so I'm glad to say that there was no line in sight! After much consideration (and clarification from the friendly waiter about the difference between Japanese and Korean shaved ice), we settled on the mango sticky rice bingsoo. Honestly my mind was blown - it completely eclipsed my previous mango bingsoo experience from a dessert place in LA called Meetfresh that was severely disappointing (but that's a Yelp review for another time) - the presentation was absolutely gorgeous. Separate tiny bowls held extra pistachios/nuts, mango puree (?), condensed milk, and actual sticky rice (which in itself was again garnished with cream and nuts!!)..then, the actual bingsoo was a beautifully fluffy and huge mountain of condensed milk snow (the shavings were so light that they instantly melted on your tongue, leaving a wisp of sweet milk taste), surrounded by glossy mango pieces, topped with swirls of mango sauce and a mint leaf. It was so incredibly thoughtful how they layered all the toppings within the ice as well so it was still equally flavorful inside, and even moreso to have the extra toppings on the side for you to add yourself. And after everything else there were crushed flower petals dusting the whole thing. This dessert went above and beyond both in taste and aesthetics!
author: Shelley P.

description: The best bingsu I've had so far. I ordered the mango sticky rice bingsu and matcha lava cake. Presentation was so cute, I couldn't eat the bingsu right away
author: Francesca R.

description: The desserts and service are very good - definitely eat them fresh (don't take it to go). However be prepared to be surrounded by obnoxious millennials taking forever to take a picture for social media instead of immediately stuffing their faces. You've been warned.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Best dessert  place in SF  highly recommended. 
So delicious and creative. Good services too.
author: Aimee J.

description: delicious Thai tea Lava toast U dessertstory  golden, caramelized toast (love how they hollow out the bread and serve it back in it) with whipped cream, a scoop of Thai tea ice cream and topped with sliced almonds and condensed milk drizzle. Dreamy  tried their mango shaved ice and pandan crepe cake too - both are tasty!
author: Weich Y.

description:
*** In Short ***

Cute cafe serving up tasty, shareable Asian treats.

*** In Depth ***

From the folks that brought you Kitchen Story and Farmhouse Thai, comes, well, another tasty Asian venture, this time, entirely focused on desserts! Like Kitchen Story next door, their offerings pull from a number of Asian countries, including Japan, Korean, and of course, Thailand.

Most of the desserts are fairly substantial and probably meant to be shared, but who's to judge you if you want it all to yourself? And like the decor of the cafe itself (which is cute, if not a bit discombobulated), effort is put into the presentation of the food as well.

Their mango sticky rice bingsoo is definitely one of the more noteworthy items, with a hefty serving of snow ice accompanied by a quartet of sides, including sticky rice. Meanwhile, their Thai Tea Crepe Cake is less impressive, though this could just be my own bias against crepe cake.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - The cafe is on the smaller, more squished side, with seating comprised mostly of regular tabletops, and a handful of high top bar seats. Accessibility will likely vary depending on how busy they are at the time, but there ARE accessible options.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
We went on opening week and the service was disarrayed, as can be expected for a new establishment. What got me, though, was the audacity of charging $12 for a slice of toast or cake - that seemed... egregious? They were pretty good cakes, no doubt, but still. Unless they're slinging Michelin dessert magic like B Patisserie I don't see this being worth it (FYI, B Patisserie is a lot cheaper, and so is Thorough Bread down the street).

The major selling point is the friendly staff and the late night hours (such a blessing in this neighborhood!). Otherwise, for a price of toast here you can get a whole bowl of premium hand-made ramen at Orenchi Beyond half a mile away. Something about this does not sit right.
author: Ken H.

description:
Perhaps the most popular place to get Asian desserts in the city. You can see the line from a block away.

U :Dessert Story looks like the cute dessert spot you've dreamt of, but perhaps too much. If you look too closely, you can tell the place really wants you to post every wall/angle of the place to Instagram. It makes the place feel quite tacky and tells you that this place is part of the trend of restaurants that focus more on aesthetics rather than the food.

When it comes to places with such long lines as these, I can't help but think "Is this place really worth the wait? Am I here because of the food or is it just a photo op?". It's not like the dishes being served here are experimental, risky, or unpredictable at all. Mango shaved ice, chocolate lava cake, multi-layered crepe cake, we know these desserts and what to expect. They do these dishes quite well, and I can't complain about anything in terms of the food. However, it took about 20 minutes to get a piece of lava cake after sitting down to order.

It's not really worth the wait unless you really want to take nice pictures of the food and show off that you've been here, and there is definitely nothing wrong with that! It's just not the type of place I would make repeat visits to.
author: Tommy T.

description: Service was really nice. We came here after eating our anniversary meal, and wanted something cold and plenty for dessert. The vibe was relaxing, and it was cute seeing families and friends gathered. We ordered the mango bingsoo, and although it was delicious, it was hard to see the price ($13.50) after living in Koreatown the last three years. Shaved ice is not a joke in LA, and it's hard to find decent shaved ice in SF. The presentation was beautiful, but I'm sure if it wasn't for the extra added sides, it should be about $10 or less (in my opinion).
author: Hannah C.

description:
SUPER CUTE MATCHA HEAVEN IN SF!!!! Can't wait to come back for more! Too bad they're sold out of a few things today, but the matcha latte was soooo good!! 

Only open for a month and the line @9PM was out the door!

Congratulations! 5 Stars!!!
author: Emily L.

description: I have been this place three times. The desserts looks so beautiful. I shared the plates with my friends cuz it is too much for one person per order. Before 7:45 pm, you can make an reservation. After that time, you have to wait on line, but it is not take too long. It is about 15 to 20 minutes.
author: Theresa Y.

description:
After complaining about the service..... I completely take it all back because the matcha chocolate lava cake is one of the best things I have ever tried!! 

We just had dinner and came for some desert, but I suggest you come still a bit on the hungry side because they look so big and filling. We beat the crowd, but 10 minutes into sitting down around 8pm, there was a line forming outside of the door! The decoration inside was also super cute and cozy, and perfect for photo opportunities!

I can't wait to come back and try all the other things on the menu!
author: Kassie E.

description:
It was a hot day in SF so my boyfriend and I went to U :Dessert Story to cool off with some dessert. Unfortunately, the store doesn't have AC so it was unbearably hot in there. I almost wanted to leave but decided to stay since we made the drive out here.

The dessert and drink items are on the pricier side so we opted for the bingsu because it seemed like we'd get more bang for our buck. We got the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu that came with condensed milk, mango puree, nuts, and sticky rice on the side. I love that they provide sides because it adds more flavor to the dessert. They really put a lot of effort into the presentation of their desserts!

I have to dock a star because the service was subpar. Although we got seated immediately, it took them a while to take our order, bring out our dessert, and give us the check. We were sitting at the bar by the window and I literally had to turn my whole body around and wait for a worker to notice me before someone finally came over and asked if we needed anything. I noticed that the person next to us received more attention and faster service than we did and we arrived at the same time.
author: Alika N.

description:
This place does so, so well with food aesthetics and decor!! My girlfriend and I stopped by here to start our July 4th and ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Toast and Thai Tea Crepe Cake. Our total came out to be almost $30 for just the two desserts, but you pay for aesthetics right? Service was fair as there only seemed to be two-three waiters/servers working the shift, and our desserts didn't take longer than half an hour to come out. 

The Mango Sticky Rice Toast was much better than any honey/brick toast I've had in the bay and was a nice size for sharing between two. On the other hand, the cake slice was much smaller than we expected it to be, the Thai tea frosting tasted a bit off, and the cake itself wasn't as soft/moist as I'd hoped--if you've had Lady M crepe cakes before, you'll be disappointed by these (especially for the $10 price). Neither of the desserts wowed me in taste, but the toast is still worth a try!

Would come back again to try some of their other offerings! One star off though because it IS a bit overpriced (although this is the city) and it might take a bit of time to get a server's attention.
author: Claire L.

description:
TL;DR - Excellent food, horrible service.

Based on the food alone, I'd give this place 5 stars.  

BUT the service was crappy and the HAIR I found in my melon bingsoo drops this rating to 3 stars. I get it, mistakes happen. No biggie. BUT the waitress' response when we showed her the long hair buried in our bingsoo was horrifying. She pulled it out like it was a feather in a down jacket, threw it on the floor, and walked away! She left the bingsoo on the table without a single word, no apology, and WALKED AWAY. When my mother brought the dish up to the counter to ask if they were going to bring us a replacement, the waitress responded, "but you already ate most of it"! 

Um, no. That is not an acceptable response. The waitress said they would bring us another, but they never did (though they did take if off the bill).

Would I come back for the delicious bingsoo and crepe cake? Sadly, yes. I guess yummy food beats out "hairy" service. Sigh.
author: L C.

description:
Came here to try out with my friend. The thing that attracts me here is the decor of the food, the way how they present their food, the wooden block plates and flower flakes make the overall finish of the dessert looks really nice and pleasant. It makes you feel happy before you even eat it. And to my surprise, the dessert actually taste delicious too, not over sweeten. Their menu is really special too. I beg you have tried toast and crepe cake before, but the flavor they have here are rare- like mango sticky rice, coconut pandon and even Thai tea flavor. The only thing that I think they need to improve is the preparation time of the food, it took like 30 mins for our dessert to come. 

Observation from my visit: a lot of people choose to celebrate birthday here, employee will put up candles on your dessert and sang happy birthday song, the atmosphere was really good. Not a bad idea to celebrate your friend/ family's birthday here
author: Hiu H.

description:
This little cute dessert place has some decent sweets to offer! I did order the ice-cream toast 
and thai tea ice cream. It was so flavorful!
Not that many dessert places in SF are offered the ice cream toast like this place.
I definitely come back for more!
author: cathaleeya K.

description:
Been here twice in one weekend because it was so good! The desserts were absolutely amazing! Pretty pricey but it's nice that you can sit down and enjoy them. 

The first time I was there, we ordered the matcha lava cake and the Thai tea toast. The matcha lava cake was warm and the presentation was A+. The Thai toast was very interesting. They cut a slit in the toast so the Thai tea sauce flooded out of the toast. Very creative! The sauce was very sweet so we couldn't finish it. 

The second time I went, we ordered the Thai tea crepe cake and the matcha shaved ice. The crepe cake was so light and fluffy! As for the matcha shaved ice, you could really taste the matcha. It wasn't very sweet, but combined with the red bean and condensed milk, it was amazing.
author: Kristine C.

description:
One of the finest dessert places around! We have tried Honey toast at several places, this was by far the best. The place is always buzzing with people and every table has something fascinating coming their way! Chic decor, friendly servers and LONG wait times, but totally worth it.
They have some really awesome desserts that are served in decorative platters. We had the adffogato and honey toast; both of which were amazing. 
Going back to try their Thai Tea Crepe cake.
author: HCfoodler C.

description:
I've seen this place w| a line out the door, so i knew i had to check it out. 

Got SUPER lucky, made reservations but walked right up in that G-Thang and got a table for two. 

We order the : Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu and Strawberry Cheesecake Yogurt Kakigori Bingsu.

Now, YES that was far too much for two people. Clearly we were just excited to finally trying out this place. But, it was BOMB.COM.! 
We couldn't finish both, but we sure tired. 

The place looks small but i believe there's a whole "dinning" area in the back. They do have to-go ordering which is good but if you're lucky enough to get a table , enjoy it there. 

i will for sure be back for more!
author: Silvia R.

description: Great cafe JUST for the aesthetics! The presentation of all the drinks and desserts are amazing and are great for instagram photos. However, the desserts itself were mediocre. The price is on the higher end (over $12 for a slice of crepe cake), and you're definitely pay for the aesthetics. The seating area is very limited and they try to squeeze you into a shared table. It also gets very stuffy inside, especially if you come at a busy time on the weekends. I highly recommend that you make a reservation if you don't want to be waiting in line to get in. The one thing I really enjoyed was their Iced Americano, which was not too bitter and was refreshing.
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description: Came in an hour before closing on Friday night. Only had to wait 10 min to be seated. Had the earl grey cheese tea, matcha lava cake, and the mango sticky rice bingsoo. Everything was great including the service.
author: Vincent T.

description:
Date & Time:  Monday May 14, 2018 @ 5:30pm 
Dessert Date:  The Husband 
Scene:  Couples in Off-the-Shoulder Tops, Skinny Ankle Jeans + Booties or LBD's w/ White Sneakers or Allbirds.  The City Needs a Quality Late-Night Dessert Spot
Music:  EDM
Decor:  Adorable Instagram Ready Dessert Shop w/ Logo Walls.  Order at The Counter- You'll Want One of Everything, Grab a Number & Settle into One of The Benches Over-Looking 16th St., or if Your w/ A Group Snag a Table at The Back of The Shop or if your Lucky the Communal Table in The Alcove- In a Few Short Moments your Delectable Desserts Will Be Delivered to You- Get Ready to Indulge. 
Service:  Friendly, Welcoming, Attentive w/ Warmth & Hospitality Perfected By Thai People
Imbibe:  Cheese Tea
Devour:  Coconut Pandan Crepe Cake, Strawberry Cheese Cake Yogurt Kakigori(bingsu shaved ice) & Triple Flavor Fondue w/ Thai Ice Tea, Green Tea & Taro.  Unique, IG Worthy Desserts
Total:  $42.08
Note:  Brought to You By The People of Kitchen Story
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
I tried this place for the first time with my girlfriend and my father-in-law last weekend.

The atmosphere was nice. It was clean and creative. The place attracts a lot of young people, teenagers and early 20s. It was a good experience overall.

Their bingsu resembled what you would be able to find in Seoul with soft crushed ice. Everything we tried was delicious but more on the pricier side.

Recommend for special occasions. The place is also close to Dolores park so you can take a walk afterwards!
author: Daniel B.

description:
So finally made my stop. Let me preface that my rating for dessert is a 4.5; the drinks and everything else a 1.  So my score is around a 3.5 stars.

Lets start with the desserts:
So we ordered the pandan crepe cake, thai toast, and strawberry cheesecake yogurt bingsu.

The pandan crepe cake was 3/5. Was pretty good flavor, but texture was weird with the creme. The creme was thick and chunky; something silkier would be better for the crepe cake and finer texture. 

The strawberry bingsu: this was pretty bomb bingsu. The snow ice is PERFECTT. I cant wait to try the mango sticky rice one.

THE TOAST: My favorite thing. The crunch, the flavor. Perfect bite of taiwanese toast. I really love thai tea so the flavor was on point.

Service is super attentive and nice and pleasant.

Now onto the cons:

The drinks. Definitely a thumbs down. They made me a hot instead of a cold matcha latte, but quickly corrected. But the latte itself was overall on the heavy side, matcha then a heavy layer of whipped cream makes it overbearing and too heavy to drink. The additional matcha powder on top really added to the heaviness as well. This was one of those "it looks hella Instagramable but was a let down." 

Butterfly pea latte- the milk was burnt. Pretty straightforward on this one. Also butterfly pea latte? It's pretty floral and aromatic tea and a delicate ingredient. It's really being overwhelmed by coffee and milk. I was genuinely intrigued by
It; but also a bit of a disappointment and I couldn't tell if it was because of the pairing or because of the burnt milk. 


The setting- So if you haven't seen already, a lot of the display setting is set on a wood plating;  however upon my visit and receiving my order there was a pretty bad odor coming off those boards. The smell was from the board setting and having that smelly sweat smell from not being dried right after being washed and retaining the odor. Im glad that it came with my drink and I hadnt ordered with the cake. I had them send back the boards back after getting the drinks but having them sit there for a few minutes was kind of off putting with all the amazing desserts sitting in front.


Overall desserts yes definitely come; I will be back to try some other desserts for sure myself. I will probably avoid drinks for now.
author: Tay N.

description:
I was loaded with carbs after eating at Nagi so might as well adding some sugar to complete my diet for the day, and that's how I ended up at U:DS.  

U:DS offers some pretty grammable desserts from Korean bingsu to lava cake to crepe cakes.  I was craving for sticky mango rice and the weather was warm enough to warrant this snowy dessert so Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu it was ($13).  It came in a presentable tray with U:DS engraved on the handle.  Aside from the main bowl of snow ice, there were extra mango sauce, sweetened crisps/nuts(?), condensed milk, and sticky rice so you can add to the remaining snow ice after eating midway through it and that is a very thoughtful idea.  

Very friendly staff and it's a nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Shirley H.

description:
This is a new dessert spot in SF. I was attracted by the cute dessert pictures I've seen online, and traveled several miles to try this place. The design of the store is very artistic with nice lightings and decors and also soothing French music, it's a great place to catch up with friends and for some Instagram photos. 

As expected, each individual dessert is unique in its own way, and this kind of dessert hard to find in SF. We ordered a matcha lava cake with matcha ice cream. It was the best dessert I've had in awhile! The lava was matcha so it was really pretty and the sweetness and bitterness was just the right balance. We also ordered a Thai crepe cake, which was also really good. It came with some Thai tea sauce and surprisingly it wasn't too sweet. We also had a mango sticky rice bingsoo, which is a Korean style shaved ice. They served the shaved ice with 4 different toppings on the side and some rose petals on the serving board, which was a really cute design. I'd definitely come back to try their matcha love series. The only down side is that the desserts are a little pricy. Each dessert costs around $13. Otherwise, I'd come back more often.
author: Maylene F.

description:
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The moment we got out of the car and started crossing the street towards dessert story, I noticed it was next to Kitchen Story, one of my favorite brunch spots that I hate waiting 2 hours to eat at . 

Thankfully, this dessert place didn't have a huge line out the door. (In fact, we got seated immediately!) I suppose it's because it was a Tuesday night at around 9pm. They're opened till midnight so it's a perfect place to chillax and catchup with some friends, tea, and desserts.

As I walk through the door into Dessert Story, I instantly felt like I stepped into a k-town/LA Korean cafe. The atmosphere and decor inside are SUPER cute! By cute, I mean a mix between chic and hipster (wall of succulents, cute and fresh flowers, a wall of polaroids on a string, cute chairs that are made of metal buckets, etc.) it's the kind of place where you would make your significant other take a million IG photos of you in... I mean, that's what I did (although the SO has a track record of taking bad pictures )

I looked through the menu and chose two items that appealed to me the most: Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo ($13?) and the Thai Iced Tea Mille Crepe Cake ($12). To go with those, I also got a cup of Hojicha tea ($5). The total was kind of of ridiculous for just desserts but when you eat that mango sticky rice bingsoo... it's suddenly worth it. I will come back again and again for that bingsoo! 

The Mille crepe cake was not amazing to me but it did have great texture. I have a bit of a sweet tooth and the Thai tea crepe cake was not sweet enough for me (despite drizzling the sauce it came with and left over condensed milk over the cake). It does have good tea flavor though so not complaining!

Overall, the photogenic desserts were not only pretty, but they were delicious as well! I will bring extra stomach space next time to try the rest of the desserts on their menu. And hopefully it won't get as popular as Kitchen Story because I sure don't want to wait 2 hours for desserts!
author: Carin S.

description:
Ah, I'm so happy I get to write a review about this dessert place!  If you know me I absolutely LOVE desserts.  It's very aesthetic and spacious.  We devoured everything - will definitely be coming back to try other desserts.  
Ordered:  triple flavor fondue ($12), mango sticky rice bingsu ($13)
author: Mikayla M.

description: Must get desserts! This place is so good. We got to try matcha mile crepe for the first time even before they put it on the menu, and it was superb! I like it more than LadyM. The matcha sauce and the red bean sauce were so good, not too sweet and not overwhelming. Must try!
author: Waraporn T.

description:
This place is packed but once u get seated its super fast. It's very good too I love the coconut pandan cake and the strawberry cheesecake bingsoo. I was very sad that they ran out of the sticky rice mango bingsoo though :/ really wanted to try it will come again!

Edit: I ended up coming back for the mango bingsoo and it was bomb
author: Onyx L.

description:
We came here right after a light dinner at the Jasmine Garden - we knew the portions for some of the desserts here would be small from the photos.

A waitress seated us and gave us menus. As we waited in the cute cafe atmosphere we were served basil and strawberry infused water.

My friend got the crepe cake and I got the Thai Tea Lava toast cuz I just had a papaya salad and it's chilly out...

It's pride so this week they only serve the rainbow crème crêpe and they offered a choice of strawberry sauce or earl grey infused chocolate sauce.

I almost got a cheese tea as well but I'm glad I didn't cuz when the lava cake arrived it was a lot bigger than I thought. I don't think most people can eat the whole thing by themselves. I personally ate perhaps exactly half of it and my friend ate almost half of the rest and we had leftovers.

The crepe cake slice is as small as shown in the pictures. We think $12.75 for a slice is pretty steep even for SF... does Tartine even charge that much for a slice of cake? The earl grey infused chocolate sauce was very tasty, however. I would have been interested in trying the coconut crepe cake too.

Dessert here was more expensive than our dinners... but all in all it's your usual $$ SF food. The lava cake really knocked us out. 

I'm docking a star because the food is definitely not good value (tbh I've never eaten anything good value in SF except for when I cook it myself ).
author: Mei Mei C.

description:
I think this is my new to-go dessert place ! 

It's a pretty small place. You order at the counter and they'll give you number and will bring the dessert to you. You can choose where to sit. Water is also provided. 

I ordered the Mango sticky rice Bingsoo and it was delicious!! Juicy mangos with mango purée on the side. It also comes with additional condensed milk, granola and the sticky rice.  Snow is perfect fluffiness. Definitely enough for 2-3 people.  

5 stars for presentation and aesthetics.  Perfect for Instagram posts. :D 


Will definitely be coming back to try everything else on their menu!
author: Rose K.

description:
The manager wrote back as you guys can see.  I think that should be fine but they should have written it on the menu and let the customers know that tips was included in the check.

*******Don't you guys think that's tricky??????*******
author: Monkey M.

description:
This dessert place was very good. I was craving dessert on a late Sunday evening while driving home, and to my surprise i came across dessert story around 9pm at night. 

There was a long line out of the door, so i figured this place must be amazing. I asked to order to go so i was able to by past the long line and enjoy my dessert in the comfort of my new car 

I must say, i most definitely will return. The place looks like it's great for a cute date night. Now I have to find a date ‍
author: Jamar M.

description:
I finally went here on a Wednesday afternoon. Upon entering, I was immediately helped and got seated. The menu has plenty of tempting options; all the more reason to come back! 

I decided on the matcha float and the Thai ice tea crepe cake. Presentation is stellar here! The matcha float and Thai Ice tea crepe cake came out with actual rose petals. 

The Matcha was subtly flavored yet sweet. The Thai ice tea crepe, along with the side of sauce, had enough flavoring to taste the Thai tea. 

I am very happy with the service, desserts, and cute seating arrangements here .  ^ . ^
author: Brenda B.

description:
I came here for the first time with a party of 10, and I was very impressed by the service! We were seated immediately at 2pm on a Sunday and ordered:
- Mango sticky rice bingsoo
- Young coconut pandan crepe cake
- Thai tea crepe cake 
- Honey brick toast 

The desserts were delicious, and they were easy to share amongst everyone! The servers were also really nice and always came by our table to refill our water cups.

I would definitely come here again for more dessert =]
author: Emily Y.

description:
It's about time a place like this opened in SF! This will be my go to spot from now on for refreshing,
creative desserts, not to mention a cute ambience. We arrived at around 8 and didn't have to wait in line before being seated. Our group of three ordered a total of four items: the matcha latte, chocolate tea, mango sticky rice shaved ice, and the thai tea crepe cake. I can't speak for the chocolate tea, but the other three items were delicious! Matcha latte was standard, nothing special other than a dollop of matcha ice cream on top, but that doesn't mean it wasn't great. Thai tea crepe cake was really interesting and yummy, but probably a one-time thing for us. My personal favorite was the shaved ice - the shaved ice itself was a lovely texture, the mangoes were perfectly ripe and sweet, and the side toppings it came with (condensed milk, savory sticky rice, mango purée, and sweetened nuts) were all fantastic and really complemented the shaved ice well. Looking forward to many more trips here!
author: Sophia W.

description: hands down one of the best dessert shops i've been to. i'd recommend putting yourself on the wait list or else you'll be stuck waiting a very long time; either way, i'd say that it's well worth the wait. the desserts are just good, they're unique. i've never had a boba bingsoo (korean shaved ice) before, and the quality and aesthetics of the place were off the chart. i think if you're in san francisco, this should be one of those "must-try" spots!
author: Maya S.

description:
I'm not sure how Thai people do Korean food and desserts so well, but I'm not complaining!

The atmosphere inside is super cute and cozy, with a good amount of seats.  We ordered the Thai tea crepe cake, melon bingsoo, and a cheese tea.  The crepe cake was solid and the cheese tea is excellent, a really thick and rich cheese topping.  

I'm so excited that SF finally has a good bingsoo place.  I did wish that the melon bingsoo had a little more going on, it was cantaloupe, snow, condensed milk, shaved almonds, and melon ice cream.  A lot of ingredients, but similar tastes.  I think it would've benefited from granola instead of shaved almonds and maybe some rice cake or red bean for texture.

Wait staff is so nice!  They came to check up on us multiple times to refill our waters and ask how we were doing.

Tips and Tricks
-Busy at 8pm on a Tuesday, but seats available
-Will def be back to try the strawberry bingsoo!
-Non caffeinated tea not available when we visited
author: Jessica L.

description:
I honestly could rant about the interesting flavors, cloudlike melty but soft shaved iced options, and fluffy crepe cakes~ but I'm confident that you should just get. yo. ass. to this spot and try it yourself.

You deserve it. 

Treat yo self.

cLoUd.Like shaved ice with Greek yogurt creme thingy and fruit and sweetened condensed milk.

Oh also, the service is always good when I come here, very pleasant people .
author: Jechri D.

description:
Atmosphere and decor: very clean, open, and the space is bigger than I expected. I liked the hanging greenery, wooden table and decor, and white contrast against the wood. It wasn't over the top but very thought out. 

Dessert: we chose to share the matcha bingsu between the 3 of us because it seemed reasonable. It was a matcha flavored shaved ice with purple dusted mochi pieces on a stick, redbean on top and on the side, condensed milk on the side, and a sweet milky matcha syrup-like condiment on the side. I really enjoyed the matcha bingsu because it felt light and refreshing and seemed like the perfect dessert after a big heavy meal. The shaved ice hardly seemed sweet which was fine because the sweet side condiments allowed you to control the sweetness level and I appreciated that! The purple mochi was delightfully chewy but the purple dust overdid it for me because it tasted floral - maybe like a rose flavor and I didn't like that too much. Overall the dessert was 5/5 still! 

Service: this is where it goes downhill for me. My two friends and I got seated fairly quickly and when the waitress came to take our order, we said we'd all share the matcha bingsu and she said "That's it?!" To which we replied "yeah, that's all we'll start with for now!" After about 15 minutes, she quickly walked over to us and asked "You want anything else?" To which we replied "no, that's all we'll have." She just made it seem like it was wrong for us to come and sit down for just one dessert, but the dessert, we thought was quite a large portion size. When we got our dessert, the person who set our dessert down did it so quickly and haphazardly that our stick of mochi completely fell as soon as it was set on the table messing up the shaved ice. The pretty dessert no longer looked as pretty :( lastly, as we were finishing our dessert, our waitress came by and asked "Are you done?" And feeling rushed we said yes. She quickly came by again with our check. It was pretty busy and so I get that they would probably want to get us out as soon as possible for others to be seated and served but it felt rude to us to be treated so carelessly. Perhaps, it was just an off day for our waitress or maybe she didn't know she came off rudely, but my other two friends also felt like we were not treated well as customers. 2/5 for customer service. 

All in all, I am willing to come again to try other items because the dessert was so tasty, but I wasn't too happy about service. However, it may have just been an off day for them, so we'll see! Hopefully I'll have a positive update once I go a couple more times.
author: Christina C.

description:
First experience was A+ 

Service was great 

Dessert presentation was A+ 
Love their little details

Quality dessert, Thai, Korean, Japanese Style.

A great place to hangout !
author: Mack A.

description:
First time here and really love the atmosphere here. They just opened so it's little slow service and also had electrical outage several times in the kitchen. However, all the food presentation and taste are really outstanding. We ordered coconut pandan crepe cake and it's fresh and not too sweet to dip with Thai coconut sauce . Really creative in a way. The toast cube with ice cream and fruits are trending dessert in Asia and you can found it here as well. Haven't got chance to try Korean shave ice here and will definitely come back here to try other items here. 

By the way, first time to see Thai Tea crepe cake here. Really attempting and I will need a bigger stomach next time.
author: Jenny C.

description: Great dessert, but the service isn't that great. I came here with my friend on a Sunday at around 3pm, and the place was crowded, with a line out the door. There is seating in the front, as well as a little more in the back. Since it was just me and my friend, we were seated immediately since there was a small empty table that was available.
