We quickly ordered, since we knew what we wanted. While we were waiting for our dish, people who were seated after us got their dishes before us, making us wonder about our order. We waited half an hour before we mentioned anything to the servers, and once we did, we got our dish within 5 min. making us think there was a miscommunication. Because the servers don't have set particular roles (they all rotate amongst seating customers, taking orders, serving customers so not one person does a single role), there was definitely room for miscommunication and errors. The servers were great, but the service model is not up to par. We got the strawberry cheesecake shaved ice was amazing, and the portions were big for 2 people. There's condensed milk and strawberry syrup on the side that you can pour in as you chip away the shaved ice. Overall, the food was great (definitely recommend the food!), but the service style was not.
author: Lisa C.

description: I never leave reviews (I think this is my very first one) but what does that say about the mango bingsoo? TO DIE FOR. $13 seems pricey for a shaved ice, but it's very big and good to split with one or two other people. I love the small separate bowls so that the toppings aren't eaten at the beginning and can be more customized for each persons preference. Highly recommend!
author: Emily J.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon and the wait wasn't too long. The place is longer than it looks so there's definitely seating in the back (thank god). The inside is really cute and decorated like a patio/garden but it does get a little warm with the kitchen and all of the people so be sure to get something cold or dress in layers!

We got the mango with sticky rice bingsoo and a thai tea brick toast. The food was great and really delicious. This is the only place that I've seen does sticky rice bingsoo and they do brick toast right. The only con is that it took a long time for the waitress to take our order and bring us our check. They were really overwhelmed but other than that, the food is great!
author: Irene T.

description: The staff here are so nice and attentive! Came in with as a group of 5, seated at the back, sorta-private area of the place. We knew that we had to try everything that sounded good and we pretty much ordered what was available. Sadly, they didn't have the earl grey cake that I really wanted to try, but I'm not docking stars for that since every other item in their menu was excellent. The presentation of the dessert was mouth-watering and the taste was amazing. Would definitely come back, maybe once in a while-- can't have too much dessert!
author: Kondo J.

description:
Wow!!! So good!!! 


Great desserts and relaxing atmosphere. There really aren't too many dessert places left in the area so I'm glad this place opened. Looking forward to stumbling in here after drinks.
author: Dimitriy N.

description: Never had churros this good! Paired with Berry powder and drinkable chocolate to dip in
author: Elpie K.

description: My boyfriend and I decided to look up a dessert spot before leaving San Francisco. I came across U :Dessert Story and saw that they had amazing ratings and gave it a try. This place did not disappoint and was well worth the 40 minute wait. We ordered the Mango Sticky Rice. I was definitely contemplating on ordering seconds. For you Instagram maniacs, this is the place for you. The atmosphere reminds me of a cute vintage Pinterest. The service is amazing too. We were serve within two minutes of being seated and got our snow ice within five minutes. We found another favorite snack/dessert spot in the city and 10/10 recommend.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I got the Thai tea crepe cake and the matcha float while I was here! The crepe cake was pretty good and so was the matcha float, but definitely a little overpriced. It's ok though, EVERYTHING was so aesthetically pleasing inside I'll let it slide. 

Overall this place is definitely a cute foodie spot to get nice ig pictures and a sweet tooth fix :) 

Also, I saw a crazy dessert that was piled with sweet stuff and had dry ice coming out of it while I was waiting to be seated. I wanted to try it but I'm sure it's pricey and I only had one other person there with me to help me finish it haha 10/10 on their dessert plating and displays though, they all look very cute!
author: Maggie K.

description:
This place was a great find. We saw the crepe cake photo and decided this was a shop we wanted to stop by for dessert. We made a great decision.

When we got there we were seated immediately. There are also tables towards the back of the restaurant. We looked through the menu and made our order. We ordered four items. All the desserts were delicious. Sweet but not too sweet. Great for a summer day. 

The customer service was great. It was a friend's birthday and we started to sing happy birthday and the employees chimed in. The cutest ever! And they were also glad to take a photo for us (they have a photo wall.) 

I can't wait to visit again. It was truly worth it and very instagram ready. You must try the kakigori!!! You won't be disappointed. Yummy!
author: Henry And Nalee B.

description: I ordered the most popular desserts which are the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo & the Thai Tea Crepe Cake. I've got to say, i enjoyed every bite of it. The mango was so sweet & the toppings that came with it goes perfectly well with the shaved ice & mango. The sticky rice was a bit on the hard side (for me) but it was still pretty good. The thai tea crepe cake was so light and airy. However, it was kind of different for me since i'm used to drinking thai tea instead of eating it. Maybe next time i'll try the earl grey lavender crepe cake! Overall, this dessert cafe is a must & I will definitely be coming back. :-)
author: Bea A.

description: Finally a good dessert spot with good presentation and flavors, I've been twice and tried there bingsoo and kakigori plus the crepe cakes and drinks..most people will think it's a little on the pricey side but the ingredients and time spent on each dessert shows in the presentation..plus it tastes good lol no to sweet but just right,also I would like to point out you gotta let the matcha float sit for a little bit so the ice cream can melt and bend with the rest of the drink...so good
author: jonathan h.

description: This is a spectacular establishment of voluntary obesity. The deserts are so beautifully served that you just have to take a minute and get a photo for the Instagram. Then after about 5 minutes of contemplating how good it's going to be because it's unlike anything you have ever seen before. You decide to meticulously operate on your desert, slowly enjoying the sorcery that is occurring inside your mouth that can only be equated to a mouthgasm. After taking that sweet delicious bite you wash it down with a dirty matcha that leaves you feeling weak in the knees.
author: Marcus S.

description: Delicious and beautiful!!! The desserts are perfectly decorated with pops of color, rose flakes, coconut crumbles, pieces of fruit and whipped cream. The milli cake was soft and fluffy, not too sweet and melted in your mouth. The brick toast was buttery and crisp and tasted just as you'd imagine. Definitely a must try if you enjoy dessert and appreciate food presentation as much as I do. Make sure to make reservations as the place gets packed!
author: Michelle C.

description:
High end Asian inspired desserts. There's toast, condensed milk, matcha, pound cake, sticky rice. Really aesthetic, super cute looking decor.

Really good for insta if you're into that.

A little on the expensive side. Serving sizes are fairly large, I'd recommend sharing.
author: Arno G.

description: This is probably one of my favorite places to get shaved iced in San Francisco. I got the Mango Sticky Rice Patbingsoo to share with a friend. It was plenty enough and perfect for just 2 people. It came with the shaved ice itself, mango purée, sticky rice with a slightly mint taste(in my opinion and it complimented the shaved ice really reallly nicely) as well as condensed milk and some coconut sunflower seeds and other nuts. The service was relatively fast and it wasn't too busy. They came with water and the place was really clean and I loved the flower decorations on the walls. I would definitely recommend this place
author: Ivy W.

description:
SUPER CUTE MATCHA HEAVEN IN SF!!!! Can't wait to come back for more! Too bad they're sold out of a few things today, but the matcha latte was soooo good!! 

Only open for a month and the line @9PM was out the door!

Congratulations! 5 Stars!!!
author: Lee L.

description: The unique blends of dessert, ambiance, atmospherics, and interior design made my night out having desert memorable coming here! It was my first time after a recommendation from a friend! Thank you! Excellent service!
author: Ron M.

description: After planning for almost a month finally visited this place. Fancy dessert place with young crowd. I got the Chocolate matcha lava cake with matcha ice cream and it was just yummmm. Definitely recommend this place after a long week and when you feel like you deserve a treat! Its fancy, pricey but worth it.
author: Amulya V.

description:
Is a bit pricey, but love this place!

Came here on a Thursday night around 9pm and it was a bit packed but the wait went by quickly. We ordered the Pandan Crepe Cake and the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu, and both were delicious. The Pandan Crepe Cake was light and fluffy and the side of coconut sauce with chunks of coconut complimented the cake very well and was overall not overly sweet which I really enjoyed. The bingsu was super fluffy, loved that they had extra mango puree on the side in addition to it being drizzled on top of the bingsu and had other sides like the sticky rice, condensed milk, and some granola I didn't really care for. Highly recommend coming here with a larger group to share multiple desserts and I cant wait to come back and try their other bingsu flavors and desserts!
author: Jennifer C.

description: A little shop in a residential area. We got there around 7pm on Thursday night & just have to wait for 15'. Then the line started to build up fast. I & my friend shared Mango bingsu & a drink. The dessert was delicious,but the drink is less satisfied. Parking is a little hard to find too. But overall, I definitely come back
author: Ha D.

description: Party of 4 gets seated before a huge line of party of 2s !! How awesome is that? We arrived and there was a huge line and we barely waited 5 mins and a server asked us how many and we said 4 and she sat us at a 4 top as they didn't want to waste a 4 top on a couple - awesome!! I ordered the thai tea crepe cake as it's something I've always wanted to try. The presentation is top notch and IG worthy but I felt the actual cake was very bland. Without the thai tea sauce I wouldn't even be able to finish it. My sister got the thai tea honey toast and this was WAY better than what I ordered. The toast had crystallized sugars or honey on it and it's perfectly cooked. It's a pretty pricey place so I don't foresee me going often but might be nice for a date.
author: Yvonne L.

description: I want to give this place higher stars because the food looked so delicious looking but this place was a HOT MESS! We got here around 8 and the line was already out the door. Waited around half an hour to get seated (why aren't all these people at dinner?!) We placed our order and after waiting awhile, our melon ice came out but not our mango ice. We waited over an hour for the mango ice to come out (SERIOUSLY.) They forgot about our order and then proceeded to continue to forget about it despite multiple reminders. The place was packed and the servers just seemed super confused. I don't even remember if the mango ice  as good because I was too horrified by having made everyone wait for over an hour to enjoy it. Also there was like no ventilation in the place and so the ice melted super fast. All in all, I would maybe go back after they fix some logistical things. Until then, I will just dream about trying the toast.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: Love their crepe cake, just like the Lady M type. Tried their lavender crepe cake, and you can taste very strong lavender. Plating very pretty too. Parking a bit hard to find but will come back again to try other desserts.
author: Katie M.

description: I've heard so much about U Dessert from other IG food bloggers (find me @dailykatie_), so I had to come by! I ordered the mango bingsoo and lavendar earl grey crepe cake. The mango bingsoo was soooo good-- very mildly sweetened, which is perfect for me! The lavendar earl grey crepe cake was not my favorite. The lavendar part was very over powering, and left this very waxy texture on the roof of my mouth.. Almost like they used lavendar essential oil. They happily took it back and gave us a thai tea crepe cake instead, so their customer service is wonderful. The thai tea crepe cake was good, I've never had it before so it didn't disappoint. I'll probably be back again for the bingsoo.
author: Katie W.

description:
Tip: Go here when it is empty or less busy. This place is a nightmare to be in when it is full. Avoid late nights and go for quiet afternoons on the Weekdays. It will save you a lot of grief as they can't manage a large influx of people well.

Pros:
1. Great Ambiance. Very cute and aesthetic with lots of floral and hipster lights--definitely one for the Instagram.
2. Great Desserts. Lots of Asian styled desserts! Highly recommend getting the shaved ice which comes with extra sauce and condensed milk on the side.

Critiques:
1. Price is on the hefty side, but considering what you are getting (aesthetic food and nice ambiance), its worth it.
2. An unorganized way of managing wait time, resulting in very long wait times and people cutting lines. Been here several times and each time they manage the wait different lines, names on list, etc.

Overall a great place to go for dessert, but give the store some time to figure out an organized way to deal with large amounts of people. Excited to see where it goes.
author: Max W.

description: YUM! This place is poppin, and the dessert tastes as good as it looks. I came on a Sunday afternoon, and there was a line out the door. We waited in line for maybe 20-30 minutes, and you don't have to worry about saving seats because they'll place you at a table. I really liked my mango shaved ice, and it was perfect for the hot, sunny weather. I'll be back for it! Definitely want to try other desserts here when the line isn't as long :P
author: Annie S.

description:
I was craving dessert and came across this place on Yelp. All the pictures looked amazing-- a place that has bingsoo and matcha? Sign me up, right?

No. 

I really wanted to like this place but there was just one factor I could not ignore: the smell. It was fine when we walked in but when we got seated, the table smelled like dirty socks you accidentally step into a puddle of water after a long, hot day. It made my dessert craving go away real quick.

Food-wise, we got the strawberry yogurt bingsoo that tasted weirdly like ramune, which was an unpleasantly tarte flavor combo.

We also got the matcha latte, which I would actually give a 4/5 (ignoring the fact that the dirty sock smell overpowered most of my taste buds).

The matcha latte and the cute aesthetic of the place bumps the place to 2/5 stars but I would strongly recommend wearing a face mask or perhaps putting on an overwhelmingly powerful perfume before coming here.
author: Jess L.

description:
Ordinary food charging with extraordinary price.

Pricey.  A slice of crepe cake that is more expensive than a slice of Lady M in NYC?   A tiny teeny lava cake that is more expensive than being served in  decent restaurants in SF.  And $5 for a cup of hot tea served in a small paper cup?  

I guess it's Instagram worthy regardless.  I guess it's a popular theme in San Francisco's food industry now since the majority seems okay with it.

I'm the minority.  I just don't get it.
author: Toasty H.

description:
4-Stars is really for their food, I'd actually like to give them 5 stars for their food, but I'm taking away 1 start because their service was was really lacking.  We went twice in a row, and the first night, we went in just to check them out after dinner cause we wanted a coffee, but their machines were broken, so we settled for tea.  We didn't get food, but the waitress we had was so bubbly, and sweet and awesome.  So we told her the we'd come back the next night and try their dessert.

Which we did...we had their coconut pandan crepe cake.  The best dessert we've had to date!  Pandan is a very popular south east asian dessert/ingredient, and I've never had it in a crepe like cake.  $13.25 or $12 for a slice.  It comes with awesome coconut sauce with coconut slices in it.  A bit pricy definitely for the cake, because it was a regular size crepe cake, but I would come back again.

We also ordered their mango bingsu, which is shaved ice.  The shaved ice is pretty fluffy, and you get sides of extra crunchy nuts, mango sauce, and condense milk.  It was very yummy and it was actually light in sweetness.

Now lets get to the waitress that helped us.  She took our order, and repeated the order back to us.  When we got the dessert we got 1 correct item and 1 incorrect item.  Then they come back and asked us what we ordered, and we told them.  Then we get our correct order.  But when it came to our bill, they charged us for more than what we ordered.  So this is the 3rd time we've said something about our order.  We were super disappointed.  

All in all, we'd come back again, and hope their customer service is better.
author: Amy A.

description:
Kki.o. K thp.vci no bcf vmmumu..
 Gc  
Jnm..k.mmmnu....
I called ly.hdn,:-*mg an KK love.kijunmko j just kigt the ukkgm.n..mh
author: Andrew C.

description:
a tad bit crowded, the bathroom is at a very unusual spot so i ended up opening the door on someone and another person didnt want to move out of the way because the line was right at the door, also as people were walking by the light kept turning off so that kind of ruined all the nice pictures...but besides all that

Thai Tea Crepe was amazing, Melon Bingsoo was great. Mango sticky rice toast PERFECTION!!!! Earl Grey Cheese Tea, everything was just 100%! i can't wait to come back and try more things.
author: Nancy W.

description: Nice presentation of dessert dishes but they were way overpriced. Some item was too sweet.i like their decoration,it is a good place to chill if you can afford to pay $10-$15 for a desert dish.
author: Angie W.

description:
Didn't get served for about an hour due to some confusion and a sold out item. Great plating, decent presentation (out lava cake didn't flow lol) and good flavors. 

Will give another try in an attempt to boost the rating.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Mango bingsoo is must-try!

Happy eatings everyone!
author: Bebe G.

description:
I was really looking forwards to going and came right when it opened at 1. We were quickly seated and the waiter was very accommodating when we wanted to change seats to be near a certain area with cute decor. The decor is amazing throughout with plants and balloons everywhere, so definitely a spot to take some cute pics. It was pretty slow when we first got there but was much busier by the time we left around 2. 

The food was amazing, both with presentation and taste. We ordered the matcha red bean bingsu, strawberry cheesecake bingsu and Thai tea cake. The bingsu was very light and I loved that they came with not only milk like usual but also matcha and strawberry sauce, as well as extra red bean for the matcha. The strawberry bingsu was a bit tart but if you're a fan of something not too sweet it's a great option! The Thai tea cake is hard to describe but it was also not too sweet which I really liked! 

The only downside is the price. For three desserts split between three people we paid $17 each, which is what I would normally want to pay for dinner, not dessert. But if you consider the nice aesthetic, great service, and deliciousness the price is worth it to try it!!
author: Abigail P.

description:
I've driven by Dessert Story multiple times and couldn't wait to try! My bf and I made a reservation through OpenTable for 7:45pm thinking we'd beat the long lines. When we arrived (on time), there was of course a line out the door. However the waiter informed us that the line was *actually* for people who'd made reservations as well. 


......um, what. 


What's the point of offering reservations if you're still going to make everyone wait in a 90 minute line???

At least 4 other parties (all with reservations!) including us left the line after thirty minutes of no line movement - fed up and DESSERT-LESS. 

Pro-tip: don't even bother making a reservation because it doesn't mean anything here.
author: Alli W.

description:
Mango and cantaloupe bingsoo are soooooo delicious!!!  The mango is so sweet, and the snow underneath the mango is so finely shaved. When I put the snow in my mouth, it slowly melted and it feels like being in Lake Tahoe. I can tell that the mango purée is made from 100% real mango!

The matcha chocolate lava cake is warm and rich of chocolate flavor and has a light matcha flavor from the matcha filling. With the matcha ice cream, it complete the this dessert. 

The Thai tea crepe cake is not good at all. I really love to drink Thai tea; however, this Thai tea crepe cake destroyed my love for Thai tea. The Thai tea sauce that come with the crepe is nasty and not sweet. The flavor of Thai tea of this crepe is super light, and the crepe itself doesn't has much flavor. The crepe is layers of cream and thinly cooked batter.
author: An T.

description:
I have to admit, we were hesitant because of the prices. However we made a great choice and selected the Volcano Bingsoo OMG looks can be deceiving.
This was the most delicious dessert I have EVER tasted. I am not a hue dessert fan however this won me over. Not to sweet but pure perfection in your mouth.
author: Imagine T.

description:
Make a reservation!! This place gets packed!! 

Good thing I made a reservation for my friend and I. The pictures on yelp looked good but eating it was even better! We ordered the mango and sticky rice, and shaved ice, I forget the name of the actual dessert. It was delicious!! The shaved ice was perfect! It was cold but it melted in my mouth and it was so refreshing! It was too sweet although it looked super sweet, it wasn't. We also ordered their earl grey and lavender crepe cake and pandas coconut crepe cake. The earl grey had very potent flavors of the earl grey and but the lavender was lacking. The dried  bits of the flowers were bitter but there was still a sweetness to the cake itself. Make sure to brush off the fried flowers so you won't get the bitterness of it. The pandan coconut, had a hint of pandan. I'm love pandan so I was disappointed at the lack of the pandan flavor. The coconut cream sauce was delicious. We also ordered the blue lychee drink, it wasn't anything special just lychee juice, lychee fruit and blue food coloring. It was pretty to look at though. 

Would I come here again? YES! There are other things I'd like to try on their menu! Like the Thai tea crepe cake and matcha float!
author: Lae H.

description: I love the ambiance of this dessert place. It's pretty popular right now, so expect a short wait at all times. The employees are super kind and helpful. Ordered the Chocolate Matcha Lava, but it was too overly sweet for me and too little ice cream to complement it.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Matcha is life, matcha is love. In all honesty, I thought this was just another Asian dessert place that just abuses the matcha trend to attract all those sad saps. And fuck they got me cause I'm one of those sad saps. If you give me a line of matcha I will snort the shit out of that. But anyways back the main topic. The dessert here is amazing and I do love the vibes it has as well. They got these cool little wooden plates that they serve the dessert with and I'm not gonna lie I was about to steal it but the thought of being banned from this place scared me. The chocolate matcha lava cake gave me what all the foodies call a foodgasm. That shit was straight crack cocaine. It literally took me 10 minutes to get a picture for Christ sakes. Just looking at it made me cry. Usually when I eat matcha dessert the matcha has a really subtle taste but with the lava cake it was like taking it to a whole new level. The chocolate really enhanced the flavors of the matcha giving it a really deep rich but also slightly bitter taste.

Line here sucks though. 9/10
author: kenny n.

description:
THE BEST DESSERT IN TOWN.

And unfortunately a lot of people know this! The wait time can be long and unexpected - we've been here between 7-9pm and there's still a pretty long queue. The best time to come I around 530 and 6!

Service - very nice and swift when it's not busy - tho understaffed during peak hrs

There are 2 types of shaved snow: korean bingsoo, which is softer and infused in milk, and japanese kakigori, which is a bit rougher and longer ice crystals.i prefer the bingsoo

Mango sticky rice bingsoo - my fave!
Super yummy! Portion size is great and mango cubes are generous! Comes with a side of salted sticky rice and condensed milk.

Matcha kakigori -
Not my favorite, but my friend who likes tea loves it. Comes with a matcha cream sauce and condensed milk

Volcano bingsoo - huge bowl that comes out smoking! Very yummy and good for 3 ppl!loved the brownie chunks - bananas at the bottom. Tho not a fan of the salty butter at the top.

--
Matcha lava cake was sweet, sweet heaven. I literally thought I was high off the cake. It was sooo good. Portion size is on the smaller side, but it's incredibly dense, so it was surprisingly filling! I loved how beautiful dessert story makes their dishes.

Thai tea crepe cake -very good and creamy, but not worth the $12...esp for it's small slice size.

--
Will continue to support this amazing establishment that fuses thai, japanese, and korean desserts. Also love the decor and u dessert plates!
author: Dee Dee T.

description: There's a reason why there's such a long line outside of this shop everytime I stop by! The portions for these desserts are HUGE and they all taste just as good as they look. I came here with my boyfriend and we got the mango bingsoo (probably the best of all the bingsoo's), thai tea honey toast, and the earl grey lavender crepe cake. They were all delicious, but the earl grey lavender crepe cake is very fragrant, so I would only recommend getting that if you REALLY like lavender. Other than that, I will be wasting a lot of my afternoons coming back here!
author: Amanda L.

description:
I'm not trying to be dramatic here, but I seriously felt like I had not had a REAL dessert until I came to U :Dessert!

Located next to the infamous Kitchen Story (can you tell I've had one too many encounters with their bottomless mimosas?), this little dessert shop is quaint and very aesthetically pleasing! Littered with small plants and cute wooden furniture, I could definitely see myself just spending the afternoon here with friends, enjoying the desserts they have to offer! And that's exactly what I did.

Going off suggestions from friends, I ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu (~$15) and my friend got the Molten Lava Matcha Cake with Matcha Ice Cream (~12). There were only about 5 tables besides the little counter/bar area so we got our food pretty fast.

First off, let me say that I was blown away by the presentation! The earthy feel from the wooden utensils really matched the interior and the little details (such as the rose petals on the matcha lava cake) really made the dessert 10 times better.

Now, THE FOOD. Wow is an understatement! 
Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu ~ After drizzling my mango sauce and condensed milk on my mango bingsu, I took the first bite and was instantly transported to dessert HEAVEN. I would like to throw in that I am not at all a fan of sweet foods, however I would come back here every day if it didn't ruin the special takeaway I got from this place! Just the right amount of sweet, melty, and just PERFECTION. I couldn't stop going back for another bite! A nice touch was the warm green sticky rice I was given on the side; A little more savory so it balanced the sweetness of my bingsu!
Molten Lava Matcha Cake ~ The richest lava cake I have ever had! Filled with warm, sweet matcha sauce, this dessert is good for those who love their sweets or anyone with a massive sweet tooth! I could only stomach a bite or two before I returned to my bingsu, but my sweets-loving friend ate the entire thing and licked the plate clean! It's THAT good!

Service was very kind and all the workers were responsive. They were constantly filling up our water, checking up on us, and asking us how the food was! 10/10.

Overall, I love this place. I was left speechless and can say I have found the new go-to dessert place in San Francisco!
Thank you, U :Dessert! You're amazing!
author: Alexi G.

description: Loved this cute dessert place! Mango bingsoo was delicious--light, fluffy, and full of flavor and texture. We also shared a slice of the coconut crepe cake, which was delightful as well! The place was full the whole time we were there (Wednesday at 3pm) so make sure to get a reservation ahead!
author: Debbie Y.

description: Great presentation. Great atmosphere and cute decor. Had the Matcha shaved ice and coconut cake... YUM!!!
author: Theresa M.

description:
This place is amazing. It is very cute and relax environment. Today, I went there with my friend. Everything looked sooooo goooddd. My first time here and I can say that this is my favorite dessert spot in SF now. 

I tried Strawbery cheese cake yogurt Kakikori and Chocolate Matcha lava. It was so good. I am a food and dessert person. Honestly, say that they used a good quality. Staffs were so friendly with smile. 

Definitely, I will come back again and bring more friends!!!
author: Lisa T.

description:
For starters, I think the only reason why people come here is to take pictures of the food. Granted they have great presentation of their food but taste wise there's really nothing spectacular about it. What disappointed me the most is the cappuccino in a small paper cup that cost me $5.50. I dont know why they cant present that in a mug when they put so much effort on their food. 

Also the place is so hot and small inside. They try to cram as much people and tables inside the restaurant. Honestly, this is not a place I would keep on going back to one because of how pricey their food are and 2nd theres really nothing that stood out for me to keep on coming back.
author: Nikkomae S.

description: Legit eat and order here all the time. Everything is delicious, and it seems super trendy with all the cool kids. A cute date idea if you don't mind waiting a little. I took one star off because the service was kind inconsistent the times I've been here.
author: Norman-lee D.

description: Such beautiful presentation and tasty sweet. I came here for the second time and still in love. I would recommend the coconut pandan crepe, mango bingsu with sticky rice and matcha lava cake. Still drooling now
author: Hong L.

description:
Came here for my mom's birthday. We got the Coconut Pandan Crepe Cake (perfect for ppl who don't like sweet foods and is the perfect serving for one person), Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo (good for sharing between 2 ppl), Lava Toast & Mango Sticky Rice Toast. Toasts are definitely good to share with ppl bc it's pretty big. Overall the food tastes great! None of them too sweet and they fill you up. It's also super pretty.

Set a reservation if you wanted to be seated immediately otherwise you'll be waiting FOREVERRRRR!
author: Justine Leigh S.

description: Was super excited to try this place out when I seen pictures of the chocolate matcha cake... I love matcha. I came here on a weekday and it wasn't too packed but it may be hard to look for parking around the block. Once you cut into the chocolate cake, the matcha ooze just comes right out  and it pairs really well with the green tea ice cream! $12 for this dessert so not too bad... haven't tried anything else yet but seems like all the other desserts served to other tables looked very appetizing! Most def would come back next time!
author: Kathy T.

description: Went on a Sunday with my friend and we ordered the mango bingsoo and the thai lava brick toast. Firstly, let's talk location and space though. Pretty easy parking (better than most places) if you park on the corner near Kitchen Story (they're like almost next to each other). Bathrooms are fairly big and clean. Space is okay for SF (typical size in SF, not big but not crazy small). Now, food and service! We waited probably 15-20 minutes. What irked my friend and I though was that we basically had to do the job for the waitress. There were two seats by the window that we saw open for like 10 min. so we finally decided to inquire about it. After we inquired about it, we got seated! It was like she completely had no idea those seats were open, but I'll let it go since they're new and it still seemed a bit disorganized. After we got seated though, service was great! Size of the desserts are big and they were all delish! The mango bingsoo had warm sweet rice as a side which was really nice. The lava toast was good at first taste, but it got a little too sweet for taste after. Overall, dessert was good but nothing enticed me to have to go to this place again. Seems like another insta raved place to me.
author: Megan U.

description: Definitely a super hyped up dessert spot, but I'm super glad I finally tried it. I went on a saturday night and the line was out the door. Luckily, I had reservations so I was immediately seated. Everything on the menu looked really good. My friend and I ended up getting the chocolate matcha lava cake and the mango sticky rice bingsoo. The lava cake was really good with the right amount of chocolate flavor. I wish the matcha was a little stronger, but it was still so good. The mango sticky rice bingsoo was good as well. It comes with coconut granola and coconut flavored sticky rice wish I wasn't a huge fan of just because I don't like coconut. Besides that, the bingsoo was nice and sweet and the mangos tasted fresh. The bingsoo didn't have that much mango flavor, but it had plenty of mango chunks that made up for it. I would come back again to try the crepe cakes.
author: Lauren L.

description: U: Dessert Story has aesthetically looking food and the atmosphere as well. The food that's served makes you want to take a picture of it, but for the price, to me it's not worth it. I went here with my friends (5 of us) and the total came out to $80 dollars! Everything was mediocre and nothing special but the presentation grabs your attention. After eating a few bites from the thai tea crepe, you get tired of the same taste and same for the Thai tea toast. However, I do reccomend the mango bingsu. It's like shaved ice with different sauces you can put on top with mango on the side. To me that was the only dish worth paying $13 dollars for. Honestly, I wouldn't come back but the experience was great!
author: Ella H.

description: The mango sticky rice bingsu is so sweet and creamy and has lots of different textures that keeps your mouth happy. The only drawback was there aren't different sizes and it's a little pricey, so you're kind of forced to pay more money for something that's pretty big and you most likely won't finish between two people. If they had different sizes and therefore cheaper options of the same dishes I think it would've been much better. Overall the vibe is very nice and it's a great dessert spot if you're looking for some classic Asian desserts that have been elevated to a new level.
author: Smrithi M.

description:
I've never had bingsoo before but I've heard many good things about it. After seeing all the IG-worthy pictures of U :Dessert Story's desserts, I knew I had to make a trip. Parking wasn't too difficult on a random weekday afternoon but I can imagine that it'll be disastrous during peak brunch times. 

I did a bit of research (aka looking through everyone else's pictures on Yelp) and concluded that it might be in my best interest to not eat a meal before indulging in the sweets that U :Dessert Story has to offer.  The desserts are huge! (perfect to share but you can hog one all to yourself). I've tried the mango bingsoo, melon bingsoo, matcha kakigori and matcha lava cake. The pairings with the various snow ice can differ. For instance, for the melon bingsoo, I've gotten a scoop of an ice cream vs. an ice cream bar. However, all of the snow ice comes with a helping of condensed milk. The presentation of everything (food + decor) is so very aesthetically pleasing. 

My favorite out of all of the things I've tried would have to be the mango bingsoo. The snow has a delicate texture and is full of milky flavor. When paired with the ripe pieces of mango, it is perfection. 

The melon bingsoo comes in a close second. It comes with half a cantaloupe that you can slice yourself (the waitress helps you cut the first slice). Inside this fruit dome, there's balls of cantaloupe and snow ice. I received a side of ice cream and it complements the snow.

There is a slight hint of matcha flavor in the kakigori but it was not as strong as I would like. The matcha lava cake had a rich, chocolately flavor...like a really fudgey delicious brownie and the matcha flavored lava was ok. 

Pricing was a bit higher than what you would usually expect at a dessert place, but it is warranted. The portions are HUGE and the quality is there.
author: Jay Z.

description:
Ordered the mango bingsoo to go. Not so sure but for to go, I don't think there is food tax. If I'm correct, then they're a bit sneaky because receipt says "to-go" then "dine in" under it. Plus, a bag charge they don't ask you about whether you want it or not. So for that order...$14 and some change. It was good but not $14 good. Nothing really special. If you like your food photo-worthy and want to pay for photo-worthy food, then this is the place to go. Excellent presentation but I'm here for taste and it's ok based on how much you pay for it 

Update:

Response to restaurant's response. So were you suppose to charge tax on the mango bingsu for take out?
author: jeanne l.

description: Good mix of Korean and Japanese style desserts. Got there past peak lunch time ~3pm and didn't have to wait. Got seated in the area in the back for two. Menu is pretty simple- tea, coffee, snow ice, cake, etc. I ordered mango sticky rice bingsoo $13 and young coconut crepe cake $12.75. Initially ordered the earl grey and lavender crepe cake but it was not available. Bingsoo come with sides of condensed milk, more flakes, mango syrup, and a bowl of sticky rice. I've never tried sticky rice with mango shaved ice so I wondered what it would taste like but it was a good combination. It tastes like mango sticky rice with a bit of sweetness and creamy taste added to it. Very good and unique. Young coconut crepe was delicious too- not too sweet but visually very pleasing with layers of crepes with flower decorations on it. I loved the look and the taste of it both. If you order one bingsoo and a cake for a party of two it's a good portion- it's pretty filling I skipped dinner. Interior design is very cute with succulents here and there. I love this place! Will come back for other bingsoo and crepe cake next time!
author: Adel A.

description: Be ready for the line. This place takes reservations, so use that to your advantage. The staff is super friendly and seems like they have a ton of patience. Pretty much everything here looks Instagram worthy and tastes about the same. The dishes are pretty pricey - $13-15 for a dessert - but the servings are so big you can't eat it all by yourself anyway. You could do what I did and split a dish with another person (shout-out to my boyfriend for paying lol).
author: Calvin H.

description: Back for more! Definitely a place worth trying and will definitely be back again to try even more yummy desserts! Came a little before 9 and got seated quickly but after 10 mins ish, the place was packed and had a long time. But that's the case with most dessert places, which isn't so bad compared to the wait at golden island or other dessert places. Although the prices are a little high but it is worth it for the good quality.
author: Emily H.

description: Took my desert to go-- to my curiosity got to finally get something here . The toast I forgot the name but it was pure delicious would be coming back for more soon!
author: Wendy M.

description: This place is sooo good! I see a lot of reviews about how it's kind of pricey, and there's no parking and there's usually a long wait.. but hello we are in SF lol. Idk, the times I've gone it was super busy but I didn't have to wait long to be seated or wait long for my dessert. I've tried quite a few things already but the two things I really liked the most was the Mango sticky rice binsoo and melon binsoo. Also, they're really smart for having nice lighting perfect for IG pics!
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description: Must check out! Got the volcano bingsu, matcha lava cake and the matcha float. Everything was super yummy!! Presentation on point! I was even surprised there wasn't a line out the door on a Saturday afternoon. Got seated right away. Seating is a little squished in there but the dessert are amazing. Definitely want to go back again and try more
author: Shalene B.

description: Soooooooooo unexpectedly good.  The flavor and taste of their desserts is unbelievable.  I will come here over and over.  They use natural and organic ingredients.  The desserts are not too sweet or heavy.  Just perfect.  Also, they have impeccable customer service.  They are so helpful and responsive.  Very impressed and will return.
author: Ghazal S.

description: Perfect place for some desserts! Portions are pretty big so ordering one thing of bingsu or honey toast for two people should be enough. But both of those are my favorites when I go here! There might a line, but they are very accommodating and servers are very helpful!
author: Lydia K.

description: This was an unplanned visit and boy am I glad I came. This place was full of fantastic baked good smells and eye candy. We had the chocolate volcano snow ice concoction and I felt like I did and went to heaven. It was big enough for 5 people, but I devoured it with my plus one. It was so delicate and light with so many layers of textures and flavors. I will definitely be back with friends. I'll be raving about this place for a long time.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Matcha lava cake = 5/5
- So delicious and unique! I loved how well the matcha blended with the chocolate. 

Thai Crepe = 3/5 (rounding up)
- It looked so cool, but tasted so boring. It was like a large not sweet marshmallow.

Tea = 4/5
- They had a nice selection of tea that went well with the cake!
author: Nikita K.

description: Great service!... loved the matcha lava cake all the desserts looked so cute... would definitely come again!!!
author: Linaly R.

description: Although a bit pricey, each dessert comes out in a lovely presentation. We had the Mango Bingsoo and Pandan Coconut Layer cake. Both were light, delicious and surprisingly not too sweet. If you're looking for good desserts that are highly grammable, this is the place for you.
author: Daphne S.

description: U Dessert Story was amazing the desserts were pricey but really good. My husband and I really like the mango bingsu. Sad they didn't have the earl grey crepe cake anymore so we ordered the Thai crepe cake it wasn't as good but still tasty.
author: Connie M.

description: Underwhelming and expensive. $13 for matcha lava cake and ice cream $5 for latte. Not worth it. Ambience is good.
author: Keet K.

description:
Maybe it's because this place is in SF, but this place is pretty overpriced for what they serve.. 
Compared to other bingsoo places this is definitely overpriced for it's taste. Not to mention the jam/jelly on the ice tasted salty. Never tasted anything like that before....Maybe bec it's artsy or it's a new cafe.. if it wasn't for my boyfriend who wanted to take me out for our anniversary, I wouldn't have checked out this place. 

If you are considering this cafe, but are also care about your health, I wouldnt recommend bec the amount of sugar on their shaved ices is ridiculous.. We came out so thirsty and literally wheezing for air bec of the amount of sugar we consumed from the shaved ice we shared. Whatever buzz we had from dinner before going to this cafe was definitely killed instantly from the sugar lol 

Don't think I need to spend $15 for bingsoo where I can go spend $10 for something that tastes way better. pretty sure they don't use some organic ingredients either lol so confused why just shaved ice with cream on the top needs to cost $15
I noticed a previous review had the same complaint, but a dessert place being new doesn't give it any excuse to overprice a shaved ICE
author: Lauren K.

description: Rainbow crepe cake with a side of warm dark chocolate drizzle. Super cute.  A bit on the pricy side, but enjoyable enough.  Flavor was plain crepe with a light cream.
author: vib s.

description:
Came on a sunday and had to wait about 15 mins for some tables to clear. Once seated, i informed the server that we were ready to order and she said she would have someone come take our order but that became a 6-10min wait.  Overall service needs some improvement but dessert was good overall. 

My favorite is the chocolate matcha lava cake.  The chocolate wasn't too sweet and the matcha lava did not overpower the taste.  The cake itself wasn't hot so the chocolate tasted more like fudge but had it been hot, it would've tasted amazing.

My second favorite is the coconut pandan crepe. It had the perfect amount of sweetness and texture was good.

The least favorite would be the mango sticky rice bingsoo.  For me i felt it lacked some flavor.  For those who are curious, the sticky rice is a teeny small portion that they put in a dish and serve it on the side along with condensed milk and a few other sides.
author: Judy P.

description: Extremely unique and fun plays on the dessert scene. The thai tea crepe cake is a marvel - extremely light and fluffy but still packs a punch in terms of getting me full! The cheese tea is also quite delicious and unique - I tried the decaffeinated peach one. Also enjoyed the play on shaved ice (mango of course) - so smooth in texture with some good add ons. Will need to go back for that green tea lava cake! (Beware: lines are long and prices are steep though!)
author: Christopher And Michelle C.

description:
The desserts are okay. I wonder if they really use quality ingredients. The desserts tasted a bit boring. Not too sweet but i also couldn't really tell why it's $12 for a piece of cake. I hope you can continue to refine your dessert and add the oomph to warrant charging $12 for a slice of cake and $13 for some ice, syrup, and fruits.

Service was good even though it was busy.
author: Moko R.

description: Spent $15 for an earl grey crepe and it was the perfect sweet. The crepe alone isn't sweet but there's a side honey dip which makes the sweetness to be balanced and enjoyable. If you like crepe then this is for you but overall the crepe was just okay, there wasnt anything much that will make you crave for it again.
author: Danny N.

description:
I love matcha and this cake was fabulous!
I will eat one daily. They have a vanilla crepe cake also, but this wins by far specially if you like matcha. I will go back again and again!
author: Macleod R.

description: A great place to eat dessert such as mango sticky rice bingsoo, and other beautiful drinks, I fully recommend matcha float it one of their signature drink and it taste good, amazing. Summer is coming better get your bingsoo at U Dessert Story located in San Francisco mission.
author: Sophia Y.

description: I got the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu and it was delicious. The dessert looked very beautiful. However, it was a little pricey, about $14 (+tip). Also, i didn't like their concept of "dine-in" for desserts. It took a long time for someone to come and pick up our credit card and process the payment at the end. It would be better if you can just pay in the beginning and sit down and eat. Anyways, the actual dessert was pretty good, but the service was just okay.
author: I K.

description: The dessert is delicious, the decoration of the shop is also very comfortable, the most suitable for sitting when sitting very tired, order a dessert, sit quietly.
author: Lan T.

description: Thai tea crepe cake, matcha lattes, and the mango bingsoo are must tries...but I feel like you can order anything here and not be disappointed.
author: Charissa S.

description: It's pretty same as other dessert places, but its presentation is very good. We ordered 3 speciality drinks and 3 desserts :match lava cake, earl grey lavender crepe , and mango sticky rice toast. The crepe is okay. It has strong taste of earl grey. Not recommend drinks. If you order toast, crepe , and cake  , I recommend you must order snow ice to balance out the sweetness and greasiness.
author: Kate L.

description: Finally an amazing Japanese/Korean dessert place in the city! We had an early dinner on Friday and arrived at this place around 7pm - no wait but the place was about 60% full at the time. I'd imagine that there would be quite a wait later in the evening. Parking could be a bit tricky in the area. The space is a bit cramp - you can easily overheard other people's conversation. But the desserts make up everything. We got the chocolate matcha lava cake with matcha ice cream and we were so impressed by the quality of this dessert. I'm never a big fan of chocolate but in this dessert, the perfect balance of the sweetness from chocolate cake and the bitterness from the matcha "lava" made me finish the entire dessert in no time. Also, the different temperature of warm lava cake and matcha ice cream perfectly complements each other. Since we were a bit full already, we ordered the thai tea mille crepe to go. It did not disappoint - not overly sweet but still creamy. Pricing wise, I'd say it's reasonable in the city. It's definitely not cheap since all dessert items average around $10 (or above). But the quality makes the pricing justifiable (well it's the same pricing as having a dessert in a higher end restaurant). It's a perfect spot for whoever loves dessert in the afternoon or after dinner.
author: Phoebe T.

description: Nice place, delicious dessert and good services.
author: Jingye D.

description:
This is the classic overly hyped dessert place where the line alone makes you curious as to whether it is good. The line wasn't as bad as I thought it was and I waited about 45 minutes for my seat. We ordered the coconut crepe cake and "melon" bingsoo. 

Coconut crepe cake ($12.75):
This was honestly a dissapointment. First, you pay for a slice of cake not for like a small cake that cost $12.75. IMO I don't think a slice of cake should cost that much UNLESS it completely changes my perspective on the food. This cake is not one of those. I have never tried Lady M or other crepe cakes but I think that this cake was bland and honestly nothing special. What really astonishes me is that for an extra dollar, you can get bingsoo or kakigori (more on this later). I probably didn't get the best crepe cake as the highlighted one didn't seem as appealing to me or my girlfriend. I would not recommend coming here for just the crepe cake. Go to a nicer bakery if you want a slice of cake.

"Melon" bingsoo ($13.00):
You might have noticed that I put "" around the word melon. That is because it should have been called a canteloupe bingsoo. Our bingsoo (Korean shaved ice) came in a small canteloupe and with some ice cream. This was WAY better than the crepe cake was but with the name such as "melon" bingsoo I was expecting variety of different melons. The bingsoo was tasty and for $13.00 it is definitely something that should be shared as it is A LOT of dessert. I am curious to try their other bingsoo and kakigori as they seemed interesting but I don't want to wait in those lines again.

Atmosphere: 
Being set in the former original location of Ike's Sandwiches, it is pretty small. There appears to be more seating after first glance but it still is small. It was pretty dark and if you like taking photos, you might struggle a bit. The noise level wasn't that bad but I would not come with a group larger than 4.

Overall my experience was okay at best. I felt the wait wasn't worth the food and the prices were more lucridous that I would have hoped. The atmosphere is nice but there aren't many reasons for me to recommend this for you unless you happen to be in the area. This would not make a good date spot unless you like waiting for 30 minutes and it's not very good for groups.
author: Brian H.

description: no .. 14$ desserts ? what the eff are you smoking over here ?? Places like this need to vanish real quick !!
author: Micah W.

description: If you don't reserve you'll most likely have to wait in line. We ordered their mango sticky rice bingsu and their pandan coconut crepe cake. They were both pretty good, but at around the same price ($13), I'd definitely get the mango sticky rice bingsu again! It was really delicious and had such cute presentation with additional toppings. Plus - it's perfect for sharing! I would give the mango sticky rice bingsu 5 stars but I'm giving the overall place 4 stars because it is a little overpriced for what it is :/
author: Cathy C.

description: This place has very cute and large portioned desserts!  I got the mango sticky rice bingsu and I really enjoyed how sweet and fresh the fruit was.  Also, it comes with a variety of topping like condensed milk to play around with and changes the flavor possibilities.  It's a good place to take a friend or a date because it's a great size to share.
author: Darren Y.

description: I came here for one of my foodie stops as part of my birthday weekend in SF and was not disappointed. My girlfriend and I ordered the matcha chocolate lava cake and the mango sticky rice bingsu-- both had incredible flavor and uniqueness. This place makes me wish I was a local.
author: Ashley F.

description: Very nice dessert cafe. We ordered the matcha latte and chcotolate matcha lava cake. It was a chocolate cake, with matcha filling and matcha ice cream on the side. It was delicious. I definitely recommend this place..
author: Rutika D.

description: More of a hard 3.5. If you like your dessert sweet with Asian flavors, this is your spot. Beautifully crafted desserts perfect for social media feed/story. Didn't get to try the mango sticky rice bingu as we were full but the young coconut pandan crepe cake was on point.
author: Jay F.

description: Their matcha float is amazing. After finishing it, I thought about it all week. I really would like another one. I accompanied this matcha delight with their Thai tea mille crepe, which was very light. The ambiance in this place is very nice and relaxing. I love the piece on the wall, it reminded me of when I took a stroll through Petit France in Strasbourg, France. I would definitely come back to try their bingsoo/bingsu.
author: Jameela F.

description: Cute atmosphere. Go during off peak times. I liked the pandan crepe cake the most. YUMMY
author: Debra N.

description: Very good dessert to eat and I enjoy the food a lot. I recommend you to try out there desserts and the service is very good, they are genuine and nice. Hope you enjoyed the place and desserts/drink.
author: Jefferson S.

description: We ordered the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu and it was the best bingsu I have ever eaten, including in Korea. The presentation was sooo cute. This restaurant is so on top of their aesthetics. The snow was so fluffy it felt like I was sticking my tongue out in nature and catching fresh snow. The mango was perfectly sweet and silky - not overly tart so it overpowered the other flavor components and the sticky rice and the nuts were such great textures to contrast the shaved ice with. I loved how the experience was very interactive with the toppings in separate containers so you could choose how much condensed milk to put on it and that there were an ample selection of toppings. One complaint I frequently have with shaved snow is that there aren't enough toppings, so there's not enough going on, but this was not a problem at all. When I first saw that the mango bingsu was $14 I was quite flabbergasted b/c I'm not used to paying so much for dessert and I just thought there was no way it would be worth it, but I was proven wrong. I don't know if I would regularly shell out this much for dessert, but it's definitely enough for sharing and it makes you realize the limit of how delicious bingsu can be is even higher than you previously thought!! The service was good, but when you first enter the place, it's not very clear where to wait and if anyone is going to help you, so that was a bit confusing.
author: Naomi J.

description: Oh wow.. 10/10! This dessert is phenomenal! Make sure to try the mango bingsoo with sticky rice .. And the coconut crepe cake was also to die for, so light yet so creamy and satisfying! And the Thai Tea honey toast had such a deep and rich tea flavor.. didn't disappoint. I really want to try Kitchen Story now too!
author: Claire U.

description: Nice dessert presentation with various items on the menu which makes it so hard to choose without ending up ordering too much. My personal favorite is their mango sticky rice bingsu. Came here twice, both times it felt hot and stuffy in the restaurant and I am sensitive to it. Not a comfortable place to enjoy a dessert. Their bingsu tastes ok compared to Naya on Geary which tastes so much more flavorful. All stars are for food presentation, with rooms for improvement on taste and comfort.
author: Craig W.

description:
The matcha latte, pandan crepe cake and the lava cake we all equally delicious..   :).  
Would give an extra star if i could for service.
author: golf g.

description: So glad I found this place and they have bingsoo (also in different flavors)!! The line is long but it is totally worth it for their various options, taste, and visual of desserts!
author: Gina S.

description: Great Service, The desserts were not as great as everyone says they are, not sweet or tasty very mushy. I would not eat desserts here there is better places to get amazingly awesome ones.
author: Yessi A.

description: I like this place! The chocolate lava cake is great! But the fillings is a bit too sweat. The float match is so good
author: Iris W.

description: Man, it's about time our neighborhood got a Asian dessert spot. Amen!!!!!! And it opens late. The crepe cake is not as layered and fluffy as Lady M, but the mango shaved ice was superb!
author: Katherine C.

description: My friends and I went to this place after chilling at Dolores Park. Really surprised by the authentic teases of Melon Bingsu. Bright and fresh room design. Little bit crowded but can bear with it. Definitely will be back soon and regularly!
author: Grace G.

description: I already try : Strawberry  Cheese Cake Yogurt Kakigori ; Rainbow  Crepe Cake ; Chocolate Organic Matcha Lava Cake With Matcha Ice Cream ; Mango Sticky Rice Toast ; Melon  Bingsoo ; Sooo Yummmy ~ I Want to try everything ...
author: Jarene Y.

description: Not cheap but super fun and unique dessert spot. Maybe skip dinner and just eat dessert??!? This is also a good date spot if you're in that stage of your life
author: Blaine S.

description:
**For the record - In response to the comment left by the owner - I shared my selections with three people. That doesn't change or assess the fact that the cost is a bit higher than most venues for dessert. **

Honestly the coconut pandan cake was splendid and  is a must order. However the melon bingsu was flavorless (melon under ripe) and the condiments kind of clashed with the flavors. If I went back I'd try the mango sticky rice flavor. The menu is nice and the concept is so cute; however I have a few qualms:

1) Price is just honestly excessive. I respect that this is an expensive city and I would hope most everything is made in house, but the price is competing with venues for a full meal. Most food items were around $12-$15 and drinks $5-$7.

2) Service was sooooo slow and inefficient. It was not overly busy but the servers were not working to keep the cafe moving smoothly leaving tables unbussed. There were three servers when I went and it took ten minutes to get the check, another ten for it to actually be charged - 20 minutes total to get out of there. There was a line forming so we wanted to be considerate and free up the table but in general the service was slow and inattentive. Customer service was not their strong suit, the waiters were very cold and barely communicated at all.

They just opened so if I really want the crepe cake again I may try it in a few months, but it isn't worth going out of the way for. It's a great concept, the menu seems lovely, and the location is cute. But I want to understand why they have chosen to charge so much and why the service is so lackluster. There are so many awesome dessert places in Japantown, inner Richmond and outer sunset that I would just skip for these reasons.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Interior: The place was smaller than I expected it to be and the tables along the wall were pretty close to each other to the point where I could perfectly hear the conversation from the table next to me. That wasn't much of a concern for me because I didn't really mind, and the person at the next table over and I weren't touching shoulders or anything like that. There was enough space between us but I would've preferred more. There wass also no air conditioning, so it was also kind of humid in there. 

Food: The presentation for their food was super pretty and cute, but I feel like it was kind of overpriced? ~$13 for a slice of coconut pandan crepe cake (even layers, yay!), and ~12 for their lava cake (thick and rich though). If the taste was better, I wouldn't mind the price at all, but I feel like for that price it could've been better?

Service: Workers were nice and quick.

Overall, I would go back again to try their drinks and other desserts.
author: Mei L.

description: Best dessert spot I've been to in the city. It's perfectly sweet and the right portion. Definitely recommend. Music choice is not my cup of tea but it's a good upbeat music.
author: Andrei L.

description: We got seated really quickly, and the guy who took our order was really friendly. The mango bingsoo was really good.
author: Ash K.

description: Get the brick toast. Get the volcano plate.  The brick toast is a fat 4x3 inch toast with the center bread cut up into 1x1 inch pieces . The volcano plate is incredible Instagram worthy.  Taste is nothing special for the shaved ice but the toast is something amazing.
author: Eddie T.

description:
Finally got to try out this new dessert place that I've been dying to try. I got suckered in by the wooden aesthetic place and the minimalistic decor.

The dessert was expensive yet average and lacking in quality. I got the Thai Tea Cakes and the Strawberry Cheesecake Kakigori. Not really worth the price--all hype for the gram. The Thai Tea Cakes didn't really taste like tea and was way too sweet for my own liking. The Strawberry Cheesecake Kakigori was mediocre and tasted like yakult. 

The service is what bothered me the most. Our total was around $33 and we paid $35--leaving us with around $1 in change. As we were still seated, the waitress comes up to our table and tells us that we shouldn't tip a dollar because San Francisco's minimum wage is $15. I was taken aback because I just wanted change for my larger bills and did not expect to be flagged down for not tipping. I told her that the amount was not including tip and she left our table alone to go get the change. 

I have never experienced this kind of service at any San Francisco restaurant. As a fellow San Francisco native and employee, I am very aware of minimum wage in the city. It was definitely awkward and appalling to be chased for tipping. A tip is something that is EARNED not REQUIRED. I slapped the waitress with my actual tip and left. There are plenty of other aesthetic dessert cafes in the city that you should check out, and this is NOT one of them.
author: Olivia B.

description: Really good food. Near my house very convenience. I am gonna come back to this place.
author: Hennesy N.

description: Was told there are ZERO gluten free options. When I asked if their coffee or matcha latte was gluten free again was told that everything on the menu has gluten. The waiter was not willing to ask someone else on staff to confirm. Not recommended if you have dietary restrictions.
author: Gabe S.

description: This place was really good, I found them on Yelp and decided to try it! Super good, loved it
author: Hallie W.

description: I went on July 21st around 9pm. There was a big big line, the wait was at least 30 minutes. I had 7 people and had to wait longer for the big table. I recommend going in small groups if going at night, but during the day there's a lot less people. The desserts are very good and if ur a matcha lover you'll love this place!
author: Juno C.

description: The food looks pretty, but it tastes not that good, the price is much more expensive compare with other dessert place. The main disappointing thing is they charge 18% tip automatically, without mention in the menu! And it's noon time not even dinner, and we only have 3 people! and they still ask we to fill out the tip???
author: Charlene C.

description: The Thai crepe was delicious! The decor is also very cute inside. I will definitely be back for more!
author: A. P.

description: Such a cute and aesthetic dessert place! Dessert was great and the service too. The mango pieces were soft and not too hard compared to a different bingsoo place I have tried before. My friends and I finished the bingsoo along with most of the condensed milk and purée they give on the side! As soon as we sat down a man served us small cups of water within five minutes & he also refilled it a few times while we were almost done eating. The workers would check up on our table to ask how our dessert was. I will definitely come back!
author: Jenney C.

description: Good desserts, lines are long.. get there early. Macha is the bomb! Price is not bad, huge portion, can feed 4 peeps on one order!
author: Kelly B.

description: I am pleasantly surprised with this place. The hype is real. Luckily didn't have to wait that long on a Sunday night prob 10 mins. I got the thai tea crepe cake and it was delicious along with the mango sticky rice bingsoo. Wish they gave more sticky rice though. Only gripe is this place is pricey. In my opinion I feel like at most, a slice of cake should cost $8. I don't think I've ever paid this much before for two desserts. Totaling $30. I'd probably only go here on a special occasion or a once in a while type of thing. Also, when you get your receipt they expect you to tip 18% come on guys it's just dessert. Shouldn't expect too much =P just a heads up they get busy so it's hard to flag them down or get prompt service.
author: Diane L.

description: Good but not amazing. We had the matcha shaved ice, which comes with red bean, Mochi, and condensed milk. It's a *huge* bowl of green tea shaved ice, with a little red bean and two small pieces of Mochi. I think the dish would be better with more toppings. The red bean, while fresh and homemade, was made with kidney beans instead of adzuki beans. The dish was also very expensive. The presentation was nice, on wood trays with ceramic or wood bowls.
author: Alex M.

description: One of the best sit down dessert places in San Francisco. We ordered the thai tea crepe cake which was unlike any dessert I've tried. Really soft, layers of thin crepes stacked on top of each other. We also tried the volcano bingsoo(shaved creamy ice). It was great as well. Expect to wait atleast 20 minutes on a busy day. But I can assure you the wait will be worth it.
author: Ashish S.

description: Went here 2x in a week. Each time the restaurant was full with a 15min wait. Their cakes and their version of mango sticky rice is excellent! Huge portions and plenty of add one to enhance your flavors. Pastry chefs are prepping food as fast as possible and customer service is excellent. Only 2 drawback is their one restroom. Smells really bad and not so clean. The other is the limited parking.
author: Cee B.

description: The food looks aesthetically pleasing but the taste was mehhh...and don't think it was worth $12.
author: Priyanka S.

description: Great atmosphere, cute presentation and delicious desserts!  The Thai tea crepe cake was amazing! Will definitely come back
author: Elaine Z.

description: Really great food over at "Dessert Story" Would highly recommend this place for different varieties of meat! Great service along with it as well! Give them a chance!
author: Mark H.

description: My first time here. It was crowded and hot. They have small fans everywhere, but it gets really stuffy. The reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because 1 amazing waitress. I didnt get her name, but she was doing everything by herself yet made time to make sure my huge party (8 of us) we accommodated. I dumbly spilled my matcha latte all over the floor and she gave me a new one for free.  Parking sucks, but its san francisco so what'd you expect? But it's close to Castro and to mission Dolores you can literally walk from several bus stops. The mango dessert was amazing
author: Becky Mae A.

description: Heard so much hype about this little place on Mission and 16th Street.  Line is out the door for this place so best thing to do is reserve a time and you are seated right away.  The mangobingsoo was very delicious, highly recommend it. The crepe cakes were also yummy.  Will definitely recommend and return when we're in the area again. Ok
author: Ro A.

description:
Presentation 5/5

service 2/5 so slow .. waited 35min after getting seated and then we saw 2 other tables eating before us but they were seated after ours.. we were forgotten til I said something.. hard to get the attention of the waiters'.. clear shortage of them - only 2 for all the tables they had!!

taste 3/5 quality was there but they didn't nail the flavor. It tasted bland surprisingly !
author: YH L.

description: Thai tea crepe and mango sticky rice was good, but overall it was "allllrighhhht", more for the ig gram if anything.
author: Maellene D.

description: A new dessert place in SF. The chocolate lava cafe is very good.
author: Ha C.

description: Unique, delicious and simple! My new favorite SF dessert stop. The line was out the door for a good reason.
author: Anthony P.

description: desserts aren't overwhelmingly sweet. The shave ice comes with different toppings. worth going again!
author: Janice Y. W.

description: My sweet tooth is satisfied!!! Totally worth the wait!!! The ambiance is delightful  and I love the decor!!! If you like chocolate the Volcano Booingso is for you!! Yumm yumm yumm it's light shaved type fluffy ice. It's not too heavy of a dessert. the servings are perfect for sharing (kinda big). Do check this place out you won't be disappointed.
author: Nora F.

description:
Never heard of a dessert-centered store taking reservations -- but once we entered, I understood immediately. The scent of baking and sugar and fruit just entices all that pass through that door. It was delightful to be able to see the workers in the back actually construct your dessert.

We got three things, which totaled to $45:
- Mango Sticky Rice Bingsoo (Korean shaved ice): was kind of expecting more sticky rice but the other toppings provided were really nice! Gorgeous plating and the snow ice was super fine!
- Thai Tea Lava Honey Toast: when they said laval, they mean lava -- it was quite the show!! Definitely recommend for first timers. Honey toast is a classic and the little twist they added to it made it more desirable. My boyfriend had never tried honey toast before and he said afterwards that he could not find a dessert to compare to it.
- Plain Honey Toast (togo): the basics, served with condensed milk. Good even after we had taken it home!


Reason for four stars instead of five:
-- Unfortunately, the store is very small and slightly cramped but they make the best of the space. 
-- Getting seated was a pain. There's no instructions on where / how you are to line up, so I walked up to a waiter inquiring about seating for a group of three (we had no reservation) and they told us to wait outside until we were called in to be seated. Understandable. However, another group of three that came in after us did the same and were seated immediately even though they had no reservation. Huh?? I had to ask another waiter to make sure that we were seated next.
-- Service is also very abrupt; I understand that there are many customers and things are always coming out of the kitchen but when you are taking orders, please don't pounce on your customers words. We changed our minds twice as we were ordering and it seemed our waiter was counting down to a timer, just waiting to jump away. Not a very welcoming / calm ambiance.
-- Also, server to kitchen communication is poor: we asked for our last order to be in a togo box on THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS to THREE DIFFERENT WAITERS (just to make sure!) and it still arrived plated. We had to pack it ourselves.
author: Angelica N.

description: Once this place actually IF this place slows down I think it'll be a gem just a little cramped but worth the wait and the money for sure. All the shaved Ices are amazinggg
author: Valerie M.

description: Unique desert creations using Matcha and other Asian ingredients like Thai tea. Tried their Matcha Lava Chocolate Cake with Matcha ice cream and loved it. Great service. The only downside probably is their prices which are a bit high.
author: Sai Ram P.

description: So delicious. All the desserts are light and fluffy but still flavorful. My party tried the Thai tea crepe cake and mango bing soo both of which I would highly recommend. I can't wait to come back and try more. Decor is super cute as well.
author: Tian S.

description: These desserts are way too expensive! Sorry guys--but there is nothing on this menu that is affordable. My friend & I went tonight & all the dessert portions were too large & too pricey.  Cute restaurant but out of touch with the gig economy folks like me--new working class people.
author: Connie C.

description: We tried mango bingsoo and Thai crepe cake. The mango binsoo was delicately made with several add ons for different layers of flavor. Would recommend. The crepe cake was ok, personally like Lady M more . The desserts are pricey but it is higher quality.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This is my favourite dessert spot. Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu is the best. Highly recommend it.
author: Manmeet G.

description: AmmmmaZzing! Get the mango sticky rice shaved ice or the green tea, both to die for. Also, the presentation is next level beautiful. Great latte as well. 5 starts, keep up the great work ;)
author: William B.

description: We took a coconut pancake and it was not at all tasty. We also did not have a pleasant experience with the staff. They were giving tables for everyone but when we asked they said they were closed although they let few other customers in after closing hours. Left feeling ill treated.
author: Samhita R.

description:
Had the strawberry cheesecake yogurt kakigori  never had anything like it before and it was ABSOLUTELY DELIGHTFUL! 


What a great place !!!!
author: Rodney J.

description: Pretty restaurant--but too trendy, over-priced & pretentious. If you don't want to spend more than $10 for a small dessert--forget it. I went solo, hoping to have something they had advertised in the weeks before opening for 1 person, but no luck. The least expensive item would serve 4 people. What a waste of time & space. A colossal disappointment.
author: Scott F.

description: I have to cheer up a high quality dessert cafe in the Bay Area. I am not sure if others can tell a difference on desserts made by low quality vs high quality ingredients. I appreciate the details that they have done for the desserts. Young coconut Pandan Crepes cake (real young coconut meat sauce), Thai Lava Honey Toast (homemade Thai tea ice cream with very strong tea favoring. I guess the ice cream is homemade? If not, they must have done a good job searching for good supplier), Mango Sticky Rice Shaved Ice (this reminds what I had in Bangkok, excellent job). I saw one other reviewer said this place is overpriced. But I think this place is very reasonable priced for the presentation , atmosphere, and quality of food. I will not pay a penny on a piece of over-sweeten junk with artificial favoring, but I am happy to pay $12 for a piece of art with real quality ingredients. Good job and keep the good quality, we will be back with more friends.
author: Miu T.

description: Service was great! I definitely love their desserts! I will highly recommend Coconut Pandan Crepe Cake. It's very tasty and not too sweet. Mango Bingsu is a must for mango lover.
author: Snow H.

description: Long line when you go here with an interesting selection of desserts. Small place and friendly service.
author: M L.

description: I thought the dessert was good but a little too sweet for my liking. Prices are kinda pricey too, and it is difficult to find street parking.
author: Luffy L.

description:
Found this cute, trendy place on Yelp.  It's a great place to hang with friends, but I'd recommend bringing a small to medium-sized group as U :Dessert Story is a cozier place with less space to walk.  My family and I ordered the Cheese Oolong Tea, apricot peach tea, a glass of hot water, a chocolate matcha lave cake, and a mango sticky rice bingsu (bing su is a Korean finely shaved ice dessert).  As far as beverages go, the teas were unique & good, but, personal opinion, we're not fans.  The apricot peach tea we found too sweet; it was supposed to be hot, but came out "cool"/room temp.  I ordered a simple glass of hot water, but it came in a mason jar with a handle; water stayed hot, but I would suggest the water be in a different container other than a mason jar so diners would have an easier time handling hot liquids.  The cheese tea was different, but my mom preferred otherwise (nothing personal toward the restaurant).

As for the desserts itself, we all loved the chocolate matcha lava cake (which includes matcha green tea ice cream) & the mango sticky rice bingsu.  Just the right amount of sweetness, and both definitely IG-worthy!  Picture the viscous, green, matcha lava flowing from the smooth chocolate cake...mmm... Our personal favorite was the bingsu; finely shaved ice with sweet mango cubes, and you are given a variety of toppings: cluster of almond (I think?), coconut sticky rice, mango sauce, and condensed milk.
