Newly opened by the owners of Kitchen Story, and it's 4 stars in our books (3 hand clap emojis)!  Do I recommend?  Yes!  Would I give it a return trip?  Yes!
author: Jessica S.

description: I decided to give this place a try today because my friends recommended. We got there around 4 pm and it's a weekday so it wasn't crowded which was good! After we sat and browsed the menu, I thought they are quite pricey but given that they are located in SF, I'm  not surprised. We decided to try coconut crepe cake, chocolate matcha lava cake and matcha float. Coconut crepe cake was fresh, soft, moist and not overly sweet. One of my friends doesn't really like coconut but she actually enjoyed it! The lava cake was dense and you can really taste the matcha flavor! The chocolate cake on its own though was a bit bitter but it made a perfect combination with green tea ice cream. Matcha float was really good as well. It was smooth, not overly sweet and doesnt have the thick consistency. Overall, I like everything we ordered and would definitely come back for more!
author: Chantanee W.

description: The espresso matcha latte is legit and I only need half a cup of it. The first time I drank it all, I was intensely jittery. The mango dessert is amazing especially on a hot day.
author: J. L.

description: Only been here once, but I plan of coming back even more! When I came here with my boyfriend, he and I shared the Thai tea honey toast and it was literally the best honey toast I've tried in my life! I can't wait to come back again.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Absolutely beautiful interior and dessert presentation. The Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu and Matcha Lava Cake were a bit pricey, but tasted pretty good.
author: Vivian C.

description: I can eat the mango sticky rice bingsu EVERYDAY! Not too sweet and just the right amount fruits. Presentation is immaculate and the option for extra mango syrup/condensed milk is a nice touch. To top it all off, the staff is attentive, wonderfully warm, and super helpful. I can't wait to go b
author: Wing Man C.

description: Good food and drinks to eat and the server is very nice. Also very nice place to hang out, really enjoyed  it and I recommend other people to try it out if you haven't.
author: Huong Q.

description: The lava cake was okay, the earl grey crepe cake was bad. Neither was worth the price. Service was bad, they kicked us out after we finished eating to seat the next group.
author: S J.

description: As you are looking from the outside, it may seem small, but there are actually a lot of seats inside (When it isn't busy). After reading all of the positive reviews, I just had to try this place. First time I came  here the place was packed, but was able to be seated within 5 minutes (8pm Monday Night). Didn't really have to wait too long for the food. I really recommend the Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu and the Mango Sticky Rice Toast as they were my favorite out of all the desserts I've tried (They were also the most worth for the price) The matcha Lava Cake was also good, but I think that people looking for something not too sweet will like it. Strawberry Cheesecake Yogurt Kakigori was also good, but the mango one is hands down my fav. The Thai Tea Lava Toast was the least favorite as it had an unfamiliar Thai Tea flavor. I'm giving a 5/5 because I enjoyed everything, but a 4/5 for the overprice for the smaller portioned desserts (Matcha Lava Cake/ Crepe Cakes). Overall everything was excellent including the presentation, the food, and the service. I actually came again the next day and had the same great experience! I highly recommend this place for people looking for aesthetic desserts!!!
author: Kristofer P.

description:
Being as I just got back from a trip I decided to go last night and get a feel of what this hot spot is all about and give my support. First and foremost, if you're looking for inexpensive desserts..this most definitely is not the place. I knew this beforehand that the pricing wasn't in the normal range. Display of the desserts were cute and high end looking so I'm taking it as that's the reason why the price is in the higher range.  

Onto the actual desserts. I ordered the mango bingsu and coconut pandan crepe. Yes, again the display is nice. But that pretty much is it for me. I'm a big fan of desserts and have had my fair share in SF. WOW factor is not there for me and rather just impassive to be quite honest. The overall taste was not bad, it's just not there for me. I feel they can do a lot better especially for the price range.

Another thing I would like to point out is how the shop is run. Being as they are super busy, they really need to have someone up front taking down names to reserve a spot. I saw a worker walking around with a clipboard and calling out the next group so I thought the waiter would come and take down names of the new faces that walked in. In this case that wasn't the ordeal. A lot of people stood, waited and were kept confused on what they were supposed to be doing and I was one of them. I feel they really need to be on top of those who come in and have no clue if they have to wait for someone to acknowledge them or what.
author: Ann S.

description: Dessert $12-$15????? Over priced! All I can say about this place is EXPENSIVE deserving no reasons. Not coming back!
author: Ahnokin A.

description: Brought my twin 6 year old boys here today and had no idea what to expect. We ordered two of the snow ice (mango and strawberry cheesecake) and were expecting these small little bowls of some frozen ice with flavored syrup. So yes, I didn't look on Yelp before ordering, otherwise I'd have known what we were in store for. Total shock when they brought out the first PLATTER of yumminess. The snow was so cool (pun somewhat intended) and yummy and the fruits, etc, so playful and worked perfectly to enhance each flavor. We will be coming back for sure! Must try the other adventures that await!! The AstroTurf on the wall and lattice accents could go, but small price to pay!
author: Chris S.

description: Gorgeous desserts. Kinda crowded at night but still worth it. I went with my bf and the wait was around 30-40 minutes long before getting seated. The interior is pretty with a modern and hip vibe. The food is served on wooden trunk with dried roses.
author: Regina T.

description: Nice place and gentle staff here. I will came again and agin. I like such customer service. 5 stars!
author: Tenzin C.

description: This place is super cute, i love the theme of the shop. I also love how they treated it kind of as a restaurant style instead of just having to stand in lone and ordering. The people that worked there were super helpful and nice and checked up on us multiple times. We ordered cheese tea and the fondue and everything was served beautifully and tasted amazing!
author: Viviana R.

description: Loved the dessert we ordered. The mango with sticky rice &  crushed ice. The chocolate cake , not so much. Great concept. Very unique. I'm so glad we found this place. We went on a weekend and the line was very long. There is very limited space too.
author: CC R.

description: Finally decided to try this place out since I've been seeing it everywhere on social media! Located right next to kitchen story. Parking may be difficult depending on the time of the day. Luckily we found a parking spot right outside of this school! When we walked in there was a mini line forming already at 8pm. To be honest I think they should just let people write their names on a board because the inside isn't really big and the line was blocking the restroom entrance. We were seated in 5 min because there was a group of 4 in front of us. I wouldn't recommend coming here with a big group unless you go in early. I knew exactly what I wanted and we ordered right away. We got the mango bingsuu, matcha lava cake, and lastly Thai tea crepe cake. I thought everything was pretty good but not outstanding. The Thai tea crepe cake was lacking in flavor unless you pour a lot of Thai tea sauce on it which is on the side for you to pour. Even one slice of lady m crepe cake cost about 8$ and this place charges like $12 per slice which is ridiculous LOL. Definitely give this place a try if you're in the area. I thought this place was way too pricey because 3 dessert cost us $40.
author: Tina C.

description: One must really bring friends to share the large desserts  My earl grey honey lavender cake was pleasing to the eye and not overly sweet. I want to try the mango bingsoo next time!
author: S L.

description: Overpriced, really overpriced place. Pretending to be fancy but spoons are dirty and wooden cracked plates has strong musty smell. No funny. I ordered a slice of crepe cake and coffee and when I started to eat it I felt disgusting smell, first I thought that somebody is peeing on a street and the smell comes from the open door! But hell no, it was stinky plate! Then the waiter came and asked if everything was ok and I told him that plate is stinky and it was disgusting to eat , but all that he did was just "ok" and took the plate away. 20$ for coffee and a slice on musty plate!
author: Audrey T.

description:
This place totally sucked for us. Both service and food - WON'T BE BACK! 

We were excited about our first visit. We waited in line for about 30-40 minutes for a seat to check out the hype. No tables, so we got crammed into a corner at the counter by the window. Fine, they're crowded. We ordered the mango bingsoo, the thai tea crepe cake, and coconut pandan crepe cake. We waited about 45 minutes to get our food. The people who were seated right before us were finished and leaving while we still waited for our food. The server even came by 3 times and kept asking if we got our food - and all 3 times, we said "no, still waiting". All we got was a glass of tea which cost $5. We thought at least the tea would be good, but no. It's was just regular. Finally we gave up. We asked for the crepe cakes to go and cancelled the mango shaved ice. Total bill was $36. 2 cakes and a glass of tea. No one even said sorry about the wait or messing up the order. No comps or anything for the inconvenience. It was a huge waste of our time.

We got home and tasted the crepe cakes - both were terrible. I can't even describe it. It was bland, no real consistency, the thai tea sauce was ok, but not that tasty. The coconut crepe cake was also bland and gross. What an utter disappointment!  We went to Paris Baguette to get our cake fix instead. Then headed to k-town couple days later for the REAL bingsoo. k-town bingsoo seriously cannot be beat. This place tries to copy - no dice.

Sorry. will NOT be back, or recommend to ANYONE. Ever.
author: jjill a.

description: Everything was so good!! We got matcha lava cake(get it), matcha kakigori (get it), and thai tea crepe (Not my favorite - but my friends loved it). If you're craving good rich matcha the ice sure does satisfy! I loved dipping the matcha sauce it comes. It enhanced the matcha even more!! Loved the bitterness! Will come back again if I want some quality dessert~~
author: Nick Z.

description: Love this dessert place! It has my favorite matcha crepes. The customer service was also very great.
author: Alvie K.

description:
U-Dessert is a new trendy dessert place in SF. The place was officially opened yesterday. The atmosphere inside the place is a friendly and welcoming. The design of the place is contemporary look with a mix of natural scenes.

Everything looks so good here. Thai crepe cake is one of my favorite so far. I could feel a perfect taste from a first bite. I also got to try earl grey cheese tea that is pretty tasty. Cheese tea has two layers; mascarpone and tea. 

Overall, this place is amazing. I will definitely try all of their items in the menu!
author: Supinit P.

description: Come. On. $12-14 for small portions or toast? These are ridiculous prices, kind of everything that's wrong with the city these days.
author: Daniel B.

description: Absolutely love this place. All of the bingsus are top notch and the Pandan cake is excellent as well. Definitely one of the top asian dessert places in the city. And to add on top of the that, the service is great too. Went here for a friends birthday, and then mine a couple of weeks later, and both times the servers were nice, fun and really engaging. The only drawbacks from this place is that there is almost always a long line (but I guess it can't be helped) and the fact that both times I went it was crazy hot inside, but other than that I have no complaints
author: Tyler C.

description: Recommend the bingsoo (mango is good) but not the crepe layer cake. Not worth $12 for that tiny slice. Cafe is small and cramped, there's usually a line. Open late, which is nice
author: Teresa Z.

description: My partner and I are both absolutely in love with U Dessert Story. The Mango Bingsu was absolutely amazing. It comes with a mini side of condensed milk, WARM sticky rice and mango puréed. It was delicious. As for the price, I think it is well worth it considering the portion you get and the time and effort put into presentation. The atmosphere can be a little loud but the decor is soo relaxing with succulents. Next time, we will try crepe cake. The service is very quick in my opinion and they are so kind. Definitely will be back!
author: Karen T.

description: Dessert is not that good and too pricy, not worth it. decoration looks nice (one star for the decoration)  but customer services need lots of improvement. Didn't finish my sentence asking a question, the server gave me an annoying face and did not even answer the question and left. I know you are busy, but what kind of customer service you provided? And wound not go another time. U:dessert Not deserved
author: Jiayi Anna Y.

description: I was expecting a different atmosphere based on the yelp reviews.  It was really crowded and mosdef not a place to take IG pics; tables were very close as well.  The drinks were REALLY expensive, I think the cheapest thing was regular tea (tea bag) for $5.50....u can get a large boba from boba guys for that price!  My friend and I over-ordered and waitress didn't tell us.  We ordered the coconut pandan cake, the mango snow ice, and the Thai tea toast.  The coconut pandan cake is pre-made and was decent, but nothing special and I wouldn't order again.  The mango snow ice was huge, but not amazing in terms of flavor.  The Thai tea toast was wonderful, but they put the Thai tea ice cream inside the toast so it was already pretty melted when it arrived and within 5 mins the sauce was soggy mess.  But it was really good. The table next to us ordered before we even sat down and the servers brought our food first and they were pissed and freaking out bc they ordered some of the same things...and angrily stared at us while we ate.  Server forgot to put their order in, so a little disorganized and you have to flag staff down to order.  I'd go back for the Thai tea toast in a couple of months to give them time to improve service and flow.
author: Kevin M.
